Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 built in 1970s and. Never renevated...”
Reviews.Author: Angela K
Reviews.Content: Initially driving up we were kinda scared. It is a very old outdated and termite invested. This place needs a major uplift. The pool isn't very nice, the rooms are outdated, the bathroom was dirty, but it was cheap. So if you trying to save money I guess it's okay, but would not recommend it to anyone. The staff was super nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Low Cost Quiet Hawiian Home.”
Reviews.Author: Art F
Reviews.Content: This place ROCKS! Staff is excellent, It has Large but oudated rooms, its a Hawiian cottage. Pool is great, grounds are clean and spacious, Did I mention the Staff are superb? Ya they are. If you are a pompous type, then go pay $800 a night, but if you are only using the room to sleep in, then this is your place to stay. Cheap, really quiet, no crowds, clean and quiet beach and away from the crowds. The Luau is awesome and cheap, Bring your own booze. Sunsets from the beach are stunning. It is centrally located to all the attractions. NO BUGS anywhere. I suggest you rent a car from Kihei Car rentals, older cars but cheap. You need wheels to see the entire Island of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Going back 10 years later!”
Reviews.Author: Dionberry
Reviews.Content: My wife and i actually got married on the grounds of The Maui Lu 10 years ago next month. We had a beautiful ceremony and the hotel helped in any way they could. We took up quite a few rooms so we got to see the entire range of rooms. Obviously the oceanside loft was fantastic. Beautiful views of the sunset, vaulted ceilings, Sand steps from our door. Even wales viewable from the balcony! The other two rooms i was in were exactly as stated and well worth the room rate. Although one of them did have a pretty bad view (a wall), the hotel staff was notified and the situation was corrected immediately. My point here is if you are unhappy about your accommodations, don't wait till you get home to write a bad review of the hotel. Ask the staff to correct the situation. I find it hard to believe that you will not be satisfied with the service. The grounds were amazing! Well maintained and very open. The beach was small but beautiful and private. We were able to snorkel right there in front of our room which was a bonus for me! So here we are 10 years later and are booking at the Maui Lu again. We cannot wait to go back and i am sure our experience will be fantastic. Of course a review will follow after our trip also. For all the people complaining about this hotel, i want you to understand that this place plays a vital roll for some families. It offers regular families the ability to get good accommodations on one of the most beautiful places on earth. This hotel is not perfect and they do not claim to be. On a budget this is the best deal on Maui in my opinion. Save the $300 resort fees and go explore Maui with the extra cash!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Value Oriented”
Reviews.Author: RenesisS2
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Maui Lu does exactly what it's 2 star rating implies. The service is very good, any issues we had (there were a couple, which I will address) were taken care of quickly and without any off-hand remarks. The rooms aren't anything to write home about, but they are more then adequate to handle a week or two vacation. As for the issues we had, we originally booked a single king room, but got put into a double queen room. We called about 5 minutes after we got into the room and realized the mistake, and they told us they were booked for the night and to call back in the morning. We did, and they had us in the correct room by that afternoon. There is a laundry facility on site, which is nice if you have a family or are on a longer trip, but the facility isn't kept up as well as it should be. There are three washing machines and three dryers. One of the washing machines was out of order, and two of the dryers had full change containers, meaning they were inoperable. Also, the Tide and Bounce dispensers were empty and apparently had not been checked in some time. We addressed this with the front desk and they had someone there to get us what we needed, but the appliances couldn't be taken care of on the spot (the facility they were rented from must take care of them personally). The location is good, about 30 minutes from Kahului Airport and 45 minutes (with traffic) from Lahaina. If you are planning on going to the Hana side of the island, it will take a bit of time, but other than that no complaints. Shopping and dinning can be found 5 or so minutes to the south. You can get to the Shops at Wailea (outdoor mall) in about 15 minutes. The rooms are run-of-the-mill and not memorable. They are somewhat dated, but clean and easy to move around in. The closet isn't huge, but should suffice for a few "must hang" items. The bathroom is somewhat small, but two people can get ready at the same time with minimal elbow bumping. The only huge issue we ran into was the shower. The regulator was apparently no longer working, and the shower would jump between hot and cold very quickly. Anytime there was a change in water pressure anywhere in the building, the temperature would jump one direction or the other. Nothing could be done, so we had to live with it. If you are planning on staying in South Kihei and you aren't worried about having a 4 or 5 star resort to crash at, the Maui Lu is a good bet. If you are more interested in creature comforts and details, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Value priced option in Kihei”
Reviews.Author: EWLM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our condo was ready. It was very reasonably priced, however you get what you pay for. The motel style room was relatively clean but quite dated. The grounds are beautiful including the pool (if you ignore the condemned buildings). Just a short walk across the street to the beach. Wouldn't recommend a long stay at this hotel but adequate for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place”
Reviews.Author: manmey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Lu in an oceanfront room. The view and sunsets from the balcony were spectacular, you can even see whales off in the distance!! The bed and pillows were the most comfortable of all the hotels I ever stayed at...slept so good after a long day of snorkeling and sight seeing!! the location is perfect for all the west coast beaches. We just loved the private little beach cove in the afternoons after going snorkeling from beaches that had tons of people. The rooms are very clean and the grounds of the hotel are beautiful!! The staff was super friendly and helpful! I'm sure we will go back to Maui and when we do, we will definitely stay here again...we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: TrishaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We went January 27th 2012- February 3rd 2012 and had a wonderful time. The room is older but we knew that going in from the reviews we had read. If you are expecting a five star then this is not the place for you. We stayed on the oceanview and loved the private beach. The staff is always helpful and friendly. I have already recommended this hotel to others planning on going to Maui in the future. It is a great budget hotel and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: shlobb13
Reviews.Content: the grounds are well kept and the staff is super nice and helpfull. we did have ants in our room and the pool area has realy annoying flys, but then again, if you're in hawaii you really shouldnt be at a pool.

Reviews.Title: “adequate but..”
Reviews.Author: 2justbreathe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and just fine but I have a problem paying an amenity fee for parking and replenishing the coffee and sugar. Ok, you also get a newspaper. My real problem was that they charged my card for this and the taxes separate from the room charge and on a different day. Maui is so expensive. Guess I was just sticker shocked...but it is an old place that needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: luvholidays210
Reviews.Content: First of all I will state the few good things about this hotel, lovely pool area and beautiful green lawns and palm trees. Free wifi in rooms and thru out whole property is very reliable. Now for the bad points : No restaurant at hotel and nearest shops and restaurants are an hours walk away. If you want to catch a bus they run hourly so try doing that three times a day. Hotel is very isolated so if you don't have a hire car which now I know you really need on Maui you will have to catch buses everywhere which can be very time consuming. Front desk staff were not very friendly and didn't give any information about the hotel on checkin. We had to drag our suitcases up and down a hill to get to our room and we weren't offered a luggage trolley which I thought they must not have but I noticed later they did. Rooms are very old and extremely musty smelling. They are quite run down with old loover windows, archaic air conditioners that are very very loud at night time. If we were not able to hire a scooter to get us back and forth for meals I definitely would have checked in to another hotel in a better area no matter how much money I lost. I wouldn't recommend this hotel or location to anyone . We spent a day at a lovely town called Lahaina where I would loved to have stayed and would recomend.I'm not a fussy person and this is the first hotel I've stayed at and have really disliked so do yourself a favor and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “shabby & run down”
Reviews.Author: Shelley M
Reviews.Content: We were sent to the Maui Lu by the Maui Banyan. We had a confirmed reservation for the night at the Banyan but that didn't mean much as they had no space for us. They made a big deal about securing accomodation at their "sister" hotel, the Maui Lu, implying it was a decent place. The Lu is located far from the main area of Kihei which might appeal to some. The grounds were lovely & green but that is about it for the positive aspects of the resort. The room we were given had an overwhelming odour of chlorine - not at all near the pool - and was dark & gloomy. The carpet was very dirty with stains and the mattress & box spring were stained on the sides as well. The air conditioner was old, noisy and dirty. The beds were of the lowest quality & were very uncomfortable. Overall, we would never recomment this hotel - if there had been any other place available, we would have left immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Hawaiian Resort”
Reviews.Author: 96Roadking
Reviews.Content: The Maui Lu is not a new resort, but it is an authentic Hawaiian resort the way they use to be. Its only two stories tall. We had an upstairs corner duplex room with sweeping views of the ocean and their private beach. The views were beautiful. The trade winds would shift in the afternoon and we would get these beautiful breezes. The Mauai Lu is located on the south side of Mauai, which is the sunny side. We didn't know this when we booked our stay. Everyday the weather was sunny and perfect. They do not have a restaurant but there are plenty of very good local restaurants within a short drive from the resort. It is a very quiet resort, which we liked. The pool was never crowded. There were times we were the only ones using it. The pool is shaped like the island of Mauai. The grounds are well maintained with different colored hibiscus' growing everywhere along with plenty of palm trees. The resort is approx . 1/2 hr ride from Lahaina which is a great sightseeing town for shopping and eating. It was a whaling village at one time and the town holds a lot of history. I would definitely stay at the Mauai Lu again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: deezeee2
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Maui Lu. Skip it, find another place to stay. Old and worn-out. Uncomfortable beds. Scratchy sheets and towels. They charged $30.00 a night for a third adult in the room, but only provided 2 sets of towels. When we asked for more, they gave us grief. (We finally got the towels.) The â€œContinental Breakfastâ€� for the first morning was a joke --- a few grocery-store mini muffins and a little bit of sliced watermelon, juice and coffee. Everything ran out before we arrived (right on time!), and the food & drinks were never replenished. The grounds were nice, with lots of grassy areas, nicely trimmed hedges and lots of coconut and papaya trees. Easy walking distance to the beach; a good walking beach and the water wasnâ€™t great for swimming (churned up so the water is brown) but I did see some people having fun in the water.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: judylamb
Reviews.Content: Altough an old hotel this was fabulous, had an ocean view room with private beach for the hotel. The pool was large and so quiet sometimes we were the only ones in. The only drawback was no restaurant and although we did have a fridge in our room that was all. Rooms were spacious with balconies overlooking the ocean. Staff was most accommodating, We got bus passes and travelled to the town on the local bus, fun but returnung home after dark was dicey as there were few streetlights and a very busy highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: tothelimit
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and the hotel location was great! Check in and out was smooth and our room was just fine. It was nice and big, great shower pressure though sometimes the water got cold for a second or two. The bed was OK and the pillows a little on the flat side - double up. The fridge was a nice size and it was handy to have a room safe. We watched a free movie on our last night...good selection of titles. If you are looking for a resort with lots of activities, then keep looking. But if you are in Maui to hike, snorkel, drive, kayak, whale watch, beach comb and shop like we were and you'd rather spend your money on those things, the Aston Maui Lu fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Please tear down this resort”
Reviews.Author: Diverguy72
Reviews.Content: Oh god where do i start, the cockroaches, extreamly dirty carpets, dirty pool, or other condemned building on property. This resort it for the cheap travellers that dont want to spend the extra money for a decent place. We booked for 2 nights while waiting for another resort. We didnt even stay the 2nd night because it was so discusting. Im not a picky person while travelling but this place is extreme. While talking with few locals i was told that the owners plans are to let the resort get into such a decreped state to justify tearing the resort down. Looks like they are 2/3 there.

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, not to shops...”
Reviews.Author: gherks
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu was a good resort with good facilities but it was just a bit far from places to eat & shop if you haven't got a car. The staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival and throughout our stay and the conceierge desk was good who organised for us to see the Luau and also suggested several good palces to visit and how to get around (as we didn't have a car). The rooms at the Maui Lu like many other resorts are a little dated and tired looking. They look like they are from the 80's and in some cases a bit of maintenance was needed to walls, doors etc. where it was clear there was some unrepaired damage. In saying that though the rooms were kept very clean and were comfortable. The reosrt itself was great with a very nice pool and plenty of facilities including FREE Wi Fi and other internet access computers, vending machines for snacks & drinks as well as a lounge area to store our bags on check out and relax whilst waiting for a taxi. The gardens were immaculate and very well maintained. As I mentioned this is very close to the beach, from our room it was about a 2 minute walk across the road to the Kihei Beach. The downside was the shops and eating places were about a 20 minute walk which meant each time you had to allow for that or consider a taxi. Once in Kihei though there was plenty of places including fast food, cafes and some restaurants. There is also a supermarket, drug store and plenty of other stores. Buses do run along the main road past the resort but are only every hour so you need to time it right (concierge had timetables). Buses are cheap at $2 for an all day unlimited ticket. Overall we had a good time at the Aston Maui Lu and would recommend this place but whilst on Maui I recommend hiring a car.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: misskris8
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed here on January 11, 2012 for one night. I was a bit nervous about it because of the reviews on this site, however we thought we would give it a try. The resort is really spread out. We checked in at night and had to find our way across the street where the ocean front rooms were. We missed the turn because there was no signage. When we checked out in the morning, we noticed abandoned buildings on the property, which wasnt very nice to look at. The room was just okay. I am glad we got the ocean front room because it was nice waking up and looking out on the water. We were on the 2nd floor and the walk leading up to the room wasnt very appealing. The air conditioners were old and leaking and needed a good clean and fix. Inside the room, the ceilings were nice and high. The furniture needed some refinishing and the carpets could use some washing to rid them of the musty smell. Everything else in the room was just okay, nothing special. If you are used to staying in cheaper motels, then this room would be okay. If you are expecting something really nice, this isnt it. It isnt terrible or anything,Ask it's just okay. One annoyance I had was that they charged me for one night and a deposit of one night so I got a $400 charge before even getting there. When I checked out, they gave me the deposit back.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: travelbeat1955
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fuzzy traveller and enjoy a 'bargain' on rooms and attractions, therefore the Aston Maui Lu Resort fulfilled my needs to put my head down on a (clean) pillow. It's a bit far from most shopping malls and hang-outs in Kihei, but you might need a car anyway to get around. Room was clean, not shabby but certainly ready for a renovation. Pool was clean and inviting. If you have a slim budget that's a hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: I may be exaggerating on the title because I haven't stayed at EVERY hotel on Maui, but as a frequent visitor this has been the worst of over a dozen. Certainly, this is the worst hotel in Kihei. The staff refused to give me a military rate despite being on active duty orders to attend a conference -- how patriotic. There are NO amenities here (despite the $10/day charge) and the continental breakfast requires a presentation on local businesses (like a time-share presentation payed for by the businesses I'm sure). The room was filthy (not just dirty). I would avoid this hotel like the plague (which you might catch if you stay there).

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: jilloutlaw
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days in this hotel over new year 2010/11. When we arrived we decided to upgrade to an ocean view room,it was absolutely lovely spacious clean and right on the ocean couldnt ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Tula T
Reviews.Content: The Maui Lu is located center to the drive to Wailea or the drive to Kapalua. It is near all the favorite hubs and restaurants in Kihei and a post office too are all within walking distance. The staff is Great! The rooms are spacious, bed comfortable, and lounge in room was nice too.If you are active you will not be spending too much time in them. They were a nice haven after a full day. The pool was nice and refreshing and the ground crew took so pride pride in their property. They have a treasure chest of water toys and products that quest are able to borrow with out a fee that was nice. We actually used a few for our snorkeling. The beach is directly across the street also with in a short walk. All around a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: bschwizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 608 which was oceanview. The Good 1. Cheap 2. Amazing ocean view if you get oceanview or oceanfront 3. Small private beach and more public beaches on both sides 4. Friendly staff 5. Clean rooms 6. Nice pool 7. BBQs for free use to guests 8. Good overall proximity to other attractions on Maui The Bad 1. 2 Star. Don't expect a 5 star. 2. Some rooms are a little older. Air conditioner was a little bit noisy, wooden furniture looked fairly worn. Some small fruit fly bugs in bathroom. I had read the reviews on this hotel before we decided to book. There were a lot of really good and really bad reviews so it was hard to decide. In the end, we decided to do it because the customer service appeared good based on the reviews, meanin that the people who had problems with their rooms were taken care of as best as possible. In the end, we were glad we stayed here. The ocean view and sunsets were amazing in our unit and the beaches were nice. There are even nicer beaches also a short drive away. We had free dvd rentals too although i'm not sure if this may have been because of the length of our stay. We spent most of our time exploring Maui and mostly just wanted a place to sleep and shower.

Reviews.Title: “1/4 star hotel AT BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skimowoman
Reviews.Content: Cancelled 20 days in advance... THANK GOODNESS!!!!! They kept 2 rooms and 2 nights= costly... Non refundable!! I drove just to see if reviews were true. YEUUUPPP!! Don't waste your money. I hope they used the donation wisely, as that is the only $ they will ever recive. Didnt even want to enter..so I DIDN'T LEAVE THE CAR. The view of it and the reviews here we enough. So, I didn't brave to enter. Even my kids said NO WE BETTER NOT BE SLEEPING HERE!!! I don't think there would be enough soap and water to feel clean after. Save your $. Gross sorry

Reviews.Title: “Well managed, friendly staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi-Ryan
Reviews.Content: My husband, and 2 kids stayed here for 2 nights and had a great experience. Although it is not new and modern (i.e., you still get a hard key), the rooms are a good size, the grounds well managed and the pool is quite large. The staff were all very friendly and professional. We thought the amenities were fantastic especially when my kids were 'beached out'- the $10 resort fee, which I thought was quite reasonable, covered free wifi (that worked!), unlimited DVD and playstation rental- my kids couldn't get enough of that. Ample free parking was a plus and it is located near lots of other hotels, and within driving distance to lots of grocery stores, shops and other hotels. Our room was ok- nothing exciting, but clean, good-sized and the water pressure in the bathroom was really strong. The rooms also have a refrigerator. We also had a small back lanai with a small table and 2 chairs. The beach was just across the street. If you stay here, you MUST do the Polynesian Luau- another review under things to do, but very well done. On the day we left, you are able to reserve the hospitality suite for a 2 hr. block, so we were able to refresh/repack in the late afternoon- I thought that was a really nice service. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience to Start the New Year!”
Reviews.Author: Kanamama
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked last minute rooms at the Maui Lu to celebrate the new year to go bar hopping in Kihei. When we arrived, we were late for a show and the front desk worked as hard as they could to get us a taxi on this busy night. Their manage upgraded us to oceanfront rooms because we both serve in the US Military. Later in the evening, still looking for a taxi, we were stuck in the hotel room trying to get to our next destination. Taxis were booked for the night and there were no other transportation. The hotel manager called to check up on the hotel during the night and the workers were stressed trying to find taxis for everyone. The manager left her family on New Years Eve, and gave us a ride to our next destination there in Kihei, because we were stuck. Talk about going above and beyond! We had the greatest New Year celebration thanks to her!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's the price that makes it worthwile”
Reviews.Author: karen1monger
Reviews.Content: We like no frills hotels. Our family mostly needs a bed for the night and a bathroom to be happy. The rooms were rather roomy, even with 2 beds. Beds pretty firm. Mini fridge and coffee maker in room. I did hate the carpets, it made everything feel musty, and must be a pain to clean. Ask for an upper story room, for more privacy on your lanai, and the ability to sleep with the door open to the night air. The air conditioner is incredibly loud, but at least it drowned out the teenagers in the room next to us playing video games all night at maximum volume. The whole property is a bit worn. The pool is fine, not sure it is heated, though. The pool house/housekeeping area is very worn, keep out unless you need towels. The grounds are pleasant and well kept. Landscaping is nice, plenty of birds flying around, and a few cats. It appears there is a building that was once part of the complex that has been left to rot right next door. Keep your nosy kids out of there, it looks dangerous and should be torn down. The front desk personnel are super friendly and helpful. We had an opportunity to peek into some ocean-front rooms, and they were updated and nice. They had tile floors, and lovely lanais. The tiny beach across the street is cute and swimmable. We chose to keep our garden-view room since the parking at the ocean-front rooms is terrible. This property is in a good central location for driving around the island. If you just need a bed and shower, this place will fit the bill without a large credit card bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price!”
Reviews.Author: avz156
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this resort and can't say a bad thing about it. Definitely stay waterfront though, it is beautiful to sit out on the patio and enjoy the sunset! The rooms aren't 5 star luxury at all, but they are nice and clean. The location is great too; close to shopping and restaurants. You cannot get a better deal on Maui for the quality and the view. I look forward to coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “COCKROACH IN THE BED!”
Reviews.Author: iliveinchicago_2
Reviews.Content: This was our 12th or 14th time on Maui (lost count) so we are aware that in a tropical climate, cockroaches are sometimes part of the landscape. However, to find one crawling in our bed as we pulled back the covers is just unacceptable. That's what we found in our bed at the Maui Lu! On this particular trip, we rented a condo in Kapalua but wanted to spend one night in Kihei during our trip. It was also my birthday and my favorite restaurant is in Kihei so we thought it would be fun to pack a bag and party it up in Kihei for my birthday. We used Priceline and ended up with a room at the Maui Lu. After a fun night in Kihei, we returned back to our room, pulled back the sheets and crawling under the cover was a cockroach! My wife screamed, we packed our bags and drove the 45 minutes back to Kapalua. Thank goodness the drinking had worn off and we had the option of another place to sleep. Beware of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hawaii feeling, large rooms, nice surroundings, must have car”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth123
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aston Maui Lu Resort back in January 2009. We had a great time. We booked it as the cheapest option at that time, but we were pleasantly surprised. We were 27 and 32 y at that time travelling without children. Very large and clean rooms, though a bit dated. Old Hawaii feeling. Nice and very local surroundings. A lot of friendly cats were on the property. You need a car to stay here, everything is in driving distance. We had our breakfast on the beach in front of the resort (not suitable for swimming, big waves here) but we enjoyed the view and saw unforgettable sights of whales jumping. Must seeâ€™s on Maui: Road to Hana, Big beach (have fish tacos here) and the volcano Haleakala in the early morning. Go for a cheap option and don't expect much - but to have a large room and a perfect starting point to drive around Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: saylesernest
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here,,,,,We stayed garden view,,,,dont was your money on there ocean view,,,you can go to the beach accross the road,,,,very quite beach,,,,,the rooms are old but clean,,,somewhat,,,,,they do have loud music at night,,,,we didnt mind it,,,all in all,,,try it,,,,

Reviews.Title: “book an ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: helena r
Reviews.Content: this place is a little run down by the looks of things and can really use a renovation. What made us get past the dated look was the excellent location of their ocean front rooms! Your room is right on the beach, and for the price, you can't ask for much more. We enjoyed sipping drinks and watching the amazing sunsets and stolling on the beach at night. The staff were very friendly and we enjoyed our stay. We chose this place based on our plan to dive at Molokini Crater which worked out very convenient because the Maui Dive shop arranged to pick us up and drop us off from the hotel. Also, the beds are smaller than most places.

Reviews.Title: “not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: SAmeiKC
Reviews.Content: I was aware that this is a 2-star hotel, but maybe it's because of all the glory reviews that gave me the impression that this must be a hotel better than 2-star. I was wrong. This is exactly a motel with old buildings and furniture. Our first room was a garden-view room, and had a strong mold smell when we first entered. It has 2 full size beds, and my fiancee is 6 feet tall and his legs were hanging outside of the bed when lying down. I called the front desk, who were very quick to give us a queen size bed room with an ocean view. I was thankful for that. The 2nd room it felt a little bit cleaner. Though upon a close loo, the couch is very dirty and has turned black, but they covered it with new fabrics, but most of the "black" arm areas are still showing. The worst thing is the noise from the air conditioner and the traffic. We stayed at 508, and it is right on the side of the road. Normally I am a deep sleeper, but this time round, I couldn't even fall asleep. I tried to turn off the air-con only to find out that the noise from the traffic is continuous (busy road) even at night. I decided to leave the roaring air-con on so that it covers the traffic noise. Bed is too soft for my liking, and luckily the bedsheets felt clean (or so I told myself). Maybe the first room would have been better noise-wise, but it just wouldn't have worked for me and my fiancee. Front desk did try and give us a "better" room w/o the extra ocean view charge. There's a microwave, only it is behind the front desk to be shared by everyone. I have never seen this before, even other motels I went to have microwave in each room. TVs are old, and maybe 13" big. Picture quality was poor (i.e. snowing effect on tv). I have to say it is my first time in Maui, so I had too much hope for what I was going to get. Though I didn't come to Maui to stay in the room, I like to come back to a place where I feel comfortable in at nights. I am disappointed with my own hotel choice this time.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are beautiful but rooms are dirty.”
Reviews.Author: redpoppy17
Reviews.Content: Wow..I just read the reviews of other travelers and can't believe that we are talking about the same place. I agree the location can't be beat. We had to stay there twice in the past 2 weeks having to deal with flights. I did not have a problem dealing with the age of the rooms as they are getting a little outdated but that's okay...my concern was the cleanliness. Our first room I wouldn't even take my shoes off and the door frame and baseboards looks like they haven't been cleaned in ages. The bedspread had holes in it and I wouldn't even let it get close to me. I knew that we were going to be there again 10 days later to deal with flights so I mentioned the cleanliness of our room thinking it was just that room. We were given another room this time by the ocean....pretty location cleaner then the first one but still very poor conditions. Check out the ice machines....a cleaning around them would be great. Easy to do but never gets done. Air conditioners roaring away dripping everywhere ...ours was broken. What took the icing on the cake was that we had a very late flight and they offered to us a room that we could shower and change in...sounds great but they don't bother to clean between customers...dirty dishes ..toilet full...wet towels thrown in the tub... disgusting. Staff say all the right things but no pride of ownership. I am not a 5 star traveler but I do like cleanliness regardless of what price you are paying....both my husband and I were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: golfchick12
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Maui and we had a wonderful time! We had a wonderful stay at the Maui Lu! Everyone was extremly nice and helpful! We stayed in room 171 and it was a very nice and clean room!!! Great patio as well!!! The pool was very relaxing and you couldn'tbeat having a awesome beach right across the street!!!!!! I can't say enough nice things about this place! Yes,it needs updates,but it is cozy and very clean!!!!!!!!! We loved having a nice size icebox in the room,which helped with drinks and snacks to have close by. We loved the grounds and the luau they have right on property was the best!!!!!! It was really geared towards the family!!! My son who is 14 had a total blast and the food was really good! Again,I would totally recommend this property!!! They really go out of their way to make you at home!! What else can you ask for...great rates and great location!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value- Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ranman36
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows the hotel can use some update to the rooms, grounds, beds and bedding, bathrooms etc. Like other reviews, we knew in advance of the $10 per day charge we also did not receive the daily newspaper on our last day, coffee was not replenished on another day. We did not complain,Overall this place is a good value and the staff tries.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina W
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel for the beach front proximity. I would defiantly stay here again but only with beachfront. You just can not beat this price to have the ocean literally 10 steps out of your hotel room door. No the rooms weren't super luxurious but they weren't nasty either, plus all we did in the room was shower and sleep. Even when we were sitting at the room we were sitting outside enjoying looking at the ocean in the chairs that they provide. I took away one star because the bathrooms could have used a update other than that A+.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, some quirks”
Reviews.Author: dsgrntlxmply
Reviews.Content: Older property but good value for Maui; I love amusingly anachronistic places. The area was generally quiet, and not subject to high traffic or much airport noise. $10/day so-called "amenity fee" was at least clearly stated in advance and lower than other Maui hotels but is an prevailing local industry-wide cheesy pricing practice that deserves opprobrium, especially when it becomes deceptive by chiselingly FAILING to deliver the claimed included newspaper on my last morning. Check in and check out experiences were fine. Parking is convenient to rooms, but watch the speed bumps. Located right across the street from a decent-looking beach. Elevator smelled like hot tallow-based industrial lubricants from the Victorian steam power era. Room sound isolation from adjacent rooms was poor: an upstairs room is recommended. Ambient noise was not a problem in this room that looked out toward the mountain. Closet doors were off-track and entirely jammed upon arrival. Room safe in closet was key-operated and OK. Small jalousie windows in bathroom, combined with sliding glass door at balcony (view on attached photo) give good natural breeze in the prevailing wind. Mini-fridge worked fine. A/C fan was comically loud but worked well enough and helped to mask noise from other rooms. Mattress structure appeared to be in good condition and gave good support. Housekeeping left unexpected and welcome thank-you notes for tip on several days, but failed to deliver fresh bath towels on other (weekend) days. Boarding pass print kiosk at front desk eventually worked, but cash acceptor took $1 bills only and could not cope with the $1.50 charge to print 3 pages of boarding pass... ended up using credit card for still-unknown charge (stickers threatened $5 minimum charge, which is NOT the claimed $0.50/page), but generally a FAIL of an incompetently constructed fee-chiseling computer train wreck. Wi-Fi signal in room was 2 bars and sort-of usable. One day only, the sign-on insisted upon trying to make me watch an ad that my device could not deal with, but eventually granted access after several retries.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Maui Lu - great value”
Reviews.Author: YXiao
Reviews.Content: Maui Lu is located in Kihei which is away from the hairy tourist areas of Kanaapali and Lahaina, but has it's share of scenic spots and beaches. No traffic problems at all. The resort itself is a great value during the low season (September) when we visited Maui. It was a great overall experience and great value! Food places are nearby, though may not be within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: striker_lady
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that this was my first trip ever and it was a memorable one. When we checked into the hotel, we were greated by a very nice gentalmen but i cannot remember his name. He was very pleasent and joked with us because we were from canada. He then gave us a coupon book to use while we were on the Island (if you get a coupon booklet, USE IT! We had no idea of the different places that were on the island until we used the book!) we stayed for 4 nights and we had no complaints. the only thing that i would like to change for this hotel is the room that we stayed it was dated and it just looked like the furnature was just kind of "there". the beds were comfortable, the tub needed a plug, but it seemed like the mechanism was broken so i could not plug the tub. i used a face cloth to plug the tub to have a bath. the airconditioner was quite loud but we didnt use it all that much. This hotel is fantastic if you to have something that is a decent price for what you receive. i would definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best I ever had”
Reviews.Author: Weeruska
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone ! I would like to share my good experience with this hotel! First of all, I read so much information about it and wasn't quiet sure if it's gonna be really good, but when we arrived, we were really surprised! The woman at the front desk gave us an excellent apartment right next to the beach. A hotel room were clean and neat. We felt like YES...this is it. I wanna live here forever ;) It's a shame that we stayed only 4 days, but definitely if I go to Maui, I will go to Aston Maui Lu again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “best deal in kihea”
Reviews.Author: njkrol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in sep 11 Very good hotel the staff was very friendly and helpful .On our trip to hawaii our flight got cancelled and we ended up taking 3 flights to get to maui,so we were on a different plane with our bags ,but as soon as they deliverd them to the motel they called me and let me know. They also have a luau here I didn't go ,but it looked nice.There is a beach right across the street and Coconuts is right down the street get a fish burger there Overall awesome place if I ever go back to Kihea I will stay there And the rooms are really big

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melbournemiss
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 6 nights in August 2011, mainly just looking for a nice 2-3 star hotel for $100 a night, this hotel is very relaxed, beautiful grounds, clean rooms, comfortable beds, the air conditioning took some time to cool but worked ok, the rooms do need ceiling fans, friendly helpful staff, awesome sunsets, rooms were cleaned every day & newspapers were supplied every day for each room, this hotel is situated right next to the traditional Luau show they do every night, u can hear the Hawaiian music from anywhere on the hotel premises, makes it even more relaxing with this, TV needs an upgrade to a flat screen they still have the older TVs. Pool area is good, you can see the beach from there, takes 10-15 mins to walk to the local shops, Kihei is a town i knew nothing about before i got here but i found it pretty good. The old lady at the travel desk is helpful but they say they discount they're tours but i didn't think they did.

Reviews.Title: “classic secret surprise”
Reviews.Author: visionary13
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Kihei, Maui for 10 days in June to attend the Maui Film Festival, I was travelling alone so booked my flight to the Hawaiian Islands without making Hotel reservations. The Maui Lu Resort was in the top five of Hotels that I had planned to possibly stay at. My flight landed at around Midnight, so I decided to take a Taxi to the Maui Lu just for a single night and check out the other Hotels the next day. I stayed in the low-buget room No.305 and was pleasantly surprised with the classic style and ambience of this inviting room. The room had vaulted ceilings, very spacious, clean and well maintained, certainly not a 5-star Hotel Room, yet in many ways, 'better' than the high priced Hotels that I always stay away from. The next morning, I had strong intensions of staying at the Maui Lu for the complete 10 days of my trip, yet I decided to also investigate the 'other' Hotels in the Kihei area to compare values. The Maui Lu is definitely the favourite 'best' Hotel for the value, in truth, even if the cost of accommodations were higher at the Maui Lu, I would choose to stay there. The location is quiet, serene and pastorial, the surrounding grounds, landscaping and exquisite Coconut Grove were gorgeous and amazing. I was awoked by the sounds of birds every morning which was a true delight. Another advantage of the Maui Lu is the almost 30 meter Swimming Pool shaped like the Island of Maui. I am a strong, endless swimmer and probably swam several miles in that Pool, it is illuminated at night. Although I was somewhat reluctant about the Maui Lu before my trip to Hawaii, after reading some of the reviews on this site, my stay at this beautiful 'classic-hotel' ranks as one of the best vacations I have ever experienced. I can understand that certain people have specific requirements, yet the 'negative-reviews' are actually banal, misguided, very misleading and inappropriate. The Quality of a Hotel Experience must be guaged on many different levels. The Staff and Management of the Maui Lu are superb & deluxe and deserve special applause. I have never stayed at a Hotel where the housekeepers, groundsman, pool cleaners, almost everyone, appeared to be extraordinarily happy, cheerful and welcoming to all the guests, many were also actually singing, which is usually a reflection of the attitude and performance of the skilled management. The Maui Lu was most certainly a 'classic-secret-suprise', I was thrilled to have the good fortune of staying there. I will be returning in November/ December 2011 to watch the returning of the Humpback Whales. I have also advised dozens of my friends in Vancouver, Canada that if they travel to Maui => stay at the Maui Lu. Two sidenotes: I was tentatively thinking of renting a car, but decided against that option. The MAUI BUS System served my purposes completely, Day Bus Pass is only $2.00, amazing. Also, the Island of Maui has banned Plastic Bags, to help protect the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage hotel with AMAZING views!!”
Reviews.Author: drea1999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Aston Maui Lu on our honeymoon, before we checked into our other hotel for the week. I was pleasantly surprised. They had a wonderful lady that checked us in, and another kind lady at the tourism desk. She booked us a great deal on the Maui Zip Lines and Snorkeling trip. They upgraded us for $10 more to an ocean view room across the street from the main hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better view. You literally walk outside and there's the beach! There is a fence on one side of the property, which you can walk right around and go walking on the beach. There is also some bushes and trees, but you can go around those and walk down the other end of the beach. You can really hear the waves at night! Our room was in need of renovation, the fixtures and bathroom were really old. I didn't mind it, because I wanted to spend all of my time outside on the beach with my new hubby. There were patio chairs and lounge chairs available. I also had a coupon when I booked online for a free bottle of sparkling wine. They didn't have that, but were kind enough to give me a very cool large beach tote, candy and some other goodies delivered to my room. We even got to check out the luau show at night, by just walking by and watching from the grass area. It was really cool! We didn't want to eat all the food and pay all that $, and watching from the grass was just fine. There is an outdoor pool, but no spa. The parking spaces are a bit tight, and if you try to come back after 7 or 8 at night, you have to park in the large parking lot across the street. I would recommend staying here for a few nights, and if you don't mind the "vintage" rooms, it's a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Find a Better Hotel”
Reviews.Author: philjamar
Reviews.Content: If you want a million dollar view and a two bit room this is your place. Let me explain. We were handed our keys, do decent hotels still use keys? The outdoor stairs and walkway were dirty. The room smelled like an old shoe. Both my wife and I had little spiders waiting for us on the pillows of our twin beds. This initiated the bed bug check, found none.. The vaulted ceiling was the roof boards and it was obvious there had been a leak by the visible repair job. I have to say the view was fantastic once we moved the torn screen door out of the way. Hello 1980's the 19" diagonal TV still worked. Do I need to continue? A hotel is in the business of renting out clean and comfortable rooms. Mission not accomplished.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly60
Reviews.Content: We had reserved another resort when a friend told us about this place. He said it was nice, clean, great location, great staff and incredible views. He was so right! We got the ocean front room and our friends an ocean view room, what a view! The place had the feel of aloha from top to bottom. Our room was clean and well maintained with a microwave, fridge and small sink. Our friends room was also nice with the "ocean view" which was almost as good as our "ocean front". They had the loft room which was great since my friend had to do some work via his computer while his wife slept in the loft. Great internet service that accommodated the large files he needed to download. Although some reviewers say their room was subpar, we didn't have that experience. This is not a new resort, but that is one of the things we enjoyed about it. It felt like old maui and we WILL stay here again. See you soon Maui Lu!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you really like white noise.”
Reviews.Author: Amphigorey
Reviews.Content: First, the good: The grounds are nicely kept and expansive. I didn't use the pool, but it looked inviting and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are actually quite large for standard hotel rooms. Now, the bad: The mandatory $10/night "amenity fee." If a fee is mandatory, then it should be included in the room rate - otherwise it's pretty much a bait-and-switch. They can advertise their rates as $10/night lower than they actually are, and then charge this mandatory fee. I'm sure plenty of other hotels do this, but that doesn't make it less scummy. I didn't even want the stuff it was supposed to pay for - I don't care about having a PlayStation in my room, I don't want to rent DVDs on vacation, and if I want wifi I can find a cafe. Seriously, if you want to charge $10 more a night, go ahead and list it as $100 instead of $90. Don't advertise as $90 and then charge a "mandatory fee." It makes you look shady and it makes the customer feel manipulated. The bathroom was not nice. The floor was cracked and yellowing, and the sink counter had big nicks in it. The mattresses felt old; I could feel the springs. I could have forgiven all of that if not for the inescapable white noise. Even if I turned the one in my room completely off, I could still hear the ones next door, and they were VERY loud. It was really difficult to get any sleep here because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Who doesn't like a urine scented pillow?”
Reviews.Author: punaRob
Reviews.Content: Ok, the location of this place is pretty good. The people that worked there were nice enough. I kind of felt sorry for them for working in such a dump. I stayed in one of the back buildings, not the ocean side ones. Honestly I booked it because it was the cheapest I could find and wanted to save my work money. However, there was a mandatory amenity fee which was reasonable for what you got, especially since they don't charge for parking, but it shouldn't be mandatory. I could have lived without it. If those charges had been in the initial price I would have stayed elsewhere. So if you expect the cheapest, expect what comes with the cheapest. For me it included a pillow that reeked of urine, a shower that had what looked like years of soap scum, an A/C that necessitated using ear plugs to sleep, and what was likely the worst bed I ever slept on. Also, our room was supposed to be a single queen bed but instead had 2 beds which wasn't so romantic--on the plus side it actually allowed one of us to sort of sleep. It's nice to see the manager responds to reviews and I feel bad for her. I'm sure she is in a tough position trying to manage what is basically a dump. Then again, if it wasn't, I'm sure they'd charge a lot more. Overall it was no big deal because I was there for work, but if this had been some big vacation I had saved up for I would have left after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming home to the Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: wordsofwisdom
Reviews.Content: I travel to Maui 6 times a year and almost always include a few days' stay at the Maui Lu (the rest of the time we might be camping, if that tells you something about our tastes). It's quiet, comfortable and clean with spacious rooms, a big, peaceful garden, a nice pool, and free wi-fi. The staff are warm, friendly and helpful. If you're not looking for the big, fancy, showy type of luxury, you'll find the best deal on this side of the island at the Maui Lu.There is one less-expensive hotel in Kihei, but it's not as spacious or peaceful. Staying at the Maui Lu is like visiting a favorite auntie. You don't love her because she's elegant; you love her because she's sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: My2sons
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here after a late arrival into Maui. We only stayed one night as we were staying for the week at a resort on Ka'anapali. This was fine for our purposes which was a rest after a long flight and not far from airport. This place has so much potential if only Aston would sink some serious money into updates. The grounds are beautiful but the rooms are so outdated and worn. Sheets are paper thin, linoleum bathroom floors, and very old mattresses. The staff was very nice upon check in and check out. They are operating the best they can with the tools given. Room was very clean. Old air conditioner was very loud. Shame on Aston for not making the most of this hotel with good "bones". We would never stay here for more than a day on either end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Punabob
Reviews.Content: Whatever your reservation rate shows up as, add $10 per night for the "mandatory amenities charge for playstation and DVD player." yes, mandatory. Then be sure to bring some shower cleaner for the shower walls which haven't been washed since Obama has been in office. Pack your carpet shampooer for the floors. And don't forget a mattress pad to make the disco era mattress sleepable. Other than that you should enjoy your stay. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit is Alive at Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: LovingMauiLu
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay in an emergency and randomly chose the Maui Lu. I was greeted with care and concern from an incredible staff. Jodie and Elana embody the Aloha Spirit. If you are visiting Maui and want to experience what the real people of Hawaii are like than I highly recommend this property. You could get a modern room at 3 times the price in Wailea but I can guarantee you will not experience personal service like the Maui Lu.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Maui”
Reviews.Author: jacob89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and fell in love with the place. The location is perfect, we got an ocean front room and it truly was ocean front, just steps from our door to the water. The pool is large and very clean. The staff was always helpful and had that wonderful Aloha spirit. There is no better place to stay while in Maui. Easy access to all parts of the island from the hotel, and some great little restaurants nearby as well. The hotel is one of the older hotels on the island, but that is what makes it so great...you truly feel the Hawaiian spirit when you are here.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mkpAustin
Reviews.Content: This is where we stayed when my husband proposed to me and we returned this year. Not fancy but very comfortable with nice grounds away from the "big" resorts. The beach for sunset watching is just a short walk across the street. The place has been around a while but the people are very friendly and welcoming. Driving to anywhere is easy from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Oceanfront Room”
Reviews.Author: usanadawn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Aston Maui Lu. I was a little concerned having read some of the reviews but decided to take a chance as we would be able to get an oceanfront room for a great price. It turned out to be a great budget resort. It's definitely dated but was comfortable our room was satisfactory. The staff are very friendly and the grounds are beautiful. The beach isn't that great for swimming but there's a nice long beach beside the resort for taking walks. It helps when booking this resort to keep in mind it's a two star. Don't book it and then expect it to be more than that or you'll be disappointed. We loved being right on the ocean as we could hear the waves from our room and watch the sunsets on our lanai. Unfortunately, we were also woken up every morning by other guests talking outside our room at 5am. I don't know why people don't realize that other people might be sleeping at that hour! Also regarding noise, the resort has a luau three times a week, which can be noisy. The only other thing I worth mentioning is that there's only one pool and they had to unexpectedly close it for repairs. They suggested using the community pool in Kihei but we didn't want to do that so they offered to move us to the Aston Banyon, also in Kihei. The Banyon isn't oceanfront so we were upgraded to a suite with a partial ocean view to compensate us for losing the oceanfront room. Cathy, the GM took very good care of us to ensure we were happy with the arrangements. Staying at the Aston Banyon was wonderful and we really appreciate the care and attention we received from both hotels. We would stay at both hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: zobug1992
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was alwalys very friendly and helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Winona67
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded my expectations. The grounds were very nice and well maintained. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Check out the lua if it's still offered there. Also be sure to check the community box near the front desk, it was filled with boogie boards, noodles and beach mats during our stay. Be sure to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back at maui lu!”
Reviews.Author: marcinvyszo
Reviews.Content: i you wanna feel old Polynesian spirit Maui Lu is place to go, we spend 10 nights at this hotel from May 26 to June 4 2011 and we loved it i was bit nervous after reading some reviews online but some folks just expect too much for the buck. we've had our 20 months old baby with us i was worried how is gonna be at nite when everybody go out come back drunk make noises, well this place was quiet and peaceful whole time we stayed there. check in and out was super quick, stuff was really nice, room and bathroom clean and fresh everyday with clean sheets and towels. what else can i say ALOHA from Marcin, Justyna, And Emily to Maui Lu management and stuff MAHALO for making' our vacation awesome and see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, incredible view, clean room, best bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: Orr4aloha
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the big high end Ritz resort stay, the Maui Lu is not for you. But if you are like us, going to Maui for all the island has to offer, rather than a fancy hotel, the Maui Lu is a great place to stay. We stayed there for 7 nights. The manager Cathy and all the staff was pleasant and helpful from the time we booked our stay. I was a little nervous about booking here with having read some of the negative reviews but after staying there myself I think there are just some people who can't be pleased anyway. As far as the room amenities go, well you get what you pay for. The tv is basic and there isn't a minibar but personally we didn't go to Maui to watch tv. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The true highlight of this hotel is the view. No other hotel in Maui can offer your lanai as close to the ocean as this one. Watching the sun come up and go down and listen to the waves come in literally just feet from your door is AMAZING!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: spudthestud
Reviews.Content: Hi there......Just got back from 1 wonderful week in Maui.....I was a little worried at first booking the Aston Maui Lau because of some of the reviews i read... The trick with this place is too ask for any upgrades......I booked my trip through a package that had the cheapest room and got upgraded for a cost of an extra $22 a night....The upgrade put me right on the beach with the most fantastic view...I was literally 50ft from the water.....I was so stoked with my upgrade all week...:) Overall....The Aston Maui Lau was a wonderful stay and i would definitly stay there again the future......

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu Ethics”
Reviews.Author: Gleaming30
Reviews.Content: To be a guest at Maui Lu is to find oneself in a world, beyond that of any hotel experence, one can only possibly fathom in their most joyous dreams. We relaxed within the most comfortable living quarters and being a jog from the beach were able to enjoy the warmth of the sun and sand. We were extremely impressed, if not completely humbled by the staff. One in particular though shines quite brighter than most and for this we cannot help but praise Jeff. His kindness and his strong work ethic combined made for a comforting stay. To know a man of such good humor and heart can still present stonch professionalism while putting his nose to the grindstone. He truly restores my faith in the working man. My family and I even extended our stay after our treatment at Maui Lu by Jeff. His bubbly sense of being brought us back to your hotel for an additional 3 days. (We had planned to stay only 1) In the future I plan to stay at Maui Lu for my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Read before you stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: dsfire49
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Maui for a short stay on Maui for her 30th birthday. We usually go to Kauai so Maui was new to us. We are very experienced travelers having been all over the world and to Hawaii 10 times in the last six years. My review is not to bash this business but to educate potential patrons. First, we arrived to a very friendly staff that checked us in quickly. We were concerned when we pulled up and noticed a condemed building right next to the main building of the Maui Lu. I thought they must be renovating and there is no way thier buildings are in bad shape, WRONG! Enter the elevator for a suprise, as a Professional Fire Captain I would not ride in that thing if there was a flood on my heals. The railing was unstable on our walk to the room, then we entered our room. WOW, this was not anything like what the website shows, torn up base boards, stains on the walls, sewer smell, stained carpet, old furniture (not old like 10 years old but old). There was no way I was going to stay there for four nights. I went to the desk and tried for a refund but no luck, since I paid about $400 and cashed in roughly 15000 World Points (about $150) for the room they could not help due to a third party issue. Did I believe they could not refund my money, NO. They did offer us an upgrade to an ocean view room which was in SLIGHTLY better condition across the street fo an additional $80, I went back and asked if they could move me to one of the other Aston Hotels on the island and that I would gladly pay any differance in rate, at that point the lady said "Here, I am giving you our best room for no charge". After just being tired of spending 2 hours trying to fiqure out our situation I agreed. This women was very helpful, If I remembered her name I would have recomended her for a customer service award as her hands were clearly tied by Aston Hotels. The new room 402 was better and with alittle TLC could be really nice. Its right on the water, needs a security fence to keep the pot dealers from hassling you while relaxing. I have two points, first, Great customer service, horrible facility. I have stayed in Motel 6 hotels in Inglewood Ca, that were far nicer. If they remodeled it could be very nice as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Please STAY AWAY...Seriously, Aston is a great management company but DON'T GO THERE.”
Reviews.Author: adigerol
Reviews.Content: The location is ok, nothing to the north in the city of Kiehi, south is not much better. So much for the location. They have no beach per se, except for a sandy west facing piece of sand about 50ft across, lined by lava, be warned. Now for the hotel, the grounds are amazing, or at least they were about 30 years ago. Checking isn't much of an experience. They've spent more money on the sign on the highway than they did updating the resort. We stayed oceanfront and let me just say, we were in Maui for 5 days and Kona for 5, both were ocean front and we didn't experience the cockroaches we did at the AML. BTW we stayed in private condos at the other places. The room was worse than a central L.A. pay per hour motel, bed hard, bad everything. Don't be sucked into the "free" breakfast, there is none. It's coffee and hot water. Bottom line is, don't do what we did, we came out a day early and found what we thought was a bargain, pay a bit more and stay away from this place, it's friggin bad.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: lckycnck
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 days at the Maui Lu in an ocean front suite. It is definitely worth the money. The staff were wonderful and so helpful. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The pool was clean and very refreshing on a hot day. The hotel is very convenient for the Kihei area. Close to all amenities. The little beach is wonderful and private, 20ft from my balcony. It was wonderful to watch whales, boats ,canoes, etc, right out front. The large beach for long walks is on the north side of the buildings and you can walk for miles. The resort is a little worn around the edges, but they are upgrading rooms. The location, the price and the staff all make a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck..”
Reviews.Author: sars4619
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Aston Maui Lu for 6 nights in March. Was a little nervy to stay here having read some of the reviews but I am glad I did. First impressions last and SONNY welcomed me with a great smile and was nothing but helpful. You rock Sonny! It was clean, safe and comfortable. Don't come expecting a 4/5 star resort. It is old Hawaii but it was very enjoyable and quiet. Imagine waking up to the birds and sea waves. This is it. I was upgraded to a ocean view room in building 5. Room had a musty smell when I first walked in but beds were comfortable. Room was clean. Unfortunately I only stayed there 1 night and on my 2nd night there the tsunami sirens were going off and spent it at a local evacuation site. As I was traveling solo, I spent the initial hours prior to sirens going off at reception which I was glad I did. Management were GREAT! Brewed coffee. Remained calm and gave all the relevant information on what to do/where to go when the sirens went off. Thank God it all worked out ok for people in HI. Thoughts go to Japan. Kudos to Cathy and her wonderful team! I moved to another room after that which was garden view. Spent a few hours poolside which was very comfortable. Nice pool. Good for sunbathing for a few hours. Aston Maui Lu is an excellent base for exploring the island. Amazing beaches, restaurants. Whale watching - recommend the Pacific Whale Foundation. Blue Hawaiian for your helicopter ride. I was totally in luck when I just called in there with out any reservation and I for a full 1hr island tour and got nearly 50% off it! Right time right place! Road to Hana, Makena Beach. I love that all the beaches have restrooms on site & most have life guards. ABC stores are great and they give you free gifts if you keep your receipts. They sell gas too. Lots of grocery stores close by that sell fruit, sandwiches etc. If you are looking to see Maui and have the extra $ to spend enjoying the island then stay here. If you want something else, book elsewhere. Remember alot of places charge for parking and also a resort fee. Not here. I would highly recommend it. The Aloha spirit is well and truely alive here! Mahola Maui! I will return to see you soon! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Janice075
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Maui Lu hotel for 2 nights in an ocean view room. Even though the amentities are a little old, it was perfectly fine for us. We had beautiful view from our patio. There is a frige in the room. There is a nice swimming pool. The staffs are extremely friendly and nice. Overall, it was a great value in Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Maui is sure expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Swedishkanelbulle
Reviews.Content: I can not say that you get what you are paying for, couse this is Maui. The same standard in California would cost about 40 dollars and we paid 120 dollars + tax. The first night we had problems with bugs in our hotelroom. I phoned the servicedesk and it was okey for me too change room the next day. He told me he was sorry about this and everything felt good. The next day when I went down to the Desk I didnt get the same treatment.. The lady who was working was really really rude! She treated us like we were buging her!! Crazy! The rest of our staying was good but I dont think I would like to go back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews are spot on. Great place, just needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: MarkIngles
Reviews.Content: I booked this place since I just needed one night before my other place to stay had availability. After 17 hours of flying, this was about a 20 min drive from the airport. We got in around 11pm and were greeted by the nicest check in clerk in my life. It was actually a pleasure to check in rather than a hassle. The room was oceanfront and had to be the cheapest oceanfront room on Maui. Our place was clean and right on the ocean. The fixtures, especially in the bathroom, really needed to be updated. I would stay there again for the value. Places down the street in Wailea are 5-6x the price for waterfront rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC...”
Reviews.Author: the_cellarboy
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Aston Maui Lu didn't get off to a great start; we had requested a King Bed and were told at check-in they were only able to supply us with a Double. They did suggest we check in the morning to see if any Kings we available but regardless we were a little ticked-off. Our room could best be described as functional. The whole hotel could use some significant upgrading (what was with the dilapidated older building right next to the visitor car park, it's a real eye-sore) and the room was no different. The carpets were dirty and the whole room needed a renovation. After a poor sleep on a mattress that had springs poking into our sides, we approached the front desk and asked for a change of room. We were given a much better room with a (still uncomfortable) King Bed, which was much cleaner and had a nice Balcony. The room could have still done with a lick of paint and a reno but served it's purpose. Overall the Aston Maui Lu is in a good location and really you kinda get what you pay for. I'd just recommend considering spending a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Great "home-base" for Maui adventures”
Reviews.Author: Snoozie11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a garden room for a week. The rooms are clean, the grounds are lush, and the staff is amazing. Since we spend most of our time exploring Maui, we did not mind the older feel of the rooms. The pool is clean and big, but a little bit hard to get in and out of. There are many beaches nearby and two restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, but suffering from some neglect.”
Reviews.Author: tobbyof3
Reviews.Content: Coming from a hospitality background I am usually critical of hotel rooms. When I first entered the room the dated look of the room really turned me off. We stayed 4 nights at the Aston Maui Lu. They did honor my request for a king room which had not been available before. We didn't spend much time in our room because, after all, we were in Hawaii! The room was big and had a sofa. The grounds are well kept, the bed comfy, and the room was clean. The pool is nice and was clean. Each time I came in contact with hotel staff the greeted me and were friendly. The luau we attended the last night we were there was refreshing, entertaining and got better as the show went on. It was also family friendly. This hotel has a great location and a beautiful ocean view. I would stay there again. I would recommend this place to friends with the caution that the they would not be wanting to take any pictures of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for someone on a budget”
Reviews.Author: mitsu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Lu for 8 nights. The hotel grounds are beautiful. We loved the price of this hotel and you couldn't beat the location. We stayed in a Garden View room that overlooked the pool. The room was very clean, not a bug in site....I checked! You get a mini fridge and coffee maker in your room and cable television. They have a microwave and toaster located in the lobby for your use as well as BBQ's. The hotel also offers beach towels at the front desk and boggie boards. Check in was a breeze as was check out. We didn't go to the beach accross from the resort, but it looked very nice. They also have someone beside the front desk that assists with booking tours. Some other reviews commented on the old building on the grounds. I honestly didn't notice it until the 6th day and we drove past every day twice a day! LOL Great stay for a great price. We were only in Maui for 8 days and we decided to eat out most of the time. We brought bowls and spoons from home and had cereal and toast for breakfast it worked out great. Loved having the fridge to keep our snacks, fruit and beverages cold. The beds were great , I thought they may be way to hard...but I had the best sleep of my life better then home. Pillows were nice and fluffy and the AC worked great. If your looking for the Four Seasons this isn't the place and you will be dissapointed. This is a great place for budget minded travellers who like us only use our room to sleep. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Bang for The Buck”
Reviews.Author: l1l2zorr
Reviews.Content: We decided to do Maui over Xmas vacation. Needless to say it was the PEAK season. Hotel rates were out of this world. We stumbled on the Lu. After reading the review we were very nervous about our booking. BUT after arriving all our doubt were put to rest. This is a very charming, "back in time" type of resort. If you stay there and take it for what it is you'll have a wonderful time. It is not a 5 Star resort. The money we saved on the room gave us a wonderful vacation. We did more, we ate more, we shop more, we explored more. most of all we had more memories of Maui. The kids had a wonderful time. Maui is small so driving was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Penwyllt
Reviews.Content: WE found this hotel perfect for our needs fitted our tight budget and ideal to explore the island from...not in the hectic part of Kihei but close to everything if you have a car Rooms are spacious with a pleasant lanai we had a room overlooking the grounds to the rear . However therooms have seen better days and really are in need of refusbishment...they were comfortable and had what you need , the tv looked so dated compared to all the flat screens above but hey we didnt come to Hawaii to watch TV! Staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Very Peaceful Stay”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: If you are reading these reviews because you have booked a stay at this property or are considering doing so then you know for a fact that this is a budget property due to the price you have paid or were quoted. It is cheaper to stay here than other places because it is an old property. This is a fact, no sense staying here and then complaining afterwards about how old it is. I was fully aware of that fact when booking here. I do have to agree with other reviewers that when driving up to the check-in area the old, unused, falling apart building that is front and center provides a very poor first impression of the resort. I stayed here for my first night in Maui. Chose this hotel for proximity to the airport and price. I wanted to stay 1 night here as I could get here quickly after a very tiring day of travelling. I also wanted to save some money on my first night as I knew I would be tired and not want to spend hours shopping and stocking up for my condo. This was the perfect place to do this. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. Check in was painless and pleasant. I stayed in an oceanside room across the road from the check-in area and main gardenview buildings and pool. The Oceanside parking lot is very small, but there is lots of extra parking just across the road if the lot is full or you are driving a larger vehicle. My Oceanside room had been recently upgraded with new bedding, drapes etc. The bed was very comfortable, the room was nice and cool and there was a mini fridge and stocked coffee maker. I was in a ground floor room with a nice patio area with 2 chairs and a table. The patio doors do come off track, they are old, but it locks well so felt perfectly safe and comfortable. The hotel does not offer free internet. You must purchase a package or use the pay per use computers at the check-in area. Our room also did not have a safe. The grounds at this property are huge and beautiful. They have a very serene feel and get you in the Aloha Spirit very quickly. The pool is very nice with lots of loungers and tables and chairs to relax around. It is a bit hard getting in and out as the sides of the pool are sloped. This is not a problem if you use the stairs and railing. The Luau was going on the night we were there and it looked very intimate. It is a small family style Luau and looked like it would be good for a family with young children. Not huge and commercialized as at some of the larger resorts. The beach coves are very tiny and not suitable for swimming/sunning, but are very nice to get your toes in the sand and water. The location of this hotel is not really walkable to restaurants/shopping. You will certainly need a car if staying here. All in all I was very satisfied with this hotel and it met my expectations perfectly. I would not have been satisfied spending my whole Maui vacation here, but to get my bearings and get a good night's sleep I would not hesitate to stay here again for a first or last night stay in Maui due to location, close to the airport, exceptional grounds and low cost.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms with mini fridge.”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveller292
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Maui Lu. It is too bad it hasn't been renovated, the location is amazing and the grouds are beautiful. The rooms are clean and the mini fridge was excellent. Not many restaurants close by but a walk along the beach will take you down the street to the corner store. Very close to Kihei Canoe Club where you can be a part of a traditional experience every Tuesday and Thursay at 6am for $25 you get to paddle out with experienced, friendly people and possible get close to whales. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: BevNewYorkCity_NY
Reviews.Content: Our ocean front room had basic amenities but generous space including lanai, a beautiful ocean setting complete with the sound of roaring waves. Comfortable bedding, morning coffee, and convenient location made this hotel near perfect. The oceanfront parking lot is small however.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking View”
Reviews.Author: fehlau
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel reminiscent of old Hawaii! We were here for a two night stay and enjoyed the beautiful views of our oceanfront room! If you are fussy about the "glitz" factor of hotels, this is not for you, however. The sliding glass door to the lanai goes off track, and the air conditioner is a little loud, but we did not fret about things like that. The views off our lanai were amazing! The grounds were beautiful! Our walks on the beach were wonderful! The location is not the greatest, but we are walkers so we actually walked north to the marina which is probably a little over three miles, and south to the commercial area of Kihue by the post office which is probably a mile.
