The walk on the beach, north, is a nice walk, however, the walk, south, is along the road and can be unsafe at times. This is due to lack of sidewalks most of the way which requires you to walk on the shoulder. We were in Maui for tranquility and relaxation, and this place fit the bill. We walked to the ABC Drugstore everyday, and had a bite to eat at a short order place next door. There also is a small farmers market there. Also, there are two canoe clubs which you can walk to and sign up to paddle on certain days. You can see whales breeching off the beach. Amazing! We also walked to the Isana Restaurant close by and had a delicious Korean meal. All in all, it was a great stay despite the isolated location. We are walkers so we did not rent a car. We took the Speedi Shuttle from the airport for fifteen dollars apiece. However, for most people who want to take in all the sights, a car would be a necessity. They do have a city bus with limited service, however. That could be another option. A room could be had for a cheaper price across the street, eighty-eight dollars at the time we went, but for a short stay we opted for the ocean front for 150.00, senior discount. Being budget conscious, if we were there longer, we probably would have stayed across the street. However for two days, the splurge on the oceanfront was well worth it. The room did not have a microwave, but it did have a refrigerator and coffeemaker. Eating on the lanai enjoying ocean and mountain views through the palm trees was priceless!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - close to the ocean”
Reviews.Author: 6camaro7
Reviews.Content: They moved our room from across the road to be in the building right by the ocean (30ft away). The staff went out of their way to make sure my bed was extra comfortable. The room was dated and in need of remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price and Nice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskarie
Reviews.Content: We came here the last leg of our trip. I had never been to Kihei and wanted to check it out. This Maui Lu was really close to shopping. We rode the bus which stops out front of the hotel and runs 2 times per hour. I really liked the small cute beach which did not get deep right away. The sand was soft and smoother than Kaanapali or Kahanas sand.. It was quiet here and we were very relaxed. The hotel is older but the staff was friendly. We upgraded to a double suite and for the price, I really enjoyed my stay! We did not have a chance to go into the pool due to the storm. All in all I may stay here again because it was very convinient to the shops and what seemed to be a lot more nightlife than Lahaina. I will return to Kihei...Mahalo

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you work for your money”
Reviews.Author: makimg
Reviews.Content: Yes, this resort is worn out somewhat, as said in other reviews, however, it is very clean with great customer service, especially Sonny. Great place to stay if you really want to get a taste of real laid back old days Hawaii and get in touch with locals. Very quite and romantic place, not for wild party animals. We are glad we stayed here, because we were able to use the money we saved on lodging on other fun thngs, like snorkeling with SeaFire at the Molokini crater reef, see my facebook gallery for pics from snorkeling. http://www.facebook.com/album.php?aid=3535&id=100000359848070&l=b6031f7218 If you need great activity packages, see Mary at the front desk, she is awesome. We'll definitely stay here again next time we go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious with Great Views! + Cat Person's Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Agburns
Reviews.Content: Aston Maui Lu was a random selection but we were amazed when we got to the hotel. The room is very spacious with the size of 1 bedroom + 1 living room. We had the garden view room at a cheaper rate but the greenery view was pleasant enough to compete with the ocean view. The only downside we can think of is that there's no free internet. What's the most impressive is there are a few lovely cats living in the hotel area. If you're a cat lover you'll immediately like this place. Among all those cats, Samuel, a very cute grey tabby tomcat who appears to be the king cat in the neighborhood, made our stay absolutely unforgettable. Samuel seems to be a former house cat who got abandoned and he seems to be striving for love from people. After our first meet Samuel came to our room every morning before we left and every evening after we came back, for an hour or so. To show that he did not come for food, he usually would not eat the little snack we gave him at first, but would kindly finish it before he left. He's always very loving, gentle and polite, never hopped on the couch without invitation. Most of the time he would simply lying on the floor, taking a peaceful indoor nap. There's one evening we got some take-out food and offered the leftover to Samuel. At the end of his stay, I walked him down the stairs and saw him run into the dark to chase after something. After a few minutes when I was about to have a shower, I heard Samuel meowing outside our room. My boyfriend opened the door, took a peek outside and quickly closed the door. He told me Samuel was waiting there with a mouse in his mouth. Obviously Samuel was thanking us in his own way. Due to hygienic reason we didn't let Samuel in, he waited for a while and left. We felt bad to turn down Samuel's friendly gesture which we highly appreciated. The next day we went to the store to pick up a few cans of cat food and a flea collar for Samuel. On the day we left Maui, Samuel kept us company until we checked out. He walked us down the stairs and saw us off. This unexpected friendship with a Hawaiian cat has become the highlight of our trip. We keep missing Samuel after we came back to Canada and I do have a plan to go back to Maui and to this hotel again sometime in the future just to see Samuel. So, if you're a cat person, stay in this hotel and meet the legendary Samuel! He has a white belly and hopefully still wears a beige (used to be white) collar. And any update on him will be appreciated as we miss him so much!

Reviews.Title: “Ya gets what ya pays for....”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews here. If you are a budget minded traveler who doesn't mind worn (but safe) facilities, this is a good place. Private beach, free parking, good price, friendly staff if you don't mind the worn furnishings and some level of grottiness. I only had one night in Maui and wanted to do as cheaply as possible. This room was the result of a priceline bid of $63. For that price (less than apartment stays), I was willing to put up with some wear and tear. When I checked in, I was offered an upgrade to oceanfront for an additional $20 and I probably should have taken it. The resort consists of three areas. Two oceanside buildings which flank a private beach with its own parking lot with the main resort across the street (open air lobby/reception/concierge and pool and then the main resort behind the lobby). From the main resort, it's 5 min. walk across the grounds and street to get to the beach. Like the rooms, the grounds are minimally maintained. Grass and landscaping are cut/trimmed, but not terribly inviting or pleasant, The main buildings face each other across a large expanse of grass, so one can pretty much see the entire resort when you walk out of your room...not terribly private. As others have said, the rooms are dated and worn, but I personally didn't see evidence of mold, grot, etc. My room was quite large with two beds (neither of which were comfortable...I think it's been awhile since the mattresses were replaced. The location is very convenient. 15 minutes to the airport, 3-minute drive or about 10-15 minute walk to downtown Kihei, close to a new mall (with a Hilo Hatties if you're looking for souvenirs and otherwise pretty central. Dry side of the island so don't expect lush, tropical surroundings. If an important part of your stay is hanging out in your room or at your resort, then this might not be the resort for you. But if you're like me and essentially use your hotel room as a place to sleep, then this is a decent budget alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: TAugusta_MT
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely great time in this hotel. We upgraded to ocean and sat and watched the ocean every nite. Wish I could have stayed longer. We had ants in the room, but Safeway was close by so we got some Raid and it worked great. I had no complaints at all. The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful. No restaurant but plenty nearby. I would stay there again if I every get back to Maui. Thanks for a great vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Free parking, nice beach, ants in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Tiagogo
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel I stayed at during my vaca in Maui. I opted for the oceanview room which is $40-50 more than the standard rooms (which are located across the street from the ocean). The good - You can hear ocean waves at night while you sleep -- even with the sliding door closed. - Parking is free and there's a lot right next to the oceanview/oceanfront hotel rooms. - There are two, nice small private beaches. There are about three old lounge chairs strewn about. So if they're not taken, you can relax on the beach, which is quiet as long as the waves drown out traffic from the nearby road. - The room has a fridge and coffee maker. - The hotel hosts a luau throughout the week. It is smaller and less fancy (and albeit less expensive) than other luaus in Maui. But it is convenient to just walk across the street rather than driving to Lahaina or another hotel. During the luau you can make your own lei and there are other kid-friendly activities. The food leaves a lot to be desired, but the entertainers are fun and you can tell a lot of them are related. It's truly a family affair. The bad - The room is out of date and not really worth the price (definitely not a resort). - I was shocked to find ants living it up in and around the sink in my bathroom. - The room didn't really scream cleanliness and relaxation. I wore my flip flops all the time and even TP'd the toilet seat. - The shower pressure was sub par. All in all, if you're traveling during the off-season, I'd recommend staying at another hotel. There are more to choose from in Maui than you'd think.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and quiet”
Reviews.Author: travellin__man049
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Lu my last night in Maui. I previously was in Lahaina at another Aston property. Although the Maui Lu didn't have a kitchen, it did have a fridge. I found I didn't even miss the kitchen. There were plenty of places to eat within a few miles. The room was clean and quiet. The pool was an older style but it was great. The deep end was ten feet deep and huge. The beach is conveniantly acroos the street. The staff was very helpful and cheerful . The manager Jody was extremely pleasant. I can't wait to go back. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “The Lowest End Of Budget Hotel/Resort !”
Reviews.Author: Jarod_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This is the lowest of the lowest of budget resorts on the island ! The place needs a paint job real bad and I believe it has being renovated in years!! In the room the carpet needed to be replace, bathroom fixtures falling off, sliding glass door no lock, and at least 50 cats roaming around the grounds. Think twice before you book this resort; you're better off staying at a Super 8 motel or either at a Motel 6. Stay away from this place or else you'll be very disappointed !!!! They must have paid alot of money for the Aston name just to draw the people in; don't be sucked in like we were.

Reviews.Title: “In case of emergency ONLY, and maybe not even then!”
Reviews.Author: nightwines
Reviews.Content: Where does one start with just how awful this hotel is?! We booked a condo but because of scheduling conflicts we needed one night elsewhere while on Maui and seeing it was our last night and that we would only be in the room for a few hours sleep and a shower in the morning we went the cheap route. It wasnâ€™t worth it. First, when you pull in the parking lot there is a dilapidated and I believe condemned building to the left that was one of there older hotels. That should have been a warning to us and to anybody else who stays their. We stayed on the other side of Kihei blvd not the ocean side. The room was horrendous, plain and simple. Filthy carpet, filthy bathroom loud and obnoxious A/C and the room stunk. When you turned on the shower it blew the shower curtain around like it was in a hurricane. Water rushed over the tub, onto the bathroom floor and into the living area. I could go on and on but you should get the picture by now. And in case you donâ€™t look at some of the photos of the reviewers on this site!!! Hey! Aston Maui Lu! You seriously need to implode this place (along with the building in front thatâ€™s ready to fall over anyways) and start from scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View at a Bargain Price!”
Reviews.Author: BryanaStinson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five nights in a second floor oceanfront room of the Maui Lu before spending a week at the Ka'anapali Beach Club in Northern Ka'anapali. We couldn't believe the amazing view we got for under a $100 a night. The last minute upgrade to the oceanfront room was absolutely worth the extra $20/night. The room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and the size was more than adequate for two people. The furniture is old and worn but did I mention that the view was spactacular!?! This is our third trip to the islands and I still cannot believe what a bargain this place was. It definately wasn't luxiourious but the price was right and the relaxing oceanfront room was just what we were looking for. The grounds at the Maui Lu are stunning, and although the place needs some work, it is absolutely worth fixing up.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience at the Aston Maui Lu!”
Reviews.Author: DeliberateCreator
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home a few minutes ago and I just had to take this opportunity to share my wonderful experiences at the Aston Maui Lu in Kihei, Maui, Hawaii! We arrived on Sunday very late and we were greeted with a smile and professionalism! Sonny checked us in and provided us with valuable information about everything! The room was totally AWESOME! We were blessed to stay in one of the Ocean Front rooms and we could see the beautiful breathtaking view and hear the waves all of the time! The room was very clean and the vaulted wood ceiling is BEAUTIFUL! I sat on the Lanai and enjoyed the breeze and view quite often! The price was FABULOUS! Everyone was so nice! I can hardly wait to share our pictures with our friends and family! The Polynesian Lua held on the property was OUTSTANDING, too! We are definitely going back to Maui and YES, we will be staying at the Aston Maui Lu! Thank you Jody, Stella, Jane, Elana, Joe and of course, a very special THANK YOU to Sonny! 5 Stars across the board for the Aston Maui Lu! It was a dream come true! We will see you next year! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel room we have ever checked into - Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: ShreddingMaui
Reviews.Content: Basically this place was built in the 1960's and left as is until today. Bathrooms, carpet, wallpaper, paint, windows and linens, it is probably all still original so you can imagine the condition it's in and how it smells. We checked in, could immediately hear the tv's on both sides of the room and couldn't believe the lousy condition of the room. After passing two sketchy looking security guards, we went for dinner and a beer and decided there was no way we could spend the night here, it was just too disgusting. It's not hard to find a better deal for a much nicer place, just do your research. The only plus was that the front desk clerk was very friendly, I feel bad for him that he represents such a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Depite aged decor, no bugs”
Reviews.Author: lisa94553
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviewers who pointed out that the Maui Lu is past its prime but wanted to pass along that our room was quite clean and bug free. The hotel was undergoing renovations on the oceanside rooms going on while we were staying in the garden side building so perhaps the new decor will give the hotel a needed boost. The front desk staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to families with kids and people who fully understand what they're booking.

Reviews.Title: “Past its heyday.”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lots of parking. Huge hotel grounds (20+ acres). Cons: Free wifi is only in lobby, which is not connected to the hotel. The decor is from the 70s, and has not been maintained since then. It had peeling paint, patched bathroom walls, stained carpet, shabby bed linen, grimy cups, and ugly yellow counters. Pervasive musty and moldy smell would not go away even when we opened the doors/ windows. Walls are thin, so bring ear plugs. Not on the same side as the beach, so careful when crossing street. Essentially, we checked out after 1 night and found a nearby budget hotel for a better price with much better accomodations. If you look around, I'm sure you can find a better deal somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, laid back, great value!”
Reviews.Author: redeemed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on late evening arrival. The trip from the airport was less than fifteen minutes and we were to our room within 5 minutes of pulling up to our resort. We stayed in a standard garden view room- 3rd floor corner with vaulted ceiling and windows on 3 sides of the room-plantation shutters kept the light out. Furnishings were older but not in bad shape. Sheets were nice quality. Room was clean. Resort grounds were lovely and sedate-very nice to wake up to on our first morning in Maui. Coffee available in open air lobby in morning- and able to use wi-fi there as well. Drove into Kihei about 5 minutes away to have breakfast at diner.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Garden View Suites are terrible!”
Reviews.Author: happytrails094
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Aston Maiu Lu was rather disappointing. We took advantage of a 'sale'. The rooms looked absolutely nothing like the pictures on the Internet site. The 'Standard Garden View' suites which we stayed in are in serious need of demolition. Several 'bandaid fixes' have been done which only make it worse. It appears nothing has been updated since the early 60's. The tub and shower were repainted once but the paint has partially worn off to reveal all of the scrapes,gouges and layers of badly placed grout. The shower head was not attached to the wall. The walls in the bedroom have been textured so they collect dirt. Several hucks in the baseboards, hastily patched, then roughly painted over. Around the perimeter of the hotel area are numerous empty, unusable buildings in various stages of degradation. I have to admit the employees at the hotel did their best to accommodate us and gave us a better room for the last two nights but the very old parts of the facility need to be demolished and rebuilt.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful outside ocean and garden views but old and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: ilikerobot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived in a ocean view loft room for a short vacation there. Outside garden and ocean view was very beautiful. We took a lot of pretty good pictures in the yard in front of the 2-story walk-up hotel building with garden and ocean as background. The hotel price was quite cheap but the building was ugly and the room was dirty. Staying there for short time is ok but if for long time not to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: godserver1
Reviews.Content: Maui is a beautiful island and Maui Lu is very simple, nice hotel. It's really beautiful to smell fresh plumeria when you leave your room. Little far away like a mile from all the ABC stores, shopping and restaurants. I swam at Kalepolepo Park with a nice lagoon close by, but if you want to surf you are couple of miles away from Kalama beach park or other parks.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Maui Lu is an affordable option if...”
Reviews.Author: MsBlondo
Reviews.Content: Aston Maui Lu is an affordable option if you're visiting Maui, located at the northern part of Kihey its directly accross from a quiet beach and a close drive to more popular beaches like the Kamaole's. There is plenty to do in Kihei however if you want to drive to Lahaina it's only about half an hour of beautiful coast and sugar cane fields in driving distance. You can also easily get to the road to Hana and to Kaanapali from here although the drive is a little longer. The staff at Maui Lu is very friendly and accommodating and the grounds are beautiful and well maintained. You can easily imagine Hawaii in it's 60's hay day when you're on the lush grounds of the Maui Lu surrounded by dark wood construction and banana trees. The pool here is no frills and not heated, but youre in Maui! Why go to the pool?!? Seriously, take my word for it and hop on down to Kamaole II or III, or grab a guidebook and go to the hidden gems in South Maui, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Could be nicer without the bugs”
Reviews.Author: freckles_44
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were given een upgrade for free. Booked and payed for standard garden view, but got superior garden view. on request we got the room on the first floor so we could walk into the garden from our room. If you book the standard garden view......it has no lanai/balcony. So we were very lucky to be upgraded for free. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. First time we walked into the room we were very surprised. The room was very big and clean. Clean towels and service every day. If you leave a good tip you also get coffee for the coffemaker. You can buy coffee at reception for 1 dollar so that's a good deal also. There is laundry fascility but it is in a rundown shack. $ 1,25 for washing. Detergent at reception for $1 Soon we discovered roaches outside. The terras has carpeting and they were under the carpets. A day later we discovered roaches inside the room. There were cracks in the floor so roaches had in and out privileges to our room. At that time you don't sleep that much anymore. The place could do with renovation. The property it self is fine. Nice pool, good temperature to cool down. Be sure to leave nothing of value in your room. Property is fenced but not guarded. There is an entrance from the streets straight into the back gardens. Checkout time is noon. If your flight is later they will accomodate you for free till 2 pm. You can still use fascilities for the remainder of the day. Free wifi in the lobby. In our room we had some signal just enough to have internet. Free complimetary internet check in and printing boardingpasses at the reception. If you want luxury go somewehere else. If you are on a low budget and if you're not afraid of bugs it's oke.

Reviews.Title: “Initially disappointing but relaxing, no pressure.”
Reviews.Author: ctuna
Reviews.Content: From the road looks impressive until you notice the wing that is abandoned. Not sure if this place is on the way back up or postponing the slide to oblivion. Rooms are decent size but looked good 20 years ago with the 70's countertops, bathroom tile, and carpet that has seen better days. Pool is nice. Area is very quiet so I slept very well. Staff is pleasant and they don't bother you except for the concierge calling the first morning. Very relaxed atmosphere but not very tempting to hang around in the room which isn't what you came to Maui for anyway. Spacious grounds so you don't end up feeling cramped which can definitely happen, even at far more expensive places. A short drive or significant walk to most of the restaurants along the Kihei "strip". Good access to a quiet section of beach just across the road. Parking was easy. Wi-fi access was OK with a few periods of downtime but I'm not sure it was the hotels, possibly you might have nothing or even worse. In a way it was good, like a dependable old used car. If that's your budget and style great. If you're looking for that fantastic once in a life trip to impress your significant other. I thnk you might want to keep shopping. Recommended because I like dependable old used cars, even if they have some dents and dings.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu - Decent Hotel for Budget Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Nogoodscreenamesleft
Reviews.Content: I originally booked a standard room and upgraded to a garden view room with a lanai when I got to the hotel for check-in. I chose a ground floor room so I could sit out on the lanai and enjoy the beautiful grounds at the Maui Lu. The standard rooms appear to be in one of the old, original buildings, and I think I made a wise choice in the upgrade. The charged me a ridiculously low upgrade fee. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and the room was comfortable and clean. The pool was very nice and clean. The tour planning person on-site, Mary, was very knowledgeable and helpful getting my adventures booked. I think some of the bad reviews were from people expecting this to be the Hyatt or Marriott, which it definitely isn't, but the amount I paid, it was just fine. The hotel is old and there were some minor maintenance issues, but I had a comfortable bed, a refrigerator, a couch, and a table with chairs. If you are looking for a luxurious resort in Hawaii, this isn't it. If you are looking for an inexpensive, comfortable place to sleep while adventuring around Maui, this is the place. I have no major complaints at all about my stay at the Aston Maui Lu.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the online reviews led on!”
Reviews.Author: Desaray
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot about the hotel from online reviews "unclean, not next to the beach, bad service......etc". I'm not sure where those people are used to staying but this place was awesome. It is across the street from the beach, and its a beautiful walk across their park-like front lawn to the sandy beach surrounded in palm trees. The rooms were basic but just what you need to sleep and stay in, since a vacation is mostly outside the hotel room anyway - atleast we hope. The hosts were wonderful and made us feel very welcome with their Aloha spirit. They came in daily and vacuumed up the sand we brought in on our dirty feet. The grounds are beautiful! If you have to have ocean view, then pay for it. Otherwise if you just need a place to rest your head at night after touring all day, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: millionado
Reviews.Content: Folks, we had a great time staying at the Maui Lu. Jody always made sure our stay was pleasant. If we had a problem with something either she would fix it or find a solution. Where ever we travel somewhere we always like to stay either where the local hang out or live, and the Mui Lu fit our expectation. You tend to appreciate your surrounding and learn so much about the culture. The Maui Lu is by no means located by the expensive resort but it has it's own character. The location of the resort is surrounded by different restaurants and there is Safeway Supermarket not too far from the Maui Lu. There is also a flea market about one mile away from the resort which we truly enjoyed. Near the resort on the main highway there is a store that sells bathing suits at a discount. My wife spent $100 and bought two outfits. If we did not stay at the Maui Lu, we would not have the experience of the flea market, and outlet stores and other things as well. If you do not stay at the Maui Lu, you truly will not appreciate the culture of Maui. Sure you can stay at one of those expensive resort and lay around the beach, but you would not experience the culture, the store and the events. Oh! by the way, since we stayed at this resort, we had more money to do things. Not like the big resort you spend all your cash and just lay around the beach, and not experience anything.We shall always return to the Maui Lu when we visit Maui. The Maldonado Family

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfy, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Virginia2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Lu for 3 nights this past July and had a wonderful stay. My son was with me. We arrived at the hotel sometime in the early afternoon so we drove to the hotel to see about early check-in. Our room was ready so they checked us in. The personnel at the front desk were great. Our room was an ocean view & was very close to the beach. It almost seemed like an ocean front. Our room had 2 comfortable queen size beds, a small fridge, a coffee pot and a wall air conditioner. The tub had 2 chips in it and the bathroom could use some updating. However, like many others have said we didn't come to Maui to spend the time in our room. We were on the go - off to Haleakala, to Kamaole Beach & Makena Beach, to Paia, to the Iao Needle, snorkeling, etc. The location of the Maui Lu is excellent for driving to all of those locations. There are also many restaurants & eateries in Kihei that only took a few minutes to drive to. Some favorites were Fat Daddy's BBQ, the Pupu Lounge & Coconuts Fish Cafe ( have the fish sandwich with Mahi). Another plus is that parking is free & there are no resort fees. It's an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “A great and afforable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nursejeanie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Aston Maui Lu for a week in Kihei. The location was extremely beautiful, very quiet, and almost like having a private beach. We did have to drive for meals but it was worth it to have so much privacy in this quiet area.Enjoyed our refrigerator for drinks, and other food was kept there. Had a coffee pot in the room but only free coffee the first day and needed to pay for it after that. The suite we had had an ocean view from 3 sides, including from our lofted bedroom window, as our room was on the end of our building in room 617 on the second floor. We also had a very comfortable king size bed. Only heard our neighbors one evening on a Saturday night, but they quit by 11pm. We loved the old Hawaiin charm of the whole place, including the pretty garden side across the road. Our cove was amazing and we enjoyed getting our Maui sun there everyday, not to mention our walk on the beach too! We did use the pool the first day, which was clean and very pretty, but the cove had loungers and was very quiet! The activities desk was very helpful to set up tours, but I wouldn't do that too soon as you will discover you can do most anything on the island for free! We did book a luau which was amazing, for the Feast at Lele! But as far as the resort itself, I would stay there again in a minute and do highly recommend it for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Trompe_Le_Monde
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is an older hotel and the rooms are a bit dated....but who cares when you can hear the waves from your window and the beach is 50 feet away? If you want resort amenities and plush furnishings this is probably not the place for you - if you want an excellent, peaceful location and want to save your money for activities and eating out and want a place to crash at the end of a fun-filled day the aston maui lu offers good value for money. Our room had a great view of the ocean an sunsets, and the nearby beach was perfect for a morning swim and snorkel. The service was friendly, grounds are very pretty and they have a huge pool. There were a few negatives - the parking lot by the ocean front rooms was very tight (but there was always a free spot), the tub needed replacing (though water pressure was fine) and there was no wireless in the room (you can get it in the lobby), although I found if I positioned myself in a certain part of the room I could connect. But then, you didn't come to Maui to spend your time checking out facebook. Really recommend spending the extra money for the ocean front rooms - worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “You travel to see places, not the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shimmie77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a trip to Maui, Hawaii and stayed at the Aston Maui Lu. We found a great deal through Travelzoo & Apple Vacations, did some research on Maui and the Aston Maui Lu, and decided to book it. This hotel is very basic; it reminded my husband and I of military lodging. It was clean, had a small fridge and a coffee maker. The room also had a small safe (we used this the entire trip) and it was great. We were offered a room on the ocean side for a slight upcharge, but stayed with a regular room to cut down on cost. We were located right by the pool, which was nice to hang out at when we were done snorkeling/beaching for the day. Everyone who works there was very friendly and helpful. Our flight wasn't until 10 pm on our last day. We were given a late check out, hung out at the pool, and the woman at the desk offered us a room to shower and freshen up in before we left for the airport. The Aston Maui Lu is not a five star resort. If you are going to Hawaii to hang out at a hotel, or you are high maintenance, then this isn't your kind of hotel. Maui is a huge island, and there are plenty of resorts there to cater to that. A few things to do when you are there... Snorkel Honolua Bay - just bring your bags with you (leave nothing in your car and your doors unlocked). We saw tons of sea turtles here! Just be sure to go early; it gets crowded! Makena Bay - this is only about 10 minutes from Aston Maui Lu, we saw turtles here too! Places to Eat Makena Grill Coconuts Sansei (awesome sushi) Mama's Fish House (a bit pricey, but a great meal) Fred's Mexican Grill for Breakfast - we had french toast with toasted macadamia nuts, bananas, pineapple and coconut syrup - YUM! We purchased the book, Maui Revealed, which went into great detail about everything on the island. Definitely worth the money!! Good luck & enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Don't use reservationcounter.com”
Reviews.Author: ricesticks
Reviews.Content: When I booked w/ reservationcounter.com they had no knowledge of the reservation. It took 1.5 hours of refaxing the reservation which appeared with the Expedia logo and nothing else (we didn't use Expedia). The reservation form had no contact number, we had to go back online to fine one. The reservation person at reservationcounter.com told us they would email a refund which never arrived in the mail or via email. This is the worst online company I have ever dealt with. If you get redirected to reservationcounter.com go somewhere else or call the hotel directly. The hotel was ok, run down, but friendly w/ a good location and pool, but the fact we were in Hawaii w/out a room to go to after we pre-paid it was more than frustrating, it was infuriating. I will never use reservationcounter.com again and am sceptical about all online bookings not. Hotels.com has always been OK, don't use anything else!!!! Where's my refund??????????

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mynanna
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Hawaii and at a Aston Hotel. We found the Maui Lu to be everything we expected and more. There is an older part of the hotel (garden view) but we moved to ocean front and found it lovely. Parking is tight, but location is great. We found that having Calvary Chapel church on location was wonderful. Would definately stay again. We just needed a clean comfortable place to lay our heads - nothing fancy, this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “In Love with the Maui Lu!!!”
Reviews.Author: MistyAdams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 days at the Maui Lu at the end of March/ beginning of April and loved it! After reading some of the previous reviews, we were nervous about our room but decided to go and check things out for ourselves, and we are so glad we did! Our room was not the most elegant, but we very much enjoyed the polynesian feel. The grounds were beautiful, including the pool, on-site church where we enjoyed Easter Sunday service, and lobby. Our room was a short walk from the private beach, where we enjoyed peace and quiet without any interruptions. We were typically able to enjoy the beach alone or with very few other guests, unlike many of the popular tourist areas. The resort was only a couple miles from the touristy beaches and restaurants, making it the perfect location for us. Down the street from the Maui Lu is a wonderful farmer's market, where we stocked up on local fruits and baked goods to keep in our room. On top of all the perks, the price was great! We would definitely recommend the Aston Maui Lu to anyone going to Maui to enjoy the island and to spend time together. Those travelers who are looking for a first class luxurious resort or those wanting to spend their entire vacation in their room may be disappointed. We look forward to our next trip very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Azure7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this Hotel. The location is great. The Staff was very accomodating. The grounds are beautiful Short steps to the beach, especially if you have a ocean view room. Very quiet enviornment, non-touristy and homey atmosphere. We stayed two extra days and made reservations for a 2011 stay. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “huge relaxing lawns, early '60s style tourist-polynesian”
Reviews.Author: zakthor
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a week here, then backed out after reading the reviews here. Last 3 days on Maui we planned to use our nose to find a good place and stopped in at Maui Lu. We ended up staying all 3 days here. Place was built in late 50s or early 60s. Property was nearly sold to Marriot for condo development in 2007, but deal fell through at last moment. There is a main building thats now used by a church "Calvary Church", a sunday school, a hula school. There are two entire wings that have been abandoned to nature, the railings are collapsing and are uninhabitable. There are 7+ villa-bungalow things that also are mostly collapsed on themselves and uninhabitable. Then there is a wing by the pool thats in good shape. There are also "ocean view" buildings that are recently renewed. They are in better shape but there's quite a bit of road noise, and the view's not that important for us. The main property is so great and special, we prefer it to the beach. We had a ground floor room 173. 2 Queen beds, fridge, lanai that looked out on the back yard (acres of grass and tennis courts, then a fence and residential neighborhood beyond). Kids loved the green grass to play catch and run in the sprinklers. The big pool is in the shape of Maui. The night we arrived there was a Luau, tons of guests in full Hawaiian regalia, guys with matching hawaian print shirts, shorts AND shoes. Fire dance, hula girls, cheesy luau MC "any anniversaries this evening..." Couples hula, kids hula, guys from audience hula with the hula girls, fun for all. Kids STUNNED and amazed and enchanted. Old school hawaii tourist. Fun for all as we watched from the pool area (along with the hotel staff). Price was very reasonable, <$90/night. The lobby is pretty neat, there is wifi there. Free coffee too. There is a beach across the street by the Ocean Front rooms, but its small and not that exciting. None of the better beaches are nearby (we liked Charlie Young), you need a car to get to them (> 1 mile). There is no restaurant. If you are considering this place in 2010, don't be alarmed by some of the bad reviews. A comfortable place in Kihei is an anomoly for me, so finding it at $90/night is a great value. Enjoy it before its redeveloped to match the rest of Kihei/Wailea. Stay here you have an entire city block of private maintained grounds to play on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maui Lu - Stay here and enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: margretasmom
Reviews.Content: We loved the Maui Lu! We spent 2 weeks in one of the Ocean Front rooms and could not have been happier. Every morning we went and ate our Costco muffins on what felt like our own private beach. The views were wonderful. We watched whales from the beach and from our lanai. We watched tiny crabs one morning on the beach and one day my husband even saw some fishermen bring in a stingray caught in a net and free it at the beach. The room was clean as clean could be - no bugs ever and we stayed 14 nights and had food everyday in the room. The fridge was much bigger than we expected and we kept a gallon of milk, a large carton of juice, several sodas, yogurts and 3-4 leftover cartons in it all the time. We would re-heat with the microwave in the lobby and the staff could always get us forks or knives as we needed them. It was an older room but we were in Maui - never in the room, I think we turned the tv on once in 2 weeks. Staying here let us extend our stay in Maui from 10 days to 14 days for the same price. We wouldn't give up those extra four days to stay at the 4 Seasons. The pool which we had read so many bad comments about is AMAZING. My kids are both competition swimmers and this pool is over 25 yards long. It is not a lap pool as it is shaped like the island of Maui, and it is not for young kids as it gets very deep. It was clean and clear and wonderful. Another very cool feature of this hotel was that they had a big "sharing" box by the front desk. You could leave things like boogie boards or coolers or extra suntan lotion when your trip was over. And use things others had left while you were there. We never bought the bamboo mats for the beach as there were always 3-4 in the box. We were too busy to do many of the craft projects offered, but the one we did was fun and low key and very Aloha. Bottom line: if you want a clean room with beautiful views and a great location stay at the Aston Maui Lu!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maui Lu- Great Value-Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: shasta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Maui Lu the first two weeks in February. My sister and her husband also had a room. We loved the Maui Lu. From the beautiful sprawling grounds, to the recently renovated pool, to our rooms which were large and comfortable. Our â€œOcean Frontâ€� room was large with new paint and carpet. We had a great view of the daily Humpback Whale show out in the bay. The room contained a small fridge and coffee maker along with all of the typical amenities. Two double beds, Table and chairs. There were chaise lounges and chairs for sitting outside. My sister somehow lucked out and got a suite which is twice the size of a regular room. Her two room suite had a small kitchen/dining area with a microwave, two TVâ€™s, a couch, two lanais. She paid the same price as we did- $113.00/nt The grounds are beautiful and the pool is fantastic. The area around the pool is very nice with plenty of chaises and chairs. The pool is very large and I had it to myself every morning for my daily swim. By my measurements itâ€™s about about 58 lengths at the longest point for a mile. I would finish my swim about dawn â€“what a wonderful way to start the day on those beautiful grounds. The beach area just out from our rooms was small, but doable. It is a beautiful area with kite surfers and wind surfers are in abundance. They provide propane BBQâ€™s if you feel like running over to Safeway and grabbing some surf and turf â€“which we did a couple of times. To conclude, our stay at the Maui Lu was fantastic. The front desk, housekeeping and grounds personnel were all very helpful and nice. The room was great, bedding was nice, everything worked properly, my sisterâ€™s room upstairs was even better. From some other reviews posted apparently rooms on the mountain side of the road have not been or are the process of being updated. Our room had fresh paint and carpet. The bedding was nice, towels ok, absolutely no bugs. Every interaction with hotel personal was a very positive one. They went the extra mile to be helpful. Iâ€™ll stay here next time weâ€™re on Maui. I think next time weâ€™ll get an upstairs room, hopefully the suite my sister had. We wanted to be able to walk right out of a ground floor room to the beach and grass areas,this time, which is nice, but next time I think it would be nice to be up and leave the sliding glass door open all night and itâ€™s a bit more private upstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu is one of the older properties in the Kihei area. Primarily for travelers on a tight budget not needing much in the way of amenities. I do recommend the Maui Lu, but you need to understand that the property is a bit run down, rough and grungy around the edges, however, the staff are very nice, kind and helpful. Aston recently took over the property from ResortQuest Hawai'i and is in the process of upgrading the facilities...but slowly. Most of the property, including the pool, checkin, tour desk and rooms are on one side of the road through Kihei, and the beach, along with 3 beachfront buildings are on the other side of the road. We stayed in an oceanfront room right next to the sea, if we had been any closer to the ocean we would've been wet. Our room was spacious and clean, although in need of some rehab; the bed was comfortable and housekeeping stopped by most days. The view from our lana'i was splendid, a public beach with views of KahoÊ»olawe and Molokini on one side, the West Maui Mountains and Lana'i on the other, and the vast expanse of the ocean spread out in front of you. For the money you could not beat our location and views. On 2 different days we saw a number of Humpback whales breaching off in the distance just off the coast from Lahaina Town. Awesome! The Aston Maui Lu is an average, low-end property, but with an oceanfront room at an outstanding price, it was well worth it! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sad experience”
Reviews.Author: AthensSoloist
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Aston Maui Lu Resort. We had booked an ocean front room, and they gave us indeed a two level room, with a magnificent view. But other than that, the room as well as the rest of the hotel was falling apart. Where to start from? Room: at the lower level (sitting area and bathroom) the sofa had breadcrumbs on it and was so filthy, that we had to ask for a bedsheet to cover it, in order to be able to sit on it. There was a mini fridge and coffee/tea making facilities, but there were ants crawling everywhere. Again we called the maid and asked her to spray for the ants. The bathroom was just basic, the shower curtain old, the filter of the hairdryer covered with mold and again, ants were everywhere on the cheap formaica around the sink. The upper level (sleeping area) was good but ants (far less than in the lower level) were there too. The two a/c units were loud and their outer parts so filthy that you think twice before using them. Paint is peeling everywhere, wall papers and carpets look dirty... what a shame!! We complained about the ants the next morning and the hotel manager came to reassure us that they would take care of it. We returned in the afternoon, only to find the ants in our room alive and kicking! Plus the people who where supposed to clean the room had unplugged the fridge by mistake, and next morning the carpert in front of the fridge was soaking; that's how we found out. Overall, the view was great, and the bedsheets were soft, but that's all there is to it. Service: the hotel offers no breakfast, not even with an extra cost. There is free coffee, hot water, a toaster and a microwave available for use. So make sure you bring everything you need for your breakfast -plates, forks, mugs and something to eat. All there is around the coffee machine is a bowl with sugar / creamer (thank God in individual portions, because the bowls are filthy as well). There is an activities desk by the reception; we booked our whale watching trip there. Grounds: the grounds are well kept, and the sitting area in front of the reception is inviting. But right behind it, there is an abandoned building with broken windows -probably it used to be part of the hotel- and you don't even want to think how dirty this must be. Location: you definitely need a car as the hotel is located at the very beginning of Kihei, away from any restaurant, super market etc. Plus there are signs around the hotel, warning you that "you enter the sea at your own risk", therefore the beach ther might not that inviting (we did not try it). As a last comment, go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice front staff”
Reviews.Author: kimmy1965reefer
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at The Lu and we were just as happy with it this time as last. Jennifer and Jaquie were friendly and greeted us warmly with big smiles as soon as we approached the desk. The rooms are far from fancy but are very clean with comfortable beds. The grounds are lovely and the pool is very clean. The only drawback is that the rooms do not have kitchens so eating out is more frequent. They do have a breakfast sitting area where coffee is waiting. We usually stay with a large group of friends in a private home but we always fly in a day ahead of them so that we have one day to unwind..we'll be at The Lu for that day agasin next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: kmcd1114
Reviews.Content: This hotel could definately use some updating, however for the price it is a good hotel. Hotel staff were very nice, & the beach across the street is beautiful. Only real problem was the air conditioner in the room was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room right on the ocean for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Electraglide_rider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Ocean view room in the 500 building at the Aston Maui Lu for 5 days and thought it was better than expected and was quite pleased when entering the room. Quite large with a very cool upstairs bedroom-loft that had a very comfortable queen bed. We had a wonderful view of the Pacific with the other end of Maui in the background. Absolute stunning!!! Sliding Glass door leads to the balcony that had 2 chairs for enjoying the sunsets. Had a Nice little beach cove right there between our building and the 400 building. Now I have seen some reviews about this place needing up dated and if your coming to Hawaii to hang out in the room, well you might want to go fancier. Now if your like us... We wanted a clean room, in a great location to sleep and shower and leave our luggage while we go out and enjoy the most beautiful place on earth, this is your place. I mean who cares if it looks like its still the 90's. It was clean, and house keeping done a great job everyday. (tip your housekeepera couple bucks). Had free parking in a small lot right there. My next trip to Maui I will stay here again. Now Get This.... when we went to check out we asked about how we could print our boarding passes, I was pointed to 2 computers that for FREE I could print them.. Again for FREE. Well the website that they go through was having some problem, so the general manager took us into his office and personally printed them for us. I was very impressed, because he dropped what he was doing to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but beautiful locale”
Reviews.Author: WarmBeachWoamn
Reviews.Content: We booked our entire travel package with Pleasant Hawaiian Holidays. Once at our hotel, we upgraded to a beach side, upstairs room. The room was clean and only basically furnished, BUT had a kitchenette and a balcony overlooking our private cove/beach just actual feet from out building. PERFECT. Eating on the islands can be pricey. So, aside from our now and then fancy meal out, we cooked and ate inexpensive local fish. We had a huge bedroom, livingroom, diningroom and bath. The afternoon trade winds lulled me to sleep as I lay on the couch reading, in front of the huge sliding doors off the balcony every day. Would not have traded any of it. The room was basic, yet perfect. Slept like a baby in the comfy king bed. Spent the rest of the time out of doors enjoying all the island had to offer. If you are expecting something glamorous, this is not it. Basic, clean, good location and comfortable - Absolutely. Pool was in the shape of mMaui, was a little on the chilly side and kida cheesy. Only used it once with the Pacific at our feet; who really needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service on a very nice property right near the beach”
Reviews.Author: numanuma99
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted with a friendly smile and a fast, easy check in. The hotel is located on a beautiful coconut grove with birds, flowers and even a couple of cute gecko's. There is a nice courtyard with a Maui shaped swimming pool bordered by more swaying coconut trees, lounge chairs and even a little picnic spot with a BBQ. The rooms are motel style, older and non fancy - but they are comfortable and clean. You can choose from ocean front rooms or the standard garden view (which is where we stayed) Although the rooms are no frills, you still have everything you need - air conditioning, cable TV, full bathroom, Bar Fridge, phone, daily maid service and large table with chairs. If you are not looking for the 5 star high maintenance pampering, than this hotel is absolutely wonderful. The hotel also offers free classes for hotel guests including, Ti leaf lei's, Coconut leaf headbands and Hula Lessons (all of which include wonderful history lessons about Hawaii) The staff at the Maui lu were absolutely amazing to us, friendly, helpful and always had a big smile on their face - they even gave us a free late check out, 2pm instead of 11am! I definitely recommend this place to laid back, fun people who will really appreciate the simple beauty of this older hotel - if you like great service, cozy rooms and a private beach just steps away, than stay at the MAUI LU!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend - Enjoy the little time you will spend in the room and don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: SDLAKERFANS
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend the Maui Lu hotel to anyone. Yes, you can get a good deal on price but you get much less than what you're expecting. My husband and I got the cheapest available room, and it was the worst place I have ever stayed in. Room 103, bottom floor. I have stayed in hostels in Europe in my early 20's that were cleaner than the Maui Lu. The foul, moldy odor is clear as soon as you approach the door to the room and will come home with you on your luggage and all of your belongings. Have a bottle of Febreeze handy as soon as you get home. The AC unit barely affected just the corner it was in, and the wooden housing holding it outside the window was completely covered in mold (look at the ones on higher levels and it's not as bad). The only bug bites I got in Maui were from the room. I wouldn't walk around barefoot on that carpet either. The blankets were the worst! All bedspreads are typically not comfy, but the "blanket" was like sleeping with a brillo pad (wire mesh sponge). And the bathroom was bad. From the slanted formica counter top, to the power outlet at the top of the mirror that didn't work, the most horrible part of the bathroom was that the shower had one of those "bed sheet on a curtain rod" things where you're showering and desperately trying to avoid the wet curtain touching your body. We left our room early in the morning each day, and got back late each night but the little time we did spend in the room was disgusting. And who can forget the lovely abandoned hotel building on one end of the property, with some boarded windows and some broken, and big holes in the wall where you can see tables and chairs in the room, and the marks where the staircase used to be. I believe even a homeless person wouldn't want to squat in one of those units. And the location is not great if you plan on hanging out in Kihei. Yes, there's a small private beach right across the street but most guidebooks don't suggest swimming anywhere there until you get to Kamaole Beach I because of the cleanliness of the water and the seaweed issues. All of what you want to be close to in Kihei is not near the Maui Lu. You'll have to drive atleast 2 miles down Kihei Road to get to anything worthwhile (except Oceans and Homemaid Cafe are closer than 2 miles). If you are looking for a great deal on price, and the Maui Lu is what you're finding, look for the next cheapest deal. The Maui Lu is not worth the little you may pay for the room. And upgrading to an Ocean View room when you're there may not be worth it when you consider other hotels with slightly higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Great Location,but the rooms Need Updating.”
Reviews.Author: AllanRuth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The location was just across the street from the beach, we were there Saturday night and there was a real nice church next door that we attended. The Wifi works in the rooms if you have a room close to the office. There is a breakfast area behind the office with WiFi access if your room is to far away. They do provide a continental Breakfast. The staff were very nice and and quck to help with any problems. Good water pressure and good hot water. The only down side was that the rooms need up dating and could use a little scrubbing. The pool is also dated and hard to get into even with the handrails. If you can overlook a dated room, this is a nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Too Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Fish_On_Man
Reviews.Content: Our biggest frustration with this hotel was the comfort of the showers. All we wanted was a comfortable place to crash at the end of a fun day on Maui. Our first night was in room 161 a "superior" room, and the shower temp fluctuated between as cold as the ocean to hot enough to scald you, and the fluctuations were very frequent. We got moved to a different lower grade room where the fluctiuations were not as fequent or extreme, but still kind of annoying. That being said, we feel that the staff were curteous and polite, and while a litte run down the rooms were clean an comfortable (except for the shower).

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Alaska_senior
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu isn't luxurious, but it's clean and comfortable. We were right on the beach and listened to the surf every night. The room had a good refrigerator, so we enjoyed lots of local fruit. The staff was great, especially during the sunami alert. The only negative was the tiny parking lot, but they can't really help that.

Reviews.Title: “The Maui Lu made for an AWESOME vacation!”
Reviews.Author: djSunSeeker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently had a wonderful stay at the Aston Maui Lu while on vacation, and as a result I feel compelled to address some of the negative comments posted on trip advisor. The Maui Lu is a lovely yet affordable â€œOld Hawaiiâ€� hotel with 28 acres on which to walk around, a nice partially shaded pool (in the shape of Maui!), two private cove beaches and some sublime ocean front rooms. It is also perfectly situated in North Kihei making it the perfect base for exploring the entire island. That all said, the Maui Lu isnâ€™t really a â€œresortâ€� as the sign says. Itâ€™s more like a hotel with some good perks. Anyone expecting the fake Hawaii of the Grand Wailea or the Four Seasons should certainly STAY AWAY. Youâ€™ll certainly be disappointed and then ruin the vibe for everyone else. The building is definitely older and the dÃ©cor is rustic, but that does NOT mean itâ€™s run down or dirty. The rooms are clean and the staff are attentive and friendly. My partner and I shelled out a bit extra for an oceanfront room and we are so glad we did. A tip when booking: ask for the ocean front rooms in the 400 block (best views, I mean itâ€™s ridiculously beautiful) or the 500 block (almost as good as the 400). We vacationed in February when the Humpback whales fill the bay, and we could actually see them breach and slap their tails on the water from our patio. The front lobby on the main grounds has WiFi (not in the rooms, but arenâ€™t you on vacation to get away from all that?), and an activity desk where they can arrange and book outings for you at no extra charge. The other guests were so relaxed and happy to be in such peaceful surroundings. Two different couples told us how they love this place so much they come back every year. Iâ€™m glad to proclaim that I look forward to adding myself to that lucky list.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: LoisP4
Reviews.Content: Central to everything....nice place to crash after a day of touring. Nothing fancy, but we didn't want fancy. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately use this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: glb615
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have stated, the building itself could use updating and refurbishing. Our room was a very spacious hotel room with a king bed, couch, glass-topped coffee table, air conditioner, table with 2 chairs, an over-sized apartment fridge, safe ( extra cost ), a dresser and 2 night stands with a full-sized bathroom. There was a lanai with 2 chairs with a small side table outside a large sliding glass patio door that had very heavy curtains covering them. The front desk staff were outstanding. Plenty of extra towels and good advice. The housekeeping staff did a marvelous job, discreet and honest (can't say that about all the hotels we've stayed in). Way to go Elsa and Ann Mae!! There was a Maui-shaped pool, on-site laundry, grill, free parking and beach-side rooms available at the Aston Maui Lu There was a 3 - 5 min. walk to the CUTEST beach across the road. Plenty of dining choices 2 - 15 min. down the road in Kihei and all the beauty that is available on Maui. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money ... If you are there to see the Island stay here!”
Reviews.Author: batman521
Reviews.Content: What a terrific hotel / resort value. This represents the ideal balance between luxury and value in a wonderful older facility. The staff was always courteous and conversational. The location is terrific because you are located in the center of everthing on the island. There are two small beaches which, while public, are pretty much there for the use of the Maui Lu's residents. We stayed in the Ocean view rooms and to look out on the ocean was a delight. I would strongly endorse this resort to anyone looking to tour the island and needing comfortable and centrally located hotel. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “"Simply Awesome Hospitality!"”
Reviews.Author: kolohe24
Reviews.Content: We had very bad experiences with other businesses prior to check-in at the Aston Maui Lu.Lost luggage,restrictions on obtaining our rental car that we already paid for a month in advance,and being late to a business appointment. Next stop the Maui Lu. The registration clerk at the time of check in greeted us with the biggest and warmest smile,superb customer service and such compassion to our earlier experiences. We also had the pleasure of meeting Jodi she was the manager on duty.Again such great hospitality ,excellent customer service and very professional. Our entire stay at the hotel was outstanding,the amenities were on point,housekeeping wonderful and the room had such a beautiful view of Haleakala. Quiet and very peaceful perfect for a relaxing vacation. I know that just looking at pictures and reading comments on the internet about the Maui Lu does not serve this awesome resort justice you must go to Maui and stay at this resort and have a beautiful experience of your own.I know that compared to the Grand Wailea and its star ratings it may not compare but you cannot compare the hospitality,awesome customer service and overall island ALOHA that I experienced. And trust me we stayed at the Grand Wailea in the past Aston Maui Lu has it hands down for overall customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “My Fiance took me on my 1st Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: gromwolfhound
Reviews.Content: Hi Everyone! I am a 12 year US Army Vet, 10 Years DOD.....and have been to the "armpits" of the world. *It is very easy to find fault in "anything." WE wil be returning...God willing (I am now cancer free 2years 4 months) to be Married and stay at the Maui Lu again. The room we had was second floor end near parking lot....yes it is "vintage" and has a Cabin or lodge type ambience which is really neat. IF you want ritzy and a phony atmosphere and like to be seen.....don't go here and ruin the relaxing "be who you are atmosphere." We met song writers here, writers, executives of major companies, famous band members.......IT is a Laid back beautiful people & surroundings. *THE STAFF are the BEST in the world! They are Honest, Trustworthy, and Very helpful portraying the very culture of Hawaii. SERVICE Super, VERY Clean, Hey, YOU have your own PRIVATE beach/cove......location is super! You will get more from staying here...value wise, information, and to look up at the mountains surrounding you...spectacular. LOCATION is perfect....you travel in any direction very easily.....and the Hawaiin Culture (People) get to know them...some may be a little hesitant, but I tell you we were invited to peoples homes, gatherings.....just very kind people. If you are a "Rigid" person...please don't disturb others that frequent the Maui Lu, because they/us.....appreciate everything about it! The internet open lodge with lush tropical gardens surrounding it....the history.... *I do video and photography., Haz waste Mgt Emerg Response, Environmental Cleanups, Hvy Equip Op, Ocuupational Safety * Sugar Industry and like helping others especially Veterans (planning a Non Profit); my Fiance is a Director of Occupational Therapy - and if I can find a way to make a living on Mauii....we would be happy to live in a grass hut! The people and surroundings were like being in "Heaven" *Thank You Maui Lu! ****This is not a paid advertisement. ***If you want inside information on the most unique areas to see/visit please feel free to contact me. Ronnie" Cloudwalker" Collins gromwolfhound@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but needs update”
Reviews.Author: kabubu
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Aston Maui Lu was OK - I think for the price in that location, it is hard to find anything else. First the positives: the rooms were very clean, of a decent size, the grounds of the hotel are grand and beautiful and the hotel is centrally located in Kihei, right across the street from a little beach (but not near the best beaches in Kihei, which are further south), the pool looks very nice and the staff are very friendly and accomodating. On the downside, this hotel needs a major renovation and if you have stayed at other Aston properties (which we have), the state of the rooms may come as a bit of a shock. The carpets are worn out, the rooms are dark, the bathrooms smell musty, as does the air conditioning unit (so we didn't use it). We kept the balcony door open to get a breeze, but to really get air into the room we needed to open the front door, which we saw other people doing, as well. The walls are very thin - we could easily hear our next door neighbors (and some kind of band practice that took place in the main hotel building one morning at 7AM!?!). So, overall, this is not the kind of room that you want to spend any time in other than for sleeping. If the priority is saving money and being centrally located, this is a good place, but otherwise, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking ocean view...”
Reviews.Author: emailgreg
Reviews.Content: The resort is large, older yes but worth every penny. The rooms are very basic and classic so don't expect anything extravigant. This is no nonsense you get what you pay for rooms but the cleanliness, value and location are worth the great prices! Our room was on the main floor, opening our lania door we were on the grass which lead right up to a small beach, awesome view of the ocean and the mountain on Maui. The staff are extremely nice. It is a little far from restaurants and shopping so you would want to take the bus or rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time it was nice, not now.”
Reviews.Author: bilindarus
Reviews.Content: This place needs a lot of upgrading, its rundown and seedy. The photos on their website must be at least 30 years old. The linens were clean so was the pool and the ocean view was great, its a good place to go on the cheap. The main part of the resort and the pool are across the very busy Kehei Road, don't even think about sending the kids to the pool alone if you are by the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: KiminWNC
Reviews.Content: Our room had a sewer gas leak. They had to know about it because that bathroom had a freshner in it. The toilet seal was broken. We checked in, then went right out. Came back to sleep around 9pm and had to leave the room at 3am. I had a migraine the smell was so bad. When customer service got there that morning they did move our room but wouldnt comp the horrible night before. Traveolociy "guarantee" was NO HELP. The holtel and travelocity never did comp the night. The hotel thought they did enough moving our room. There is also very limited and very tight parking. You do walk right out of a lower room to the ocean but so do the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity”
Reviews.Author: TEA-fun-in-the-sun
Reviews.Content: I STAYED at the Maui Lu WITH FAMILY in separate rooms. The oceanfront rooms were wonderful. After swimming and activities in Maui, it was great to sit on the balcony and watch a beautiful sunset each evening. The sound of the waves were soothing and the breeze refreshing. The rooms were really clean and the staff is kind. You can play tennis, swim in either private cove or take a nice long refreshing stroll to the public beach for larger waves and oceanic activities. This location captures a beauty of Hawaii; It is breathtaking, and a great place for both families with children and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value”
Reviews.Author: parisbynite
Reviews.Content: July 23, 2009 You could not ask for a better oceanfront location. Yes, there are some drawbacks, but the Maui Lu is for the adventurous budget traveler. The staff move quickly and are friendly and open to accommodate your needs. Remember the word "Oceanfront" these are the choice rooms. Remember the names Scott and Jenn these are folks to help if you encounter problems. Don't wait till you get home let them know immediately so they can fix the wrong and make it right. From previous reviews and pictures we were prepared for an older property and, as such, found exploring the grounds, even in their well worn state, to be a part of the adventure. The age shows disrepair but also presents lots of old growth mango and plumeria trees on the property. You get a sense you are walking back in time. This Maui Lu she must have been someplace in her day. If you are seeking the likes of Wailea a drive further south would be mo betta.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: Moelise
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate opportunity to spend one night , June 22, 2009 (3 were booked) in this hotel. I have never stayed in a filthier place. When I drove up I thought there would be a problem, once I entered the elevator and smelled the mix of urine and vomit and saw the filth I knew this was not the place for me. My room was dirty, complete with cockroaches and the smell of decades of cigarette smoke and filth compiled. I was so concerned about sleeping in the bed I sprayed it with germ killer and wore socks along with my pajamas in bed. I checked out the next morning and am now dealing with horrible itchy bumps all over my arms, which were not covered by pajamas and have not gone away after 1-1/2 wks. I have a dermatologist appt on Tues! When you read this is a great hotel for budget travelers, beware. There were people lingering in bushes and hanging out in the parking lot at all hours of the night. I did not feel safe at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OregonBchtravlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. Luckily we stayed only one night, and then went to Napili for the remainder of our trip. It was so dirty, mildowy, bug ridden, old and falling apart I couldn't even fall asleep in this room. My girls swam in the murky pool and their hair turned instantly green! I am serious. They are both on the swim team and swim 4 days a week and never had green hair. Someone did not know how to manage the pool chemicals. It has taken a week to get the green out. Even my 9 year old was grossed out, and didn't like this hotel. It needs a TOTAL remodel. It has honestly run down, and nobody is investing in it's upkeep. The decor was out of 1981. THe TEENY tiny beach was non existent, and rocky. Wasn't even safe to swim in. Keep searching, there are a lot better places on Maui to stay. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: FloridaHarleygirl
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui on April 30th - May 9th....we have never been to Maui so we were clueless as to where to stay. The rates for the Maui Lu were great. The room was nice. We stayed in one of the ocean front room on the bottom floor. The room was very clean and well taken care of. We did have a problem with the room, it seems that a group of ladies booked the entire bottom floor and the hotel told us that we have the bottom floor for 3 days then we have to move upstairs! We did not want upstairs and we did not want to move. They wanted us to move on Sunday, we were married on Saturday. So we choose another room on the bottom floor in the other unit. Now that room was not very nice, it had a damp feel to it. So I called the desk again and YES there was a room in the original unit and we could move in the morning. The staff was great, they really went out of their way to make us happy, considering they gave our room away! The grounds are beautiful, the beach area is pretty. I miss my tree! The one cove has a bent palm tree that I sat on drinking my coffee in the morning while watching the water and enjoying the view. Now there is a 2 cup coffee maker and small fridge in the rooms along with ironing board, iron and blow dryer. The beds were comfortable and we did not see any critters in our room at all, but the view was amazing. So if you want to stay in a reasonable place that would be my choice and I would stay there again in the future. The downfall is the expense to eating out all the time, but hey your in Maui. so relax and enjoy. The office area of the hotel does have a microwave to use but if you stay on the oceanfront rooms you have to cross the street to use it. All in all and considering what we went through, I really enjoyed my stay at the Maui Lu and will go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aewsome place, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: aksleds
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed for 6 nights in May 2009 and what a deal! We saved some $ going with this resort and were kind of worried with some of the mixed reviews we read here but are so glad we stayed here now. After reading reviews here we were allready aware that this is not a "resort style" property. We opted to upgrade to their ocean front rooms for the addtitional $25 a night and were so pleased! There are no resturants or bars on the property but there is a small fridge in the room for drinks and small smacks, which worked out perfect for us. We made our own drinks at the hotel room while we enjoying the beach and a refill was less than 20yds away! The ocean front rooms are acroos the beach road from the main resort but we never even went to the main resort so we were cool with this. Everything you need is at the building, Ice, beach, nice patio. I highly recomend the ocean front rooms and ask for a lower unit so you can walk to and from beach and yard area freely. The grounds were clean, as is most of Hawaii, and the staff made check in and check out fast and easy. The room was as described in here not a 5 star hotel. More like a motel 6 or holiday inn quality but was roomy and the AC worked great, and the linens and restroom was very clean. We could not hear the traffic of the street as some here reported, it was nill and barely could hear it over the sounds of the crashing waves right outside the door! When I say you are on the beach with these rooms they are on the beach, less than 10 yds from the patio door is the ocean! We stayed in room 404. The hotel is located a little north of the busiest part of Kihei but we liked this also. Really quite and great beaches with hardly anyone ever on them. The hotel gives you that kind of condo feel seeing how you never have to get in an elevator, never have to worry about parking, and the patio leads straight out to the beach. The ocean front rooms have their own private parking lot so parking was easy and we were really close to the room. We highly recomend this hotel and have allready booked a return visit in August, we requested the same room and everything. I have allready recomended this to family and friends and feel we have found a great reasonable priced home in Hawaii from now on. Like I said if your looking for the "resort Style" vacation expierence, stay away from the Maui Lu as it's more of a laid back do it on your own style of resort. We loved the seclusion and the convience of this place and it really hlped to make our vacation stress free and relaxing. thanks again Maui Lu we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Dump beware”
Reviews.Author: bowery
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever seen. The "restaurant/bar" area building had long been closed down and the windows were boarded up. So we are at a RESORT without any services- no food no beverages! The pool was dirty and crumbling. The rooms had bugs and worn out furniture, Its not what a resort in Maui should be. It is more like a homeless shelter.

Reviews.Title: “I do not regret booking Maui Lu, satisfied client!”
Reviews.Author: spchik24
Reviews.Content: In the start of the booking process for Maui, we assumed that there couldn't possibly be any bad parts of the island and therefore we decided that we were going to book a less expensive, simple/basic place to stay. And all of that was true, every inch of that island is absolutely dreamy :) Maui Lu is really close to the OGG airport, about 10 miles away therefore it made it convenient. It is really close to everywhere considering Maui is really tiny so no need to worry, you're in the middle of everything! We wanted to invest more of our time and finances into field trips, exploring and activities within the island and that's the reason we were less picky about where we were going to stay. We got a deal for about $430 for 4 nights stay at the Maui Lu and 5 day car rental which is a STEAL DEAL! Trust me, you want to go to the Lu'aus and snorkling and whale watching and all of those goodies therefore the hotel is just for you to sleep, by the way we didn't even see the pool, u don't need the pool when you got a beach all around you! The people at the reception desk were super nice, and pleasant. tennis courts on the premise, internet, coffee and tea in the mornings. No room service! Go to the grocery store and stock up the fridge to save money! When you get a room, get the ocean view, our balcony faced the beach and it was very romantic.
