The rooms were in fine condition, you could tell they have not been renovated for while however it was nothing that bothered us. Don't leave the food out, you will get little ants coming in, remember we are surrounded by nature! The first time you go to Maui, I say if you're pocket is hurting a little and you want to get a good deal, Maui Lu will give it! Don't book it if it is your honeymoon or if you're taking a hot date because it will not impress her, but for an ordinary couple like us, like I said we were satisfied, no complaints/concerns, we recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Chelseak3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were flying standby and ended up in Hawaii one more night than we had planned. We had to find a new hotel to stay in for just one night and the Lu was the least expensive, so we got a room. The good thing about this place was that they upgraded us to an ocean front room, and it really was ocean front. 20 steps to the water. It was beautiful. Other than that, the hotel is really old like the others said and there were ants in the bathroom. Luckily we had thrown out all the food we had bought before coming here, otherwise I think the ant problem would have been 10 times worse. The staff works hard to make it clean, but it is so old, that it didn't seem very clean. My husband and I kept waking up in the night thinking there were bugs on us. There never was, but after seeing all the ants, we had a hard time relaxing there. The pool was nice and clean, and the grounds were gorgeous. Basically, we were fine staying here for one night, had we spent the entire week there, we would have been a little disgruntled I think. But you get what you pay for. We read some reviews about cockroaches, bed bugs, and mice. We didn't have any problems with any creatures besides ants. It was fine, if you are on a budget, you will be fine there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds, Rooms need serious remodeling.”
Reviews.Author: escondidomom
Reviews.Content: This is an ok place to stay on a budget if you don't plan on spending alot of time in your room. The rooms are old and outdated so if you're looking for luxury, this isnt the place. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are clean. The grounds are very nice and this place would be incredible if they remodeled it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice on a budget”
Reviews.Author: smithkr733
Reviews.Content: The ocean view and ocean front rooms are REALLY on the ocean. This is the place to go to see the whales in January and February. The rooms are nothing fancy and need an update, but the view is awsome and they do their best to take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC, but can be a great deal.”
Reviews.Author: glaciergirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed Jan. 1- 4th. This motel will be torn down soon, and it shows. While the grounds are well kept, the beds comfortable and the carpet fairly new, everything else was in serious need of an update. The furnishings were old and dingy, the wall paper stained, etc. We had a good time anyway. I just kept reminding myself of how much money we were saving! We had a special promotional rate for locals, so paid $75 per night. Our room was in one of beachside buildings, and had a small balcony with a nice view. The other guests were quiet and pleasant. The women at the front desk were very sweet. The room was clean and we didn't see any bugs or rodents. We had a small fridge, coffee maker, but no microwave. The private beach is so small that it almost disappears at high tide, so we drove south to get to larger beaches. The parking lot for the beach buildings is very tiny, so if it's full you may have to park across the street. I would stay here again, but I think next time we'll stay in one of their garden units across the street because they're a lot further from the road (less traffic noise) and even cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend this establishment”
Reviews.Author: JL007
Reviews.Content: I used resortquest Hawaii to book my stay. The hotel was older, which was not an issue. Overall the stay was okay because the hotel was centrally located. We had a rat in our room and we thought the resortquest website exaggerated. The oceanfront room we were supposed to have was fine, but the ocean was across the street. Overall, if you are looking for a cheap way to stay on Maui then this is your place. I would recommend something closer to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Maui Lu ***Not Closed*** as of 1/1/09”
Reviews.Author: fun4now
Reviews.Content: I just called the hotel because I found this hotel listed on several booking engines for Jan 13, 2009. The desk clerk says the November sale fell through and they are open for business. The only change in service is they no longer have a expedia booking desk in the lobby. The have great rates booking direct through ResortQuest.com! I just booked at $80 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Please don't close!”
Reviews.Author: mgevan
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Maui Lu for their last night November 9th for my finance's birthday! We had a great time, sure the rooms are a little dated but not dirty or anything close to it. We live here on Maui and got to check in by walking up around 2 pm. The 2 girls at the front desk were awesome!! They made us feel so welcome! I am so glad we stayed here and not at some stuffy condo or a hotel off the beach. We were able to get the Kaamaina rate ( locals rate) on an oceanview room as well, it really helped out. Then at the end they ended up upgrading us to a loft room probably 20 feet from the ocean! It was great!!! We have stayed in alot of hotels over the years and we both agreed it was one of our favorite hotel rooms. It had a large living room and the bedroom upstairs. They both had the greatest view of the ocean!! The pool area was nice too with lounge chairs and you could even bring your own cocktail with you to relax with by the pool! we would stay here again in a heartbeat and we really, really hope they don't close as we already want to go back next month!!!! Mahalo Maui Lu for making our stay and making my fiance's birthday even more special with all your person attention! Mahalo especially to the 2 girls at the front desk at check in they made the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Get There Quick: It's Closing in 3 weeks!”
Reviews.Author: kaukau
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Maui Lu Sept. 22 & 23, just to take advantage of the kama'aina (Hawai'i resident) rate of $81 a night, and because the property has been sold and will be closing in 3 weeks to be demolished and razed to the ground - a new time share to occupy the site - as reported in the Maui News on-line Oct. 10 edition. Suffice it to say that in my opinion it's about time; and in my wife's opinion it's way past time; to bid aloha o'e to the Maui Lu. So if you're determined to stay at the Maui Lu, do so now - as no reservations can be made after Nov. 11, 2008, the last day of busuness for the Maui Lu. Aloha o'e, Maui Lu. Aloha o'e.

Reviews.Title: “OK...Similiar to a run down Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: jdealman
Reviews.Content: I got my wife to agree to stay at this hotel due to the fact that I got a rate of $63 per night. If you are an airline employee they give you this rate with ID. I could not find any other rate close to this! We already used our Hhonors points for a full week at the Hilton Waikalea on the Big Island. The Hilton on Maui wanted over 70k points per night! Sure the two hotels were night and day. We were on a tight budget, and the cost for three nights here was equivalent to one night to the next competitor! I was prepared for the worst. My wife's family owned a one star family hotel in Idaho as a kid so she was open minded. I read the reviews and thought this could not be that bad for $63 a night! The grounds are actually well kept. The pool could use some resurfacing. The location is great, right on the beach. We stayed in the garden room as we read that the beachside rooms were noisy due to the road traffic and the ocean. I would not have minded the ocean, but the road traffic may not have been good. I did not have any problem with the room per say. However, my wife wanted our daughter to keep her shoes on in the room at first. The carpet could have been steam cleaned. There are three locks on each door, and look pretty well used. This is a hotel I would love to own! All it really needs is to have the rooms redone with new carpet, paint, furniture, doors, and the bathrooms completely renovated. The staff does not put on a happy face for you. So, to answer your question,...For $63 it is a good deal. If you have to spend $99+ , you might want to check into a renting someone's condo on Craigslist or elsewhere! Here are my photos.

Reviews.Title: “love it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: coxfam
Reviews.Content: it seems nostalgic like what you would think of hawaii in old films. we love it... and are planning another trip in the summer of 08 we will be staying at the maui lu again . and we have booked already for our trip this year summer of 08

Reviews.Title: “Ok but needs work great locaton”
Reviews.Author: agvh
Reviews.Content: We booked through Orbitz big mistake. They charged us 3 times for a single room. When we arrived to hotel they had 3 rooms waiting for us. The credit card company then froze our credit card on thought of fraud. If you must call Orbitz you get someone in India that you can't understand and vice versa. They were useless, and stayed on hold for over 40mins while they reviewed case, in end they would tell you to wait 5-7 business days for refund. Ok Hotel, it's not the one pictured here online. The resort is not exactly a resort. We weren't expecting much, The rooms and properties are old. Have the property is condemed, and they are redoing half the property. So construction starts early. Our room was in need of upgrade. Bathrooom is very old mold around the caulking, floors are worn out, toilet feels like it will go through the floor. No AC in bathroom so very humid. The AC in the room is a small unit that during the day just can't keep up, the room is warm. it finaly will cool off during the night. The sheets are very nice and comfortable as well as the beds. The rooms lack light. Good location across the street from beach

Reviews.Title: “Dated, shabby, but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Acrylikova
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and decided to stay here based on the cost of other accommodation in this area. However, all the hotels in the area had extremely low occupancy while we were there - if we'd known we would have negotiated a lower price! We were updated to an Ocean View room, which we through was great until we realised how noisy this was going to be with the combination of the ocean and the road. The rooms in the garden section would have been much quieter - and the whole place is beautifully landscaped, so lovely to be in. The decor is dated, but you are paying low rates for proximity to the ocean and other features along the coast. You do need a car! The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly. We'd stay again, but ask for a garden room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: RobBN
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by the organization that invited me to Maui. After seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor I was more than a little concerned about this place. Now that I have been here for several days I feel it is only fair to offer some feedback. After a very long day of travel, arranging for a rental car at Kahalui, and driving at night to the Maui Lu, I was first surprised by the beautiful grounds - large property with hundreds of palm trees, flowering bouganvillia and plumeria everywhere, and a friendly staff. I was exhausted so the porter who drove his cart to my car, loaded and delivered me and my bags to my 3rd floor room was much appreciated. The room was larger than I expected, but not a luxurious accomodation. I slept well, as it is very quiet here. In the morning I found that the view from my room looked out over a gorgeous setting of palms and lawn to the waves crashing against the shore, with a volcano in the background. A stunningly beautiful pool was surrounded by more palms and manicured lawn. Is this place dated? OH YEAH. Is it shabby? A bit. But I can't say it is dirty, just old. The towels are dormitory quality thin THIN white towels, there is a gap between the window air conditioner unit and the wall that I can almost place my hand through, it looks as though it was last decorated in 1980, and the hot water takes a while (*think summer camp in Tahiti), BUT GOOD GRIEF....YOU ARE IN MAUI! So get over it and realize this is a BEACH resort and EVERYTHING is casual. You are right across the street from the beach, and if you don't like the beach, then the pool is really nice - spectacular actually. This is NOT the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton, but I have been very comfortable here. Today for lunch I stopped at the Farmer's Market down the street and have been enjoying fresh pineapple, bananas and macadamia nuts all afternoon while watching paradise outside my window. The location is great if you have a car - 5 minutes to the center of Kihei, 10 minutes to Ma'alea, 15 minutes to Kahalui, and 20 minutes to the airport. They advertise wi-fi in the lobby, but I am able to get it in my room (maybe since I am close to the lobby). There is also a refrigerator and coffee maker in the room, so you can pick up some provisions if need be. POSITIVE POINTS: Location Pool Easy parking and elevator Probably the cost (I am not paying so I don't really know) Proximity to beach Beautiful grounds Quiet The view (at least from my room - 301) Friendly staff NEGATIVE POINTS: Dated A bit shabby You MUST have a car No room service or restaurant on premises Not luxurious The adjacent building is abandonded and falling apart - a bit unpleasant to walk or drive past....maybe they will renovate it soon? Would I stay here again? Absolutely! Would I recommend this to friends? Yes - with the comments I have made above. If you must have luxury and all the ammenities, this is not the place for you. If you want a relaxing (and probably relatively inexpensive) place to stay, this may be an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: WaBackpacker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week in April during Spring Break. You would have never known it was a busy time on the island by the quiet, peacefulness of the maui lu. It was definately a budget hotel- but budget prices were also what we were paying. It beat our expectations by far. The room was very big, bed very comfortable (a hard thing to find at budget hotels/resorts these days), and housekeeping cleaned and vacuumed daily. The furnishings were older and the walls showed some age- but who cares- you are in Hawaii. We stayed in a garden room and had big windows with tons of natural light. The pool was big and pretty much empty most days-- perfect! The open-air lobby felt like a step back in time to a Hawaii that is hard pressed to be found now. While we didn't swim at the hotel's beach-- it was perfect for a sunset stroll or just relaxing by the water. The staff were very helpful. The day we checked out; our flight did not leave til 10pm- they let us keep our bags there and gave us a complimentary room to shower in at days end. If you are looking for a posh, resort style location- this is not it! This is a relaxing hotel on beautiful grounds where you will have to walk or drive to get a meal and possibly (depending on the room you book) cross the street to get to the beach. We loved it- but i think it all depends on what you are looking and willing to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: loveboys
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience Hawaii in it's natural beauty this is the place to be. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and tropical, the location is quiet and there are no extra fees-like parking costs. I am an airline employee and I refer ALL my airline friends to the Maui Lu. We stay at higher end hotels on our overnights and travel more than most people, so we appreciate a Clean, Quiet, and relaxing spot to vacation in. If you enjoy paying for parking, outrageous prices for meals, and being around crowds, then being at a resort is for you. To the manager of the Maui Lu, don't change a thing. Your place is beautiful, clean, affordable and exactly what a relaxing vacation should be. We would hang out at the private cove every night to enjoy the sunset while our boys hunted for crabs. Most of the pictures we took, for us to share with our friends, were right on the property. I believe the negative remarks are from people who want more than their willing to pay for. I hope this review is helpful for the budgeted family because it is a great property, older but clean, with a tropical feel from the grounds.Keep up the good work, keep it affordable and we look forward to staying here again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacoba
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 small children and I stayed at Maui Lu for Thanksgiving. We weren't expecting much based on the price. The hotel staff were always very friendly and helpful and the location is decent. We drove up and down the road for meals and appreciated the refrigerator in the room and use of the microwave in the lobby. Our room was the garden view. The worst part of the room was the carpet. It was old, dingy and dirty. I did not want my family to walk in the room without shoes on. The room had air conditioning, a nice sliding door in the back to open to a lanai and quiet, peaceful view. The pool was okay (too cold for us to enjoy at the time). Parking was good. If staying on Maui again I would choose a nicer hotel, but the accommodations are decent for the price. I did leave behind my prescription eyeglasses after we checked out and after calling housekeeping, they were mailed to my home in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: jp560
Reviews.Content: The pictures of this "resort" are very misleading. First of all, most of the units are not beach front and have no view of the beach. I travel about once a month or so and this is the first negative review I have felt the need to write. We were treated extremely rudely by the staff upon check in at 11:00 PM. Be careful about booking on a travel service because there were many charges we weren't told about until check in and more at check out. When we tried to talk to the manager about the charges we were told the manager would not talk to us and is too busy to be at the lobby. The outside grounds are wearing down and old. The rooms were very much sub-par. Two of the people staying in the room were bitten numerous times by bed bugs! The room had poor ventilation and the bathroom had none. There were bugs in the bathroom that was in dire need of being remodeled. When booking we were told it would be central to everything. That is only if you have a car- I would recommend looking at hotels further down kihei road for a much better location. We did not use the beach on the property one time, but rather had to rent a car to drive anytime we wanted to do something. I stayed at a resort quest property last month in waikiki and had nothing but good things to say. I was very unpleased.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MacFanLA
Reviews.Content: Okay, the Maui Lu isn't ultra modern, but it has spacious rooms, your choice of air conditioning or cross-ventilation, and a good location on the South shore, at the end of Kihei nearest the cross-island highway. The room and bath were clean, if a little rundown. The beds were excellent! Great mattresses! Amenities included a refrigerator, a coffeemaker and a safe in the room; a microwave was available in back of the reception desk, which also had coffee and tea available and a couple of computers where we printed our return boarding passes & checked email. Nice wooden walkways to the rooms, and a pleasant garden. Picnic area shaded by trees. There's a pool, although we never got around to using it, and the ocean and a sandy beach are right across the road. The staff was helpful, especially the young lady at the tour desk. She mapped places for us and told us about a restaurant we liked so well, we ate there 4 times! (The Big Wave, in Kihei). We thought the hotel was an excellent bargain and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One Star is generous”
Reviews.Author: mj_moto_johnson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aston Maui Lu for the first two days of our Maui vacation. We had one of the beach front rooms in the 400 building. I was not expecting much from the hotel, but it was truly one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. Think beat-up version of a Motel 6. Not that motel 6 is horrible, just low end - the Maui Lu was low-end and in major need of renovation. We had two rooms, both had clogged toilets, dilapidated furniture, and just an over-all run down feel. The pool was also strange in that the sides were not straight up and down, they had a weird slope which made it almost impossible to climb out of the pool without finding the steps - frankly unsafe for young children. When we arrived we immediately found we did not have enough towels in either room. When we called the front desk guessed why we were calling...duhhh fix the problem then! The location was fine - the beach and the hotel property has great potential, it is just that the facility itself is just completely run down. Anyway I would not ever recommend this hotel - ok maybe for $50, but surely not for $100 or more.

Reviews.Title: “One Horrible Night at the Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: odsjr
Reviews.Content: Aston Maui Lu Resort 17 February 2008 My wife and I stayed in this "Hotel" for one night February 2nd as I was attending a Rotary function at the Marriott Waialea. This was the most disgusting hotel room I have ever stayed in. The carpets were dirty, the bathroom fixtures, although clean were showing rust, and the furniture appeared to be from the 60's. The bed was sagging. We requested a King bed but instead received two single beds. I will not stay at this hotel again and being a Kamaaina I do travel to Maui from my home on Oahu frequently. This hotel should be razed and a new resort built to todays standards. Hopefully all Aston Hotels are better maintained, but I would be skeptical to try one after this event. I just thought the tourist should know before they ruin their vacation by staying at the Maui Lu "Resort" NOT! I will say that the staff was very courteous and responsive but that does not make up for the devastating condition of the facility. Sincerely, Oran Spotts

Reviews.Title: “Those who raved must be on crack”
Reviews.Author: sdmorge
Reviews.Content: I had a fairly short notice business trip out to Maui and the Maui Lu was the only place available in Kihei. Upon arrival, I knew why. The entrance is deceiving. When I pulled into the registration desk I thought "this isn't so bad. It's quaint and rustic" The staff was friendly. It went down hill from there. The room I stayed in was across the street. The parking lot hosts the smallest car spaces I have ever been in and it was full. I had to park across the street and cross Kihei Blvd at night, alone. It's not very well lit. When I reached my room, I cried just a bit. The room is in DESPARATE need of new carpet and new paint. The bathroom gave me the willies, I dared not step barefoot on the floor. There was a small A/C unit that I promptly set to cool, but the room never quite got comfortably cool... Probably because my front door did not adequately shut. The Maui Lu still uses the old fashioned KEYS for your room and the deadbolt barely fit into the door jam. There were traces of an old bar slide lock but the area where the lock would fit into has been long wittled away leaving about a 1" gap between the door and the door jam. I am guessing this contributed to the mass of tiny mosquito like bugs flying around. The beds were not comfortable at all. There was a wall print that was dated "1989"...I'm guessing nothing has been done to the property since then. The upstairs balcony had bubbled paint that exposed rotting wood and it was starting to fall. Read: the balcony was not 90 degrees straight, it tilted slightly to the outside. There was a small mini fridge - next to the old broken mini fridge in the room. The outdated rattan furniture had stains and grossness on the sides. For a single woman traveling alone, I did not feel safe at all. I checked out of the hotel and found a place a few miles down the road for just a few dollars more. The location has potential, but for $200/night, I would expect a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: loveMaui16
Reviews.Content: I booked the Maui Lu based on the total price of the trip. I wasn't expecting a 5 star resort by any means. If you want that, then spend your $400.00 a night on the Hilton. But being on a budget and not planning on spending my entire trip in a hotel room, I was very pleased with the Maui Lu. The room was clean with maid service daily. We called a week ahead and asked for a king bed. They told us we would have to request that when we arrived. We checked in and were surprised when they said that our request for the king was noted and that is what we got. And it was a very comfortable bed at that!! The room was on the 2nd floor but the sweetest guy loaded our luggage from the car & wouldn't let us carry a thing. The entire staff was helpful and met all of our requests. Nice size mini fridge, coffee pot, but they only provide 1 coffee packet then charge $1.00 a day. Just bring your own coffee pods like I did. They do have coffee & tea in the morning in the lobby plus a microwave & toaster. Nice pool area, just lacking a hot tub. The beach is tricky to get to if you are in the main hotel complex and not in a beach front. You have to cross the street to get to it but it is somewhat secluded and nice. All in all, our experience at the Maui Lu was very good. Older hotel but they have done a fairly good job of keeping it maintained. I would stay there again. Like I said, the purpose of my trip wasn't to spend it in a hotel room but to explore the beautiful Island again. And the staff at the Maui Lu made that possible with all their great advise on what was happening and the good spots to go for things!

Reviews.Title: “2 Stars for the 2 Dead Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: ZinGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights here on business. My room was very large and oceanfront which was great, but just very old and dirty in appearance. After my first night I awoke to two dead cockroaches on the floor (that weren't there when I went to sleep). I was in a hurry for work and left them for housekeeping to clean up. After being gone all day I found the bed had been made and the garbage taken out, but both cockroaches were still belly up on the floor - they didn't touch them. I would only recommend this hotel to people who get oceanfront rooms. The location of those rooms are across the street from the main hotel and are really right on the water. The beach is fairly vacant too, which is great. I wouldn't recommend it as it appears incredibly dirty, but probably worth it for the oceanfront rooms as they are affordable. This hotel is definitely not for everyone, but if you don't mind old hotels and are travelling on a budget, get an oceanfront room....but I guess you'll have to take the dead cockroaches out yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy what GOD left at Maui”
Reviews.Author: pinj
Reviews.Content: I am a 53 year old business man from central Indiana my wife and I have traveled all over the United States and have seen a lot of things. With that said if you have not taken a week and stayed at the Aston Maui Lu you may need to. One of the best trips I have taken, They will make you feel at home and will not interrupt your stay, The staff is great and the location is one of the best I have seen. If you need a 5 star Motel and need all the glitz and lights do not go there but if you need a rest and one of the nicest places to get it, It is there. The Maui Lu was magical. The ocean view room/lanai gave us breathtaking sunsets and an unspoiled view of the ocean. The private cove was about 30 yards from our door the grounds were impeccable. The staff was outstanding You can set on the beach in the morning and have coffee and just get your self In the mind set for a great day, There is a lot to see on Maui and a lot of great places to eat but the best is just relax and enjoy what GOD left at Maui We loved waking up in our room on the beach and falling asleep listening to the ocean waves and please do not destroy the place We will be back GOD willing, Thanks for a great stay and SHAKA

Reviews.Title: “This place gets a bad rap”
Reviews.Author: tahoejules
Reviews.Content: For the value, I really think the Maui Lu is a great place to stay. It really depends on what you want to get out of the place you stay at. If you are wanting a fancy resort with a poolside bar, this isn't the place for you (go to the Westin!). But if you want a place to sleep and storage your luggage while you are out exploring the island the Maui Lu is sufficient. When we got to the hotel, I was actually pleasantly surprised, after reading so many horrific reviews. The room is nothing fancy, but comfortable, and clean. We had a nice balcony overlooking a lawn/garden. We ddid not opt to upgrade to the ocean view rooms (which seem nice- right on the beach). My boyfriend and I (in our late 20s) were not planning on spending a lot of time in the room, and we really didn't! We are adventure types- love hiking, surfing, snorkeling, etc. So we filled our days with all those types of activities, so by the time we returned to the room we were exhausted. The great thing about staying at the Maui Lu? Location! Being in Kehei makes it easy to access all parts of the island. It is close to the airport and so many attractions. During a later part of our stay we got a hotel in Kanapali, which was wonderful, but a little bit out of the way. My biggest complaint about the Maui Lu: one of the days we were there we came back to the room around 5 to shower before dinner (we were covered in salt water and sunscreen) and i could not get any hot water. I didn't have that probelm any other time, but I was really annoyed at the moment. I hope this review helps! Think about what type of traveller you are, and if you are like me, the Maui Lu isn't so bad. The staff was really friendly and check-in/out was super easy. and they have free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ocean front room”
Reviews.Author: CalGal08
Reviews.Content: We hadnt had a proper honeymoon after we got married, so we decided to go to Maui and stay in Kihei because it is such a central place for all activities. I had read all reviews about Aston Lu before I booked and was a little afraid about how the place would be. We decided to look at a place in Lahaina after a couple of days if this didnt work out.. But we didnt need to. We had booked an ocean front room and stayed in room 409. I agree that this place is dated, does not have a restaurant and they even charge you for your coffee sachet. We did see a cockroach and a lizard outside the hotel rooms in the garden, but that is kind of expected in the tropics. But inspite of all that we loved the place. Every morning we woke up to the ocean waves and the mountain...some evenings we enjoyed the sunset. We didnt intend on staying in the room for most part of the day anyways. There are two small beaches next to the ocean front properties and they were almost private. You dont even have to cross the street to get there. We spent one whole morning (about 3 hours) on the beach by ourselves, sleeping, watching the blue sky...listening to the ocean by the coconut trees, massaging each other, relaxing. It was blissful. We also went for walks on the beach almost every night. It was truely relaxing for us. And best part is it fit our budget just right. Kihei is also a very beautiful place. Very casual, lots of craft fairs, a local farmer's market...filled with locals...you dont see as many tourists out here as Lahaina and Kaanapalli...and we actually liked that. Also from what I researched both these places are very expensive to stay at if you want an ocean front property. The beaches there are great but there are a lot of people out there. Kindda like Santa Monica beach in LA. Basically, if you are on a budget and dont mind a Motel 6/ Best Western kind of a place to stay in but would like to enjoy the privatish Hawaiin ocean, I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: pappap647
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 4 nights and they were the worse our our 16 day holiday in Hawaii. How they can call themselves a resport I don't know, they have a drinks vending machine and thats it, no snack, no restaurant, no bar. The air-con is like being in a tank, you cannot sleep with it on. The walls are paper thin, we werwe kept up 3 nights by a loud talking japanses couple thill 4 in the morning, we had to call down to send security up to ask then to keep it down. As soon as you check in, they make you sign waivers saying they will charge you if you smoke, lose your key and if you want coffee after the first free packet was also a dollar. they also charge to use the safe (even though it is nominal, this should be complimentary). The closest shop is over a mile away, the closest non-sushi restaurant is over a mile away. The rooms also needed updating, when I pulled the light switch, it came off in my hand, the taps in the bathroom were very stiff. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE.

Reviews.Title: “Great View but otherwise a Dive”
Reviews.Author: NCGReen
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate on our ocean front suite (meaning that there was a separate bedroom). While the room was very spacious, and the view was breathtaking, that's where the good part ended. The resort seemed like a ghost town, with no restaurant and no bar, and strange, shack-like, run-down houses situated on the resort property (albeit, behind the main buildings). The door to our room provided us minimal peace of mind as far as security... it looked like someone had taken a crowbar to it at some point. Inside, it was pure 80's decor, which isn't bad except that the furniture and countertops are stained and marred enough for me to think they've been there at least that long. The bathroom was awful. Soap scum on the shower walls, mildew and mold stains, old fixtures (complete with lime encrusted showerhead), a toilet that barely flushed (hold down the button for 30 seconds), and one bar of soap for the sink AND the shower (don't forget to take it into the shower with you!) Find somewhere else in Maui to stay! I did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but front desk travel agency is terrible”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Sept '07 room #102. This is form very far the best deal possible for any budget family. Room was comfortable with good beds, space and fridge. Moreover the property where the hotel is located is amazingly huge and beautifull (huge pool with palmtrees, close access to the beach, tennis court ...). Service was BEST in class and the entire team was doing everything to make the vacation as good as possible (free wifi, full laundry sce, 24/24 access to microwave, ice, coffee tea, toaster) ... VERY GOOD if we'll come back directly there if we come back to Maui. Nevertheless, do not book any trip via the travel agency located in the hotel as they are way over priced (more than 40% in our case) and more than unfriendly !!!

Reviews.Title: “you don't go on vacation to stay in your room...”
Reviews.Author: DEZZBEE
Reviews.Content: hotel is dated and rooms and furniture are pretty old. I was very hesitant about staying here prior to leaving but didnt really have a choice since my step-dad already booked the reservations. My brother and I slept in the rollaway beds they provided because there were 6 of us in a room and boy were those beds not really comfortable. But that didn't bother me as much as it normally would have since I was able to fall asleep on a pretty comfortable pillow (that they provided) and to the sounds of the waves crashing on the beach in front of our room. The unit that we were staying in (corner, beach-front in the 600 building) was pretty private. Every morning I was able to have my coffee while watching the Canoe Club get together for their rides. The private beach on the hotel is awesome! It's the perfect size for families that want to keep an eye out on their kids playing in the water while relaxing on the sand or chair or anyone that doesn't want to have to deal w/ busy beaches. The only thing that I didn't like about this place was the parking lot. Be carefule when you're trying to get out of the lot cause it's reallllllly narrow...and make sure you get back before 9pm b/c it gets full FAST once the sun goes down.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spechtus
Reviews.Content: After reading the review, got a little worried. But we loved this place the moment we got there. The room was clean, no smell, very well conditioned so it's always cool whenever you get back. The stuff was really nice and friendly. There's free internet WiFi connection near the lobby - not sure if it's theirs or if it's like that always - but I was able to use it whenever I wanted to. I'd recommend this place to people who doesn't need luxury hotel to enjoy the stay at Maui. All you need a hotel for is to sleep at night and change during the day. We spent almost all the time either swimming or exploring the island. Comparing to Travelodge in San Francisco that BTW has 3 stars, this one is a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It Too!”
Reviews.Author: KAVIKAKAVIKA
Reviews.Content: After reading all the terrible reviews, we were worried....but we were surprised how beautiful this hotel is! You get what you pay for...and we weren't disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, we were offered to upgrade (not for free) but we liked our room so much, we didn't feel we had to! Yes, it is an old hotel, but our room was clean, and our bed was very comfortable....what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Old Hawaii Experience”
Reviews.Author: honu-lover
Reviews.Content: I just needed one night, so I looked to the Maui Lu for its location and price. It is an older, meaning the way Hawaii used to be, hotel resort. You create your own fun, or book an activity at the on-site activity desk. The Maui Lu has several apartments on the beach, but for the rest of us budget travelers, you must cross South Kihei Road, which has a moderate volume of traffic. The beach across the road is very nice, and includes the Canadian totem pole monument because the Maui Lu was founded by a Canadian family. Some of the guests thought there was restaurant and bar on the property, but the internet sites are pretty clear there are none within walking distance, so that's the reason for the two star rating. Unless, you learn to ride the new Maui Bus system, the only way to get around is to have rental car anyway. The resort grounds are very large making for an interesting walk under shade trees, while the trade winds cool you off. My room was on the ground floor, by a set of outdoor wooden stairs, but I did not have any noise leak into my room, or disturb my sleep. This is a great hotel for a budget traveler, but it is over a mile to shops and restaurants down South Kihei Road at the Azeka Center.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Maui Lu!”
Reviews.Author: reezy17
Reviews.Content: We loved the Maui Lu! We booked this hotel as part of Pleasent Holidays package. I was fearful about what to expect after reading the reviews below. We entered the beautifully kept grounds to check -in and the very friendly and smiling staff told us that we had been upgraded to an ocean view room at no extra charge. There was a fridge, safe, tv, and some welcome water and coffee for us. They kept the room clean the entire time we were there, even noting our preferance of not sleeping on one of the blankets by folding it on the bed rather than making it with the bed. They were also very helpful with giving directions and answering questions. Everything was perfect for the traveler that wants to see the island rather than stay in the room and order room service. The Beach was right outside our room, we woke up and went to sleep each night to the sound of crashing waves all at a great price. This is perfect hotel for the budget conscious traveler, who wants a good place to lay their head.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Aston Lu”
Reviews.Author: isfgirl
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu was the dirtiest hotel I have ever visited. When I first arrived they put me in a room with dirty smelly carpet. When I complained they moved me to a room that didn't smell but was just as dirty. I took a towel to wipe down the bathroom floor just so I would feel comfortable taking a shower. The white towel was black from all of the dirt. I took the towel to the front desk and was promised by the desk clerk to have clean room upon my return. Not only was my room not cleaned but the maid didn't even fully make up the bed. I complained several times about the dirt but nothing changed. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: woodsfamily
Reviews.Content: Waking up to the waves and going to bed with peace and quiet was WOW! The place is ready for remodel but it was not so bad that we could not endure it. To relax from work while watching my wife and two girls play in the sand from my 20 step view from my bed was unbeatable. The staff is honest and returned my wallet that was dropped from my shorts in the parking lot. The manager was so nice and pleasant. It was would have been nice to have internet access from the room and not having to go to the front desk but t helped me stay off line and focus on relaxation. Way to go Maui LU. What a place. We will return and enjoy our stay at this place. WOW.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: sgervais
Reviews.Content: Booked with Pleasant Holidays as a package deal. My entire family went, total of 7 rooms. In three of the rooms roaches were spotted. The rooms need updated. Old curtains, bathroom floors need to be redone, and the wallpaper was peeling. The grounds were nice and open. The pool was not heated and in March it was a little to cold for the kids to swim in. No food services on site, but very close by. They do have a church on site, if you wanted to attend on Sunday. If asked to stay there again, I would have to say no. The bugs were the main issue for me, but I guess roaches can be a problem on the island due to humidity.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED The Maui LU!!!”
Reviews.Author: dianelegaspi
Reviews.Content: Though older the place was GREAT! We were right on the beach in building 500 and the view was amazing! The room was very clean and the staff very courteous. The lawns and plants were very well manicured. We met some very nice people there as well. The best part was the private beach cove which was literally steps from our room. Oh and and falling asleep to the sound of the ocean was really nice. Kihei is pretty low key not super touristy. I LOVE the Maui Lu I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nice people - dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelsonbusiness
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in one of the back rooms, not on the beach where I wanted to be. Friendly people, but room was so dirty I didn't want to walk around on the floor after my bath. The bathtub had terrible black stains in the bottom; the bathroom floor was filthy, as was the carpet. The sliding door to the patio was bolted shut, so it was impossible to get fresh air into the room. Dirt was built up on the baseboards, grimy fingerprints needed to be scrubbed off of the bathroom door and there were dead roaches in the bathroom in the morning. The coffee pot was never cleaned out and the towels were not delivered somtimes until 4 or 5 p.m. This hotel was once very nice, but has obviously fallen on bad times. Beds were so hard and lumpy and so uncomfortable that it was impossible to get a good nights sleep. Go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Nitemare...Beware”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel222
Reviews.Content: AWFUL....AWFUL..Checked in late in evening..Filthy, dirty, old furniture, stained carpeting, mold on A/C and bathroom ceiling. Door had rot on bottom.. Unsafe and unhealthy conditions. Couldn't stay another night.... Checked out in morning...Wished I would have seen these reviews before booking our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic laid-back resort”
Reviews.Author: nidwaldner
Reviews.Content: Stay was 6/12-19/07. Our first night we arrived late and stayed in one of the garden rooms, it was okay and I would have been fine staying there my entire stay but the next morning I inquired about possible upgrades and was able to upgrade to one of the ocean front rooms (more like a suite) with loft in the 400 building and it was awesome for $30 extra per night. We absolutely loved the Maui Lu and the laid back atmosphere. We enjoyed having the little beach cove and nice pool mostly to ourselves especially after we saw how crowded the pools and beaches at the large resorts were. Yes, the rooms are a little threadbare, but they were clean for the most part. For those who complain about this place I really wonder what they expected to get for the price? I LOVED that there wasn't an onsite restaurant or bar, that way I didn't feel like I was constantly being marketed to. If you want big posh resort amenities then stay at a different resort. We liked exploring different beaches everyday and the best ones are less than a 15 minute drive away in the Wailea/Makena area.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: navyman72
Reviews.Content: I have read many bad reviews about this place, but from what I saw, none of them were true. The place was a little old, but was still in good condition. The staff was very friendly and answered all my questions upon checking in. Had beautiful scenery, and a very nice pool. I would stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it”
Reviews.Author: geykhmanm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the ocean front room, it was a 2 storie loft room, everything was great, place is not the first class but what most people dont get is that you are not at vegas, you are in 100% humidity in the middle of pacific ocean. the view from the balcony was amazing, hotel staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Great aloha charm :)”
Reviews.Author: daisylind
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went in December during the off season as part of one of expedia's deals, and I was a bit worried after reading these reviews. Needless to say, it was wonderful! We got moved to a room right on the beach upon check-in, and we both had a great time. I don't need a super luxury resort, and honestly, we spent most of our time out and about and on the beach, but this place was a great home-base. The room was clean and well kept; the only critter we saw was a friendly gecko in our room. The staff was always super nice and friendly, and was always helpful. This place has such a wonderful old-hawaii charm and ambiance- not your average bland condo-esque cookie cutter hotel! If you want some charm of old-fashioned Aloha, this will not fail to please! I'd definitely stay there again! I've uploaded some pictures from our stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: doreenie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aston Maui Lu as part of our Pleasant Hawaiian package in February 2006 President's Weekend. This hotel is a 2-stars hotel and it shows. The bathroom is old/dirty...and so is the carpet. However we were out and about by 7am every morning so we basically come back to the hotel at night for bath/bed. If you just want a basic hotel and will be exploring Maui most of the time, this is decent/OK. Maui is beautiful has a whole lotta places to explore, so you shouldn't coop up in your hotel with a "view" anyways. Beware: our friends stayed at the Maui Seaside Hotel near the aiport and got bitten by bed bugs!! so stay away from that hotel! one more note, Breakfast at Kihei Cafe is da best! yum yum...try the french toast with coconut syrup!

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: Happy2Go-7
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for 2 nights. After that we were booked at The Westin in West Maui. I looked up the hotel on Trip Advisor and saw the negative reviews. Was happily surprised when we got there. The grounds are lovely. The room was near the pool so a short walk. The pool was too cold for me, but the kids liked it and my husband swam in it. It's like a large cement pond so we stayed near the steps because the kids, 3 and 5, couldn't get up the slippery angled sides to get out. It was slick everywhere and I had to keep a hand on the 3 year old when he was on the steps. The room was large and clean enough. The only roach (small) I saw was when I got up in the night and turned on the light and it quickly scurried under furniture. Hotel worked for us great because we were gone all day in Kehei and just needed somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: l-1011
Reviews.Content: Aston Maui Lu Resort was a very nice hotel. I was so scared to stay here from all the bad reviews I read. I was shocked how nice it was. The hotel is older. In fact, it was the first hotel in Maui and is listed as historical. Just think of all the famous people that stayed here. I cannot explain how happy we were with our room location, the view, and the quietness.The rooms are older looking, but our room 307 garden view was very clean. I was expecting the room to look like a dump, but was very nice. No dirt, clean beds and floors, very comfortable beds and extra pillows. We never saw any bugs or lizards like others claim. Even if you did, it's an tropical island even the nice hotels probably have lizards .You can hear the birds singing all the time in the trees. You wake up to the birds singing. The grounds are kept up very nice and palm trees everywhere. Very close to the beach from are Garden view and your very close to shops and restaurants, about 2 miles down the street. This hotel is in the perfect location, its away from all the crazy restaurants and the madness. Hotel has lots of parking. The employees were very, very nice to us. They also feed two stay cats that you will see in the garden. Im so sad, this hotel is going to be torn down soon. It's such a cool hotel. I quess it was bought out and going be made into timeshares. The only bad part of this hotel is they have regular keys and the locks are a pane. I would stay here again no problem. Just keep in mind, it's older but still kept in good condition. I almost didn't stay here with all the bad reviews, im so glade I didn't listen to these people. I would have mist out in an awesome hotel. Feel free to email, Bdadylash@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Low rent”
Reviews.Author: jonbowen
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay. Years ago we were beach side and had no complaints. This time around we stayed gardenside. This place is in desperate need for a renovation. The grounds are well kept and clean, but the rooms are getting run down. It's not brutal, yet. You get what you pay for, shop around. If your renting a car, which you really should, consider a bed and breakfast. Don't expect much, it's basic. If you want a relaxing and low key vacation stay in Kehei.

Reviews.Title: “needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: mauiwowi77
Reviews.Content: The location is perfectly fine. Having the beach across the street was very nice, although its not a great place to swim. The large grounds help for a quiet sleep. Its just a little to far from town to walk. The pool was so terribley cold and there is no gift shop or coffee shop in the vacinity, that made my stay, a big disapointment. I couldn't even get a coffee after 8:30 from the lobby (where they advertise coffee). So if you like coffee in the morning and your spouse sleeps in later than you, make sure you have the car keys, because there is nothing to eat, drink, buy or do there. Its too bad because this place could be beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “It was exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: deljyl
Reviews.Content: We had read all of the negative reviews, but we were just looking for a place by the water, no frills, and quiet. I cannot explain how happy we were with our room location, the view, and the quietness. The guests next to us were equally happy, and during our stay, we had 2 return guests in the room next to us. It's not the RItz (if you have to have "room service" a view from 12 stories up, spas, etc. etc.), but if you just want to enjoy Kihei (which is the best town), it is by far the best place to stay. The people that complain about "roaches" and "geckos" should stay at the pricey hotels. I say to them "You are on an Island!!! That's life, get ovr it". The staff there is great, you can have a BBQ sent over, there is a fridge, and WalMart/Costco are close by for your snacking and other needs. We are looking forward to hopefully getting the same room next year when we get married. I don't want to promote too much, because then we won't be able to get reservations! We LOVED this place.

Reviews.Title: “"an honest review"”
Reviews.Author: onewickedb
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I really wanted to like this hotel. Over the course of the few months between booking and our stay, I had been reading the reviews of the Maui Lu on various sites. I had convinced myself that the negative reviews were for the cheaper, "garden view" rooms and since we had booked a "deluxe ocean view" room, that we'd be o.k. I decided that I would thoroughly take pictures and notes so that I could come back & advise others like me, with no actual experience but a desire for true advice on the place. Here it goes: the positives: our room #515 was a huge loft, only paces from the beach. Every window offered an absolutely unparalleled view of the ocean, beach and opposite part of the island in the distance. In fact, every night the booming of the waves lulls you to sleep and the view from one's bed in the morning wakes you with a smile. The ocean view/front rooms have the best location that anyone could ever wish for when staying on the island. The small beach in front of these buildings is truly small, but if you walk around to the other side of the building (approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute of a walk) you have a large, generally vacant beach all to yourself. This is where the positives end. (LOCATION, VIEW & ROOM SIZE of the deluxe ocean view room). As I said before, I truly wanted to love this place. I tried to love this place, but it was filthy. Previous reviews remark on the attentiveness of the housekeeping staff. I wish I could as well. In our 6 day stay, the sheets were never changed. I put a small X on a corner of the sheets & came back each day to find the bed neatly made, but with the same sheets. Also on 3 occasions dirty hotel glasses, which I had emptied of their contents & set out for the staff to take away, were left where they were, dirty. The loft portion of the room was never vaccumed, as small dead bugs and other crumbs were apparent from check in to check out, however the bottom portion was vaccuumed daily. The couch was like something you'd find in a dump. I have dust allergies & it became immediately apparent upon sitting on the soiled and grimey thing that it was laden with dust (among who knows what else). The entire stay, I had to lay a towel over it to keep myself from erupting into fits of sneezing and watering eyes & a runny nose. There is a gecko that lives in the room as well, but he was very entertaining as he'd come out of the cracks in the walls each night & watch out over us as we watched t.v. in bed. Also, the air conditioning was filled with dust and therefore we often had to due without it. The last day of our stay, we both came down with colds and although I'd like to not blame it on our room, it is possible that the filth of it all contributed at least in part. When we first got there, I likened the room to a cabin. A little old and dirty, but not half as bad as people were saying. Upon a day into the stay, I began to see what all the fuss was about. So, in the end, if you like camping but like to sleep in a comfortable bed instead of on the hard ground, this place would work quite nicely. I mean this in all sincerity. It is filthy, but the bed is comfortable and the view is extra-ordinary. If you are like me and don't require much but clean surroundings, think twice about it. We got one of the "nicest" rooms in the place and what I've told you is the honest truth from someone with minimal expectations. There are a number of places to stay in Kehei & many of them are not costly. I would recommend checking them out, as Kehei is the best town in Maui to stay in my opinion. Good luck & I hope this helped (see photos)

Reviews.Title: “Roach problem”
Reviews.Author: a12345
Reviews.Content: The room that was given to us had a strong chemical smell, which my wife thought was of roach-killer spray. I was not sure. Then on the second day of our stay in the morning I spotted a small cockroach on the fridge. There were also a few ants here and there. We let these pass. But that night, just as I was about to go to sleep, I turned back my comforter and there was a large cockroach right on my pillow! That was the last straw! I called the main-desk. The guy manning it (it was close to 10:30 p.m.) was nice enough to offer us another room. But he would not guarantee that it would be bug-free! We moved nevertheless. The night passed without any further event. While checking out next morning, when I mentioned the events of night-before, they did give us some money back. But, as a result of our experience, we are now seriously considering buying a timeshare which are usually maintained much better!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet beach”
Reviews.Author: tripdivaleee
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive considering some of the reviews prior to going. However, they were soon dismissed. Our oceanfront room was great. Woke up and went to sleep to the sound of the waves breaking. Walked on the beach every morning for an hour. Enjoyed fresh friut and banana bread from the fruit stand just up the street. Had great neighbors and shared the gas grill when "dining in" at night. It's not the Ritz but the view and the sunsets made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value”
Reviews.Author: Esrun
Reviews.Content: We booked the Aston Maui Lu through Hotwire. It was rated as a 2-star hotel and it was exactly that. We paid $84/night, which is a fantastic value in Maui. The hotel grounds were lovely and quiet, and it was very near the beach (there are a couple of buildings on the Maui Lu property that are actually on the beach - we stayed in the main complex across the road from the beach). Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable, although not the cleanest we've ever experienced - the room was very dated and worn. We had a view from our patio of the mountain. The A/C worked great and there was a small empty refrigerator in the room (ah, cold beer!). We didn't spend much time at the hotel, our focus was being on the beach or some other activity (e.g. snorkling). We came to Maui to have fun on Maui, not hang out in our hotel room. We did not have any children with us, and for us room service is not important (there is none at the Maui Lu). We are the kind of folks who don't mind staying at a "Super 8" or "Motel 6" to save money (which we then spend on other activities). We had a great time in Maui, we took a snorkle cruise to Molokini, swam in lovely clear warm water, and basked in the sun at multiple beaches. We ate some great cuisine and had several "Maui Margaritas" at Moose McGillicuddy's in Kehei. We drove and survived "the road to Hana" (it was beautiful, and we spent several hours hanging out all alone at a waterfall/pool). We would stay at the Aston Maui Lu again without hesitation. If you are value minded, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “even on a budget this is not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: reviewer25
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, the grounds are okay, almost pretty, in fact, as long as you don't look too far to the side (at the 1970's Ozark shacks) or too close to the wood and siding damage on most buildings. Itâ€™s good to hear they are tearing down next year! Itâ€™s probably a great investment property for a complete rehab/renovation. Of course, once they redo it none of us will be able to afford the place! BYO-hairdryer, coffee pot, cleaning supplies....even a lamp shade or two to replace the dirty ones! The price is pretty good but you WILL feel upset when you get to your room. Even for just a "room to sleep in" its too dingy, old, a little moldy!!! Digging up an extra $20-30 a night will be worth your peace of mind! Trust me (my idea of comfort is a clean $40-room on mainland, I'm not just being a snob)! You won't enjoy hanging out at their pool much and you'll enjoy the beach near by even less. There were a couple old, torn up beach chairs to sit on if you dare but I don't think the hotel even put them there. When its high-tide there's barely any beach to speak of. The better beaches (and probably better hotels) in Kehei are about 10-15 minutes south of where the Maui Lu is located (Kam I-III and below are the better beaches). Two good things about the hotel...I think there staff is probably pretty good considering their working environment is not great and if you are going to drive to the west, north or if you dare venture to Hana (seriously its about 1/4 th of the way there you don't think you can handle another blind hairpin turn!) at least the Maui Lu is one of the first hotels you come to in Kehei.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: Dumbredhead
Reviews.Content: We were in hotel hell. Checked in on Thursday night and checked out Friday morning. We had prepaid for an entire week, non-refundable, and just checked it off to experience.We didn't even take our clothes off at bedtime. Your feet would stick to the carpet from filth, running streams of rust down the walls. Had no water for 2 hours. It smelled terrible. It was the kind of place people would rent by the "hour". Decent? Not in this liftime. Beds looked like and felt like they had come out of some charity organization. Outside is deceiving, their website is deceiving. DON"T BELIEVE IT. Garden view was a dirt field with a walkway through it. Looked like cattle had been graving in it.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Gregs193
Reviews.Content: The bad news is the Maui Lu is not the Four Seasons, the good news is that the Maui Lu is not the Four Seasons. We walked through the Four Seasons while on the Island and it was fabulous , However at check out time we considered the bill from the Maui Lu to be just as fabulous. Maui Lu offers a clean,well kept , really large room on Maui. The sun sets,ocean and island access are the same no matter where you stay. Although the pool could use some work the Maui Lu provided a convient base to see and enjoy the Island of Maui

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought that the Maui Lu was pretty decent. We had a good room on the 3rd floor and the ac worked extremely well...there was even cable tv. We had warm water and two rolls of toilet paper and a big shower that had warm water 24/7 except at like 8pm when everyone else was taking their baths. Some rooms had tall ceilings and coffee pots but ours didn't. **If you are going to stay at the Mui Lu i suggest that you get a room that isn't on the bottom floor because those doors don't lock automatically.**This is DEFINITELY an old hotel...the floorboards were termite eaten and had about a half an inch of space between them and there was only one elevator that collected ALOT of bugs at night. We had a garden view room that also came with a lanai>The view was great<. The hotel staff were all very friendly and the service we received was really good. When we got to the hotel, a man gave us a ride to our room and carried all 3 of our BIG FAT BAGS up the stairs by HIMSELF!! The workers there were really friendly too...when we left to go to KCC park, a carpet installer asked us if we were lost and gave us help getting to our place.Finding parking wasn't too bad but sometimes, we had to park farther away from our room than we'd like. *Still in the tiny parking lot* Keys were not card keys ... they were the old fashioned kind. Self laundry area was in a secluded area that made me feel unsafe. All in all, our room was clean and decent for the price, but expect old style charm...complete with bugs.(like roaches,moths,and lizards,and ants)

Reviews.Title: “Beware, this is the real review, look at the pictures to see”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what these other people think is decent but this place is not what I call decent. I read the reviews and thought it wouldn't be so bad. I wish someone would have told the truth so I would not have wasted my money. There are two things I can say that was decent at this place, the grounds were tropical and large and the air conditioner worked great. I have never written a review before but I thought this deserved one. I don't want to be unfair but I am going to state the truth. The room was filthy, they did make the bed everyday but they did not clean the room. They did not bother to clean the sink and counter in the bathroom everyday. The ceiling was cracked and falling, rusty pipes on the ceiling, moldy shower curtain, it was terrible. The "small beach" across the street was "No Beach" at high tide. There is a part of this hotel that is falling down and boarded up. You would be advised to spend a few extra dollars and go someplace else, I would have but I prepaid and didn't have that choice. I don't know if we just got "lucky" and had a bad room but I would not recommend taking the chance. This website is to research hotels and I hope people pay attention to this review. Again, I wish someone else would have been upfront and truthful so I could have made a different choice. You go to Maui to enjoy the island but what time you are in your room you would expect that it would be at least clean. I see other pictures and the ones with rooms look nothing like ours. The others show views which I will admit was nice but regardless this is an old hotel that needs to be taken down, it has outlived it's life, which is obvious because half of it is boarded up and falling down. No one else has mentioned this!

Reviews.Title: “not a very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from the Maui Lu yesterday. I was impressed with the staff as they were all very helpfull but I was not empressed with the grounds or my room. The beach across the street was rocky and murky and very small. If you want a very budget hotel then the Maui Lu is for you. I myself will liook elsewhere the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JenD23
Reviews.Content: Rooms: The room we had was quite large and a garden view. We asked to upgrade to an Ocean View but there was no availability at the time and in hindsight I don't think it would have been worth it. We really did not spend much time in the room except for sleeping, so being on the beach is the best ocean view. The room was clean. The bathroom could definately use an update. There was mold around the edges of the sink and the shower. There were holes in the wall where it looked like a towel bar was or a handicapped railing was. The closet door was off its hinge when we got there and house keeping did not put it back on during our week long stay. There is a small fridge in the room which was nice to have. There is only a fridge, so don't go thinking that there is a stove and microwave like some of the condo resorts have. Airconditioning worked fine. I did see a cockroach but it was outside and I never saw any bugs in the room (we were on the 3rd floor so that may have made a difference) Water: The front desk tells you that they have their own private beach cove which is true but trust me this is not an ideal swimming area. Apparently most of the rain runoff comes out in this area so the water is not as nice as the waters/beaches to the south. Save your money and get a gardenview...you are going to be at the beach everyday anyway. Activities: We did the Maui Dive shop Molokini and Turtle snorkel ($50/pp for 3 hours). This is the no frills trip but I loved it. Really, how much time can you spend looking at the same fish...save your self some money and do a shorter trip with fewer people (only about 12 on our trip out) and you must do the morning trip. Saw and swwam with several turtles which was amazing. Do the road to Hana too! Food: Best place is in Ka'anapali - Leilanis (right on the beach and the best location for a sunset dinner on the island). It is a casual place and you don't have to wait long for a table, even at sunset. The food is cheap compared to the other places nearby and the fish tacos are great...try the hula pie as well and you won't be disappointed. Best Advice!!!!!!: Pick up the book "Maui Revealed" at one of the souvenir shops. This is the best book especially if you have not been to Maui before. The book has great insider tips on places to go and very candid/honest reviews of attractions and restaurants. I truly believe that this book made our trip so much better because we would have missed out on a lot of cool things that are not in other guidebooks.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in Hawaii!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't know quite what to expect...The rooms are about the same as you would find @ Motel 6, BUT in the week we were on the island we could find Nothing that could even come close to this LOCATION!!! I mean We Were Right ON THE BEACH!!! The pictures you see were taken from our "oceanview" room w/ the Perfect little private beach to enjoy w/o the crowds! Aloha & Live with Passion!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a place to be your base while on the island, then this is the best for the money. Agree with past posta that this is old style plantation looking location. If you enjoy or demand all the things a resort has to offer then this is definately not for you. We stayed seven days and found the rooms clean, the staff friendly and willing to assist. The comments about the road is true, but many of the other resorts on this road face the same dilemia. We were upgraded to ocean front upon arrival and loved it. The grounds are clean. We would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Maui Lu!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Lu Resort on Maui from 4/03/06-4/10/06. First off, the Maui Lu was not as bad as people in the past have made it out to be, sure she old, and needs some updates, a face lift wouldn't hurt. Sure the Maui Lu isn't the Grand Wailea, but it's got great old world charm (I would have loved to see this hotel in it's prime). The landscape was VERY WELL maintianed. We stayed on the 3rd floor in the building directly behind the check-in desk (garden view room). The room was big, and had everything we needed (including a fridge and ice cold air conditioning). We had fresh towels everday and our bed was always made by the staff. We had NO complaints, the staff was friendly and helpful and the other guests were very wondeful! Parking was NOT a problem either. All the bad things I read in other people's reviews, I didn't seem to find. Iit's a good deal, and if you don't care, and have no expectations you'll do just fine. You make it what you want to make it! We enjoyed our stay! We were NOT in our room enough to care either. Ya don't go to Maui to sit in a hotel room and watch TV, or sleep, and if you do, then you have the money to waste on swanky hotel rooms anyway! The Maui Lu is in a great location in Kihei, there was a little cove of a beach directly across the street for Maui Lu guests with beach chairs, and a shower, that was nice, and there were miles of beach front to expore across the street on kihei road, around the corner was a great little sushi type resturant, and just down the street heading back into the heart of Kihei only about 3-5 mins away, were grocery stores and plenty of places to eat and shop. It's best to have a car if you stay here, or anywhere on maui for that matter! We would stay at the Maui lu again in a heart beat. I have heard rumors that it may not be around in 2007, that's a bummer! Maholo

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu Not so Bad”
Reviews.Author: rocyvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Maui Lu in February. We were able to get a fairly decent recent rate through Orbitz at the last minute...a little unsure about what to expect after reading such a wide range of reviews here. Decided to go for the superior garden view which included a large balcony and a great view of the sunrise in the morning. Looked at the ocean view rooms across the street and we actually preferred the quiet garden setting away from the busy road. There is definately a traditional Hawaiian flavour to this place unlike many of the other condos and resorts in Kihei. And yes, it is older and a little run down but the room was perfectly fine. After four days in a cabin at Wai'anapanapa State Park this was a step up for us. A clean and comforable place to relax after a day at the beach. Maid service was great and we didn't see any bugs at all. The beach at the hotel is small but there are tons of great beaches and anything else you could possibly need nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A dying resort way past it's prime.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several budget hotels and don't expect mints on the pillow or valet service but we do expect it to be clean and comfortable. What we found was a dump that was falling apart. We were booked for 7 nights but only stayed one and changed hotels. (United Vacations was very accommodating in getting a refund for the remaining nights and rebooking us in another hotel) Their idea of a beach is a 50' wide strip of sand between the rocks & the pool was so cloudy and nasty you couldn't see the bottom in the shallow end. We wondered when we checked in and they gave us an 8-1/2 by 11" sheet of paper that cautioned us to double lock all doors and windows, secure every valuable in the safe, not leave anything in the car and to report any suspicious persons. This warning was repeated in the room and in the parking lot. Although good advice, didn't give us a warm feeling. It appears that they are only keeping this place open until they can tear it down and build a new high rise.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it, I took my mum to Maui Lu June 05”
Reviews.Author: FL2divers
Reviews.Content: We loved it, I took my mum to Maui Lu June 05 and stayed 10 days, I'm a Brit living in FL, my mum comes out to stay with me 2 times a year, last year I decided to book Maui, after a lot of research, Maui Lu came tops, for location and price, I would defiantly rent a car and explore this island, (it's worth it) They say that the Aston Maui Lu Resort is a 1.5 star, because it doesn't have a restaurant or shop, we would say it was a 3 star, for location, gardens and staff, the rooms are basic but nice, comfortable bed, cable TV, toilet and bath/shower, what more do you want, for the price of $1,500 each, with Flights from Orlando, car hire for 10 days and accommodation, Great location, they up graded us to sea view, but we wanted to be across the road from the sea, near the main building. (as it was quite hard to park and/or drive out on to the main Kihei road) If you did happen to see a insect, you just call the front desk and they were there in 2 minutes, You must remember that the Hawaiian islands are tropical and you will get bugs. I do believe that there are NO snakes on any of the islands. We took a flight over to Oahu and stayed one night 3 blocks back from Waikiki beach, (wouldn't stay there for the whole holiday though) to see Pearl harbor and then went up North to the Beach that they filmed "LOST" then from there we took another flight to Hawaii the Big Island to see the volcano, (it can rain a lot there) but we still had a wonderful time, walking to the lava and taking a helicopter flight over it, it was breath taking. I would recommend Maui Lu, for price & location. If you don't want to go budget wise, then spend $3,000+ each and book one of those big hotel chains, (just remember, make the best out of what you can afford, going out for meals in Hawaii is very expensive, we wanted to get a basic room to have more money to spend else where) Oh by the way the Scuba diving is unbelievable )thank you for reading my comments

Reviews.Title: “Can you say COCKROACHES”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We believed those who said this hotel was a reasonable value for anyone who just wanted a place to stay. Do not believe it. If this hotel was in the USA mainland, it would be about $40 per night, and you would not stay there. It is in a nice setting, but NOT on the shoreline, as the pictures lead you to believe. There is a busy road between the hotel and the beaches. We found cockroaches right away. They were especially impressive when the ran across you while you were in bed. (Oh, yes, the small, hard musty bed,) We are not amused. We would never stay at this hotel again, under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, best location in Maui, not for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: LauraA1979
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Aston Lu for a 3-night stay during our two-week trip to Maui. I booked my family there to stay so they would have an affordable place for our wedding. We were given the best room of the hotel-room 217-that had an excellent view of the ocean and the mountains. The room is more expensive, but definately worth the price. It is more spacious than the other rooms and has an upstairs loft as the bedroom. Our families' rooms were not as nice, they were outdated but clean. However, their rooms were right on the ocean, closer than any other hotel in Kihei. The pool is ok, and the beach is not a great place to lounge everday. The beach is small, crowded, and without any coral reefs. Hands down, the Aston Lu has the best location in Maui, it is centrally located to all of the other towns(15 minutes from Lahaina, Paia, Wailea, Makena) and tons of restaurants. If you want to save a few bucks in Maui, stay at the Aston Lu in an oceanview or oceanfront room. But, I would not recommend it if you like resorts or plush hotels, or if you are staying in Maui for a special occasion. We left after our wedding to stay at the Maui Prince for the remainder of our honeymoon. The Maui Prince has a beautiful beach with tons of coral reefs, an excellent room, but the hotel is in a remote location. It is 15 minutes from Kihei and 40 from Lahaina.
