We would definately stay at the Aston Lu again, but not for a special occasion or for an extended period of time. But if you're going to Maui to surf, dive, or spend time exploring the island, stay at the Aston Lu so you have more $$ to spend on these activities. Believe me, Maui is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I set my standards pretty low when it comes to accommodations. I don't spend a lot of time in the room, so my criteria are that the place is clean, comfortable, and proportionately-priced. It's extremely rare that I leave anyplace with a negative comment. The description I read about Maui Lu sounded nice. And as some other reviewers indicated, it probably was quite the place...once. From what I'm reading, I think there must be a range of the types of rooms that are offered. The place is situated nicely. The small beach across the highway is lovely. Maybe the rooms on the ocean side are better than the one I had. I was in what was apparently one of the oldest buildings in the complex. The building that paralleled the one I was in looked like a newer version, but with sliding doors and a different roof line. I certainly don't care that my room was in an older building, but for the price, it was dirty. Some pretty big cobwebs, and thick dust on the higher surfaces. The pieces of motel art on the walls were so faded you couldn't tell what colors they once were. The top of the dormitory-size refrigerator was sticky and stained. Tears and burns in the blankets. The room smelled like public bathroom disinfectant. The hanging light over the table flickered, and when I touched the cord, a flash came out of the plug and the bulb burned out. In the middle of the night (not a fault of the hotel) I awoke to a screaming match in another room. Walking past another room the smell of pot was clearly discernable. A prominent building on the grounds that was probably once a restaurant or lounge is now being used by a church. That's fine, but at 7:30 in the morning the very loud country-rock church music started blasting across the gounds like a wake up call. If you choose the Maui Lu Resort (not sure where the "resort" part comes in), don't do what I did. BE SURE to ask to see a choice of rooms before you drag your luggage in!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from Maui on Feb 28th after spending a week at the Maui Liu. The hotel grounds were clean, rooms were clean and the front desk help were great! We booked this vacation only 1 month prior to leaving but had a great time. I was worried that the hotel would be a disaster according to some reviews I have read but decided to give it a try. Good thing. The hotel has a clean pool, ice cold like my one in New York, maybe too many trees cover it. You wont find snack bars, tiki huts, game rooms etc. because this is a basic hotel. Usually we are at the beach or sight seeing so the hotel doesent matter that much but its all good. I have been to Maui 3x and this was probably the best, small place not like a factory, we usually stay at 3 and 4 star hotels but 1 month before traveling those hotels were a fortune. Give it a try its GOOD

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While not a fancy place it certainly met our needs. We like to tour around stay at different beaches so have a place to bunk down for the night was great. We liked the quite atmosphere of the place it seemed to me that the parking lot was full but there were no people wandering around, probably felt the same as us. We stayed there April 2005 and are planning on staying again April 2005. I would have loved to have seen the place in the "hey day".

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Lu Resort from Jan 11-16/06. Fantastic place to stay if you are on low budget. Nothing fancy but very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. An extra special thank you to Sonny. He was particularly patient and helpful after a long journey and being very tired. The other front desk staff were just as friendly and helpful as Sonny but he stands out because of my state of mind. I had booked ocean front and that is exactly what I received. What a fantastic view. If luxury is what you are looking for then the Maui Lu isn't the place for you. If we get the opportunity to return to Maui, we will definitely be staying at the Maui Lu Resort. My hat goes off to Sonny and all the staff at the Maui Lu Resort. Good job and thank you for making our stay in Maui very pleasant and enjoyable and for playing a key role in making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tiki713
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on this website my wife and I were a little reluctant about staying at the Maui Lu. When we arrived, we were very happy with the overall look of the hotel; it was very nice and the grounds were beautiful. After checking in, we went to our room and we were definately not disappointed. Every thing was in good condition (you could tell the hotel was a little older) and looked great. During our week long stay we were very pleased with the hotel and the staff. Also, for the price of the hotel it could not be beat. Once again we were very glad we stayed at the Maui Lu, and when we come back to Maui, we will definately look to stay in the Maui Lu again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: andhope
Reviews.Content: After my husband and I stayed at the ResortQuest Islander on the Beach (formerly Aston) on Kauai, we thought we'd give Aston Maui Lu Resort on Maui a try thinking it would be just as wonderful. What a mistake. First, shame on us for not reading any reviews of this hotel before booking. We had just returned from a business trip to Singapore and had three days to spend in Maui at the end of August 2005. How bad is this hotel? We checked in, went to our room, went straight back to the front desk and checked out. Here's why: 1. The room was absolutely filthy and disgusting. Carpet had mold and stains everywhere. Beds were very uncomfortable--you could feel the springs (we paid for a King and got two doubles). Sheets had stains. Small, old, brown refridgerator in room was dirty and barely worked. Coffee maker was not even cleaned. The bathroom was just frightening -- stains and rust everywhere, tub was definitely not clean, toilet looked like it was about to fall apart. 2. The sliding glass doors in the room did not have a security door pole and the latch was broken. This is a major security problem. The curtains covering these doors did not close all the way. Anyone walking by our patio could see right into the room because the curtains did not completely close. 3. We had an oceanfront room but there was no beach to walk on and this was not a swimming area. 4. Very rude front desk service. There was one lady there (Hawaiian with very long hair) with a lackadaisical and condescending attitude. When checking out, we were not nasty or rude to her at all. We politely explained what we found in the room and that we didn't feel safe staying there. She didn't offer any apologies, didn't offer to change our room, and didn't even offer to not charge us the cancellation fee. When my husband asked that we not be charged this fee because of the room conditions, she gave him a nasty look and said "This is our policy". Well, okay, but how about offering us a different room??? What confuses me the most about this hotel is that according to some of the reviews, some people had a wonderful experience and a very nice room (even oceanfront) while most experienced substandard service and conditions. Our experience was so unpleasant that we do not have a desire to visit Maui again. Jason and Andrea Raleigh, NC

Reviews.Title: “Wished I Was Here In It's Prime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Lu for a week. We were in the upper garden section. Although the Hotel has seen better days, I'm sure in it's prime, it was a four star hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We found no problems with the bed or anything else in the room. We also thought the pool was cool being the shape of Maui. I personally found the Maui Lu Charming even though it's worn and old. I just wish we were here when it was a new Hotel. We were so taken by the place that we tried to find out about the history of the hotel. Spoke to some of the staff,the manager and even went to the library. They were all very nice & helpful. I read in some of the reviews that the Hotel is to be destoryed in 2007. I hope that whatever is replacing the Maui Lu has it's old traditions and Hawaiian Flavor of the original. I don't know if we can get back to the Maui Lu before it's gone. Is there someway we can definitely find out what's going to become of the Maui Lu and it's properties? Anyway if you want some place really fancy and crowded with lots of people go to a expensive hotel. If you want a peaceful, clean , comfortable and simple place with old Hawaiian flavor try the Maui Lu.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but what a mattress”
Reviews.Author: FLgardener
Reviews.Content: We stopped overnight here on our way to Kauai. I could have lived with the age of the place except for the mattress. It was the kind that tips to one side if your partner weighs more than you do, condemning you to a night of clawing your way back to your own side of the bed. We changed to the Marriott for the return trip and were far more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great undeveloped beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to find the Aston Maui Lu as kept as well as it was. We kept food in our fridge and cleaned up after ourselves to reduce the possiblity of attracting ants etc. and had no problems whatsoever. The property has seen better days in terms of structural upkeep, however salt air and tropical climate accelerates rust and rot, so were not suprised to see both. As the property is slated for redevelopment, improvments are not likely to be made to the exisiting structures. The room and linens were clean and spacious, came with an iron and board. Hairdryers and pool towels were available at the front desk, as was coffee and tea in the am. The gardens were lovely - lots of palms of course and flowering shrubs, birds and the resident cats. The in room fridge was big enough to hold lunch and breakfast materials and lots of water etc. The morning paper delivered to our room was a nice touch, and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. The road between the beach access was not as busy as we had expected from previous reviews and we found crossing it uneventful - the drivers are courteous if you make your intentions known. We did experience smoke drifting in to our room from neighbours who smoked, but it was only a mild annoyance and we closed the door, briefly. I don't see how this would be any different at any property at any price. Of note is the fact that all beaches in Hawaii are public access, no matter how swanky the hotel fronting it. So go ahead and save your money on the lux accommodations and enjoy the beaches in front of other people's condos! We felt the value was great and spent very little time in the room anyway. The beach in front of the Maui Lu is one of the nicest we walked and ran on. It goes for miles with little development and is clean and beautiful. Great place all around for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the bad rap”
Reviews.Author: Ciklone
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews on this site, we were nervous about our stay earlier this month and had determined that if it was "that bad," we would find another hotel. It is NOT luxury by any means, but it is affordable and allowed us to spend more $$ out doing things. After all, who goes to Maui to sit in a hotel room?! We saw 2 termites in our bathroom but no roaches, ants, etc. We had a room with 2 double beds and should have requested a King, but we did not. The staff was truly the best and gave us restaurant tips, directions, and answered any other questions we had. They remembered us by room # and were very friendly. The walk across the street to the beach is not an issue and the beach is really quite nice with some great snorkeling. The Maui Lu has been sold and will be torn down in 2007. While its time has probably come, it is still a good bargain for now.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the reviews I read, we were nervous about staying 10 nights at this place, but I must admit we were completely satisfied and would stay again. We were there over New Years 05-06. We had a garden view room (on the end and on the top floor) which was clean. Understand clean does not mean NEW. If you are looking for the resort vacation with shops, restaraunts, lounges, a variety of stuff for KIDS to do, etc., you're going to have to open your wallet and stay at the Hyatt or similar. If you just need a decent place to sleep you should be fine here. There are plenty of restaraunts, bars, and shops a short drive away, and the beach across the street is great. All the staff was very pleasant and helpful (24 hrs a day). We saw no cockroaches, lizards, spiders, or evidence thereof in our room the entire stay. We had a mini fridge, safe ($1.50/day), iron, ironing board, and some great Kona coffee every morning (at the front desk). And FYI, since this is an economy stay, you might also be renting the economy car...don't - spend the dough and get a jeep wrangler or convertible. A vehicle is a must on Maui and you'll spend a lot of time in it, so get something you can really enjoy the scenery and weather with!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was just "Okay".”
Reviews.Author: ProudToBeCanadian
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu is an older resort that has not been maintained over the years. I was looking forward to playing tennis, but I was disappointed to see that the net was drooping half way down and there was no fence enclosing the tennis courts. The pool starts at 4 feet deep so it's not suitable for younger children. There is complimentary coffee and tea served in the lobby every morning. On the coffee table, there is only one microwave and toaster for all the guests to share. The toaster handle was broken. It fell off at one point and we had to reattach it to continue to use it. Despite all the negatives, there are a lot of positive features about the resort. The staff were very friendly and helpful to us. It is a very peaceful and quiet place to stay. We just needed to walk across Kihei road to get to the beach. Within a 5-10 minute drive, we could go to Foodland, Star Market, restaurants and shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your vacation by staying at this hotel. Its not worth for even leaving for free. I had booked for 3 nights, got out second day and found better place. - Full of Mold smell - Ants - Bath Tub very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maui Lu has an absolutely wonderfully helpful staff filled with Aloha. Grounds are beautiful & resort is centrally located to get to all parts of the island. A terrific bargain for your dollar. After reading all the reviews on Trip Advisor we opted to upgrade on the ocean side of extremely busy S. Kihei Road. What a mistake! You are right on the road & if you are from a big city with traffic noise you'll love it. Being country mice, we could not sleep the first night at all. Traffic noise NEVER eased up. Not even between 1am & 4am. We did what everyone told us not to do & begged for nice quiet rooms on the other side of the road on the main grounds of the third floor. We thought this was a much BETTER room! Absolutely zero traffic noise. Peaceful, quiet & a view of Haleakala. Only had a couple of pet peeves. While we were on the 3rd floor & in non-smoking rooms the floors below us were smoking rooms. At various times the puffers would light up their cancer sticks & their annoying stench would waft up to our belcony forcing us inside our room. Another thing not advertised by the chambers of commerce on the islands is that there are numerous norway rats. These are wide spread thoughout many lodging facilities on all the islands. Most keep them under some kind of control. At the Maui Lu they were living in the palm trees off our balcony. Told the desk about it & they cut some of the palm fronds so the rats could not go from the trees to the room balconies but they did not kill the rats. We saw them every morning & evening for 9 days. (Actually the town of Kihei had a bubonic plague epidemic from rats in the 1800s. Most of the people living in town were Chinese field workers. Other island folk burnt the whole town down with the workers still in it!) The Maui Lu facility is suffering from both termite & dry rot damage. (Also saw 1 dying cockroach under a chair in the room). They recently sold to a company that will raze the entire resort & construct time shares as soon as they get the necessary permits. So far the sale has not affected the staff's attitude & they are great folks. Would stay here again but don't think it will exist for very much longer into the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hate it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Man, the hotel is bad. I rather stay at local motels. Very dirty and it's not a great building at all. The only good thing is the beach across the street where it's not crowded. But, you can go to that beach even you stay at other hotels. Not recommend it at all. It's probably ok just for 1 night stay. Don't stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquiltiy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip took us to the islands in February of 2005. We have never been to Hawaii. When we come back we will stay here at the Maui Lu Resort. This is miss named because it is not a resort but a retreat. The accomadations are basic and there are places close by to meet all of your needs. You do need a car, but there is a local bus to take you places if you want. We looked for something that felt Hawaiian. If you want glitz and glamour you will not be happy staying here. If you want to feel the islands as they are meant to be then this is your place. We were able to face the ocean and whale watching and sunsets are unbelieveable! The service is very good and the staff is very helpful Mahalo.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu is like camping inside.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfreind and I stayed there and it wasn't as bad as i expected, I was weirded out by the strange black peppar like specks in the bathroom, that (rained down, over time: over the coarse of the day.) They fell from the bathroom window sill. I later theorized that this was some kind of insect repellant product. Being from a background of camping, I slept well. I didnt see those flying roaches people were speaking of. The coffee was decent and strong, although there was no food service at all there. You can toast bread, muffins and what not, if you have them. We ate out for breakfast. Ice was filtered and tasted clean, but the ice bucket was a tupperware-type deal. The sliding door lock was striped but the bottom knob worked. We could have used a pole thing to brace door, but there were none. Tv worked, shower curtain was nasty, but just call and they will change it, Not quite like some places i have been, but in Maui you have to see everything there is to see, and there is not much time for the room anyway,so go for it. I give this experience{ Motel 7.} Some where between 6 and 8. Nice and spacious grounds, IT needs renovation and the fire extingwishers had no service card.

Reviews.Title: “Pick your room wisely if staying here !”
Reviews.Author: Brandon806
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Lu for two days back in June. We spent the week before down at the Grand Wailea. For those that have ever stayed at the GW would know, leaving it is never a happy time. OMG, that place is amazing (and crazy expensive, of course). When we got to the â€˜Lu, I was prepared for the worst, but being budget travelers by nature we didnâ€™t expect much. First off, we stayed in the 500 building with the closest room to the ocean. Most of their rooms are located back by the â€œmain officeâ€�, which is 100 yards or so back from a very busy road. I would not recommend staying anywhere back there unless you want a long walk to the â€œbeachâ€� and playing a fun game of haole Frogger trying to cross that road. The ocean-front room we stayed at had seen better days, as most of the reviews here will also mention. Nice size living room area with an older mini fridge and a vaulted upper bed room, which really makes the room seem more like a condo. Nice little lanai with a fantastic view. This end unit room (#514, if I remember right), is literally less than 15 yards to the sea. The view alone made up for any other negatives that the Maui Lu had. The bathroom is small, but it did the job. The TV was also older (everything is older, really) but has basic cable. Overall Iâ€™d recommend this place for anyone on a budget who isnâ€™t expecting the Hilton. Just donâ€™t stay in any of those back buildings, unless you only want to hang out at the pool. We passed on that, WAY too much other things to see. Whatever room you go with, in whichever hotel you pick, it should only be treated as a â€œbase campâ€�. Youâ€™ve got stuff to see and do, get out there! Go horseback riding. Go snorkeling at Molokini Crater, Black Rock, Honolua Bay and Aquarium. Wake up at 4am and go catch the sunrise on Haleakala, then ride bikes back down from the summit. Pack up a cooler and hit the Hana highway, and take the detour down to the Blue Pool, words could not do it justice, you must see it. Spend all day trying to get a parking spot on Front Street in Lahaina. Hey, even this was fun, itâ€™s Maui!. Or just kick back and relax at Big Beach. If money is NOT an issue, then stay at the Grand Wailea, itâ€™s worth it. But Iâ€™ll save that review for their page at Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Landscaping, Great location”
Reviews.Author: faceyoulike
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, room was very cute, but a bit run down. Vaulted ceilings on the upstairs beachfront units, great view of the beach, but everything needs painting. Great breeze from ocean didnt need AC in the daytime

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the dirty armpit of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were there with my whole familly and our stay at that hotel was absoluely disgusting! Right when we got there guests were warned about theft going on in the facility so right there there was a red flag and so we paid extra for a safe deposit key for our belongings. The room had 3 locks just to be safe but we were still scared. We wanted to changed hotels completely but we decided to suck it up and forget all the hassel. First of all, everything is OLD and dirty. I will never ever stay at this hotel again. Luckily it gave us more motivation to leave our hotel and tour most of the island. The staff there is rude as can be. There was this one lady ( she had long long hair) she was always rude to me and even when we had to borrow towels they acted like we were going to steal them. Their service is horrible. The only persone who was helpful was the concierge and she wasn't even part of the Maui Lu! Nothing came with the room either. If you needed anything, you had to request it from the front desk. I would never ever recommend this "motel" to nobody. We figured since it was an Aston that it wouldn't be that bad but this was the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii808Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is worn down with roaches and termites in the rooms. But, the location is good and the room is big. So, you get you what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “great place, terrible female staff at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for staying on your budget. Good size room had refrigerator, large bed and ample lighting. It also had a great full size mirror in the room which hotels forget to include. The bathroom was small and it did need to be redone. My boyfriend and I were never in the room though because there was so much to do in maui. We left every morning by 6:30 am and explored on our own...I would mobve to Maui in a second!! There was one female staff member who was obnoxious and although our room was prepaid for, after argueing with me about how she has never heard of my travel agency she still charged my credit card for the 3 nights we were there. She was very arrogant and this is my only complaint about this hotel. It is now almost the end of July and my travel agency is still trying to straighten out the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You can hope for the best but you will get what you pay for when staying at this hotel. The rooms are decent except for the shower leaking and the out of date decor and patio. Also, don't let the description of beach front property fool you. If you are staying in the main are of rooms expect a 5 to 10 minute walk to the run down beach across the street. The people were friendly enough except for a couple of exceptions but I guess that you can have that anywhere. If your goal is to not spend much time in the room and get out and see the island it is perfect. If you are looking for a real resort I would suggest moving down the island to Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Thank god we stayed one night!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Maui for vacation, and needed a place to stay the night that was cheap before heading to where we continued our stay. Upon arrival, the Maui Lu looked nice, and clean. Decent for the price, $99 a night. (Maybe we should have tried the other hotel for $4 more) We checked in and the staff was very friendly, and directed us on how everything worked eventhough we were there only one night. When we got in our room, we were very suprised. The whole room was run down. Looking at the outside, you would think it would have been updated. Our room had 2 double beds, when we requested and paid in full for a King bed. Everything in the room was brown. A mini fridge acted as a night stand. The beds were horribly uncomfortable. Our bathroom loooked disgusting, we refused to even take a bath, and limited out showers because of this. (Later in the night I found about 50 mini ants around the sink). And our "garden View" consisted of a fence with a bush. Our room was right next to the maids closet, so you could constantly hear the door shutting, and noises from the dryers. The only good thing about this "resort" was the pool, it was amazing. Very nice, eventhough we didnt find out where the pool was until after we checked out. And also, the access to the beaches in Kihei. After our day we went to the Cliff's Edge in Huelo Point, and I recommend that to anyone. The Maui Lu is run down, and not worth the money. We had a friend of the owner's of the Cliffs Edge who wouldv'e let us stay a night at his Beach House for the price of the Maui Lu. Too bad we didn't know before we made our reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Steve163
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Maui Lu, given some of the reviews I read, but after some assurances by management, I took the risk... especially since I had gotten an Entertainment Card rate of $95 a night for the oceanfront room. It was, very simply, perfect for my needs. The room was spotless, complete with great a/c, fridge, coffee maker, hair dryer, etc. Shower power was great too... a must. The ability to open the sliding doors and walk a few feet down to the beach, with its perfect views, was fantastic... much better than staying at a fancy and pricier hotel and having to take an elevator, then hike to the beach. I'm told that a lot of the negativity about Maui Lu refers to the older section on the other side of the road, and that's probably the case. I truly had no problems with the room, the staff, or the parking (yes, I had to park across the street much of the time... not a big deal)... and I highly recommend the place as one of the best deals on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For only receiving 1 1/2 stars on numerous websites, my girlfriend and I were extremely suprised! We reserved a standard room, but once we got to the check in desk we upgraded to an oceanfront suite. It was so worth it!!! I am sure that if we would have stayed in a standard room I would have given this hotel a lower rating. The bad thing about the standard rooms is that you have to cross the major highway to get to the beach where the oceanfront suites are. The suite was great, it had two separate rooms. It was more like a condo. Both rooms were huge!! The living area had a couch, table, armoire w/tv, sliding glass door to balcony and a small kitchinette w/silverware, sink & refrigerator. The two rooms were seperated by french doors. The bedroom was just as nice and big. It had its own sliding glass door to its own balcony, big bed, armoire w/tv and dresser. The bathroom was a good size with normal amenities. The beaches were more like little coves. At high tide a lot of the beach area would dissapear. Overall we were very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Had the time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Lu resort last September for 9 days. I had read the reviews before our trip and I was a little scared. We stayed in an ocean view room, and when we arrived I was glad we did upgrade. I had been to Maui before so I was more interested in a clean place to shower and sleep than luxury accommodations. I wanted to spend our money doing the activities that people come to Maui enjoy like dining out, shopping, cruses, snorkleing ect. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. My husband and I got married on the Maui Lu resort grounds right outside our room with the view of the ocean behind us. Now let me tell you about the staff...we had no idea where to go to get our marriage license, the staff gave us a printed map and set up our appointment, we had no minister to perform our ceremony, the staff set us up with the most wonderful minister in the world named Jesse, people who were also staying at the hotel came out and watched our ceremony, the grounds caretaker stopped what he was doing and he became our videotographer with great excitement, another couple who was staying there became our photographers. In our room I saw no sign of falling wallpaper or stains, our room was clean...after reading the review I was looking for these things. What I did see was geckos on the walls...but I thought they were real cute and was not bothered by them at all. The only bad thing I have to say about the Maui Lu is about the parking lot by the ocean view rooms...bad bad...bad, very narrow, very awkward very packed after 5pm. People shared that it is far from everything, it is my opinion that you should have a form of transportation no matter where you stay in Maui...Kehei is central to just about everywhere so go ahead and take a small drive and see what's out there...no big deal. My husband and I plan to go back to Maui again in the next year or so, and would have no problem at all staying at the Maui Lu again. If you have high expectations and want a place that is luxurious maybe the Maui Lu is not for you, but if you are more interested in saving a few dollars to do the things that the island of Maui has to offer the Maui Lu might just be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Aston Maui Lu is a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two years ago in July my girlfriend and I stayed at the Maui Lu Plantation style hotel in Kihei. It was our first time on the island. We read several books before traveling, including Maui Revealed and Fromers guide to Maui. I highly recommend the Maui Revealed book. It describes just about everything you need to know before you go, including restaurants, lodgings, and the sites you'll want to visit. We chose the Maui Lu even though some of the reviews were less complimentary. The Maui Lu is not the Hyatt. It is a quiet, comfortable relaxing hotel that is centrally located to just about anything on the island. What we found was a jewel. We selected a room facing the ocean for just a little more than the garden view rooms. The room was plain but clean and comfortable with a small refrigerator and two full size beds. We wanted a Queen, but those rooms were taken. The view from the Lanai was amazing with the ocean only 20 yards from our back door. The Maui Lu has a huge pool but at the time of our visit no hot tub. If your going to stay in the ocean front or side rooms, I would select the 2nd floor for more privacy. The staff was warm and friendly and kind. They exude the feeling of Aloha. The Maui Lu has a small cove, but is adjacent to a nice beach with plenty of space for stretching out for some sun. We often went into Kihei for coffee and the basics necessities. I recommend packing light and bring a big suit case and buying what you need there. The prices are pretty good and believe it or not, Hawaii has better hawaiian clothes than the mainland. If you plan any activities, a Luau is a must. The Royal Hawaiian Luau is usually sold out, so book your Luau before you go. We attended the Hyatt Regency Luau. Get there a hour before it starts for a great seat, otherwise sit in the back. The Hyatt has beautiful gardens and plenty to enjoy. We also attended Tony and Tina's Wedding, a theater production where you are a guest in a classic New York Bronx style ethnic wedding. That was so much fun. Skip the Dinner cruise out of Lahaina. Its a photo opportunity and ok food on a crowded boat, pricey and just ok.. Do consider a sail cruise to Molokini for snorlking and sunning. If you decide to drive around the island, splurge for a convertible or Jeep. While everyone drove the road to Hana we took the less traveled route around the other side of the island. The views were incredible. There are little artist communities open to the public and they enjoy talking about their work. Before we left, My girlfriend and I married on Maui Lu's little cove. That was two years ago. We still dream of revisiting Maui, and the magic you feel while there.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel.... expect an old hotel but a cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably the BOMB in the 60's and if your not ultra picky about your accomidations then it'll work just fine for you. Hawaii is all about relaxing and if all you need is a place to sleep then this place will do just fine. Two of their buildings are just yards from the water and during whale season (Winter - especially Feburary) you can see them jumping right from your bed. This place is all about LOW prices and as far as being close to the water it's as good as any. If you want to hang at the nice resorts you can take a 5 min car ride to Wailau and walk the beachfront sidewalk there. Or you can spend at least an extra $100 a night plus and stay in Wailau or another place with beautiful pools and such. Bottom line - spend less here or at the Quality Inn Kihei or spend (hundreds) much more somewhere else. Note: If you can get a 'local' to rent a room for you, anywhere there, you can save a bundle!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at The Maui Lu, the employees made the stay great. I felt like I became part of their family, they have such great attitudes, and I often noticed them doing more for guests then expected. The place is also beautifull. If it were up to me I would give them a big star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Absolutely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With not cheap rate, I got my worst experience in my life. I was upgraded to an "ocean view" room, but when we arrived the building, we were shocked by the dirty area and how old the building was! The room was worth less than what I paid and the most concern was the safety. I felt horrible and couldn't fall in sleep. The "ocean view" was a lie, people will not swim at this beach and it looks so ugly. The service was rude, or you can say no service at all. Location was not good, far away from nice beach, far away from airport, far away from the shopping town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Maui! Hated Maui Lu!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at alot of hotels and this by far is the absolute worse! First of all, the people running the Maui Lu were the rudest and non caring of any we came across on our visit there. They never smiled not one time or acted like they even cared we chose them out of all the other resorts in Maui. This was my first time to Hawaii and the rudeness will always be remembered. We had an ocean front delux room overlooking the small beach area. The view was great! The room was not. The carpet and chairs were all stained and looked nasty. The bathroom was very small and old looking. Our first night there someone sliced two holes in the canvas of our rented jeep in the parking lot right next to the room. We called the resort to report it and they acted like it was no big deal and told us to call the police to report it. We are just fortuate we didn't have anything in the jeep the vandals could steal. Wow....what hospitality! I have seen all the bad reviews...wish I had seen them before we went...and the place is still awful. I guess Aston doesn't care about the Maui Lu or the people running it. We would never stay there again and will definately not recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am about to take my second trip to Maui and have booked the same Ocean Front room as last October! I am surprised at how mixed the reviews are and I can only assume the negative ones were written by peeps expecting more than a 2 star! The hotel rooms themselves were fine... clean, matching and holding everything you need including coffee maker, hairdryer, fridge etc! I saw no bugs and I was not one bit disappointed knowing beforehand that I was going to a 2 star establishment! The views and the ability to walk straight from my hotel room to the private coves below makes this best kept secret the the wonder it is! Yes you need a car! yes you should upgrade to a beachfront and yes, perhaps the bad reviews should keep on coming so the prices stay as low as they are!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 days in March. The wall paper was coming off the walls, paint was terrible, The carpets were so dirty we wore our shoes in the room. The windows and door glass had not been cleaned for some time. I've stayed in some cheep and bad hotels but this tops them all and it was NOT cheep at $200 per night for our bill. We have stayed at other Aston hotels and I certainly hope the other properties don't fall to this disrepair. This place is a discrace to the Aston name.

Reviews.Title: “South Pacific revisited”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in Feb 2005. I had lived in American Samoa in the 60's, and was looking for a place that would remind me of Samoa. Maui Lu did just that. Even the disappointment of not having the promised coffee in the room, was tempered by my walk to the open-air lobby every morning through a "jungle trail". The people could not have been nicer. The room, though old and in need of some minor repairs, was comfortable; the view was tropical and quaint. Everything was slow-paced and relaxing. The sunsets on the beach were beautiful! Mahalo and Aloha, everyone at Maui Lu!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu - What a View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maui Lu from January 17th - 19th as a last minute add on to a trip to Oahu. I had booked the resort through ----. After reading the online reviews, I tried to change the reservation but because my trip was within a week of booking, I couldn't make the change. So off to the Maui Lu I went. Here's the scoop as I experienced it. I stayed in an oceanfront room where the beach seemed to be about 20-30 feet from the lanai/porch area. PERFECT!!!! I love the beach and it was absolutely soothing to be lulled to sleep by the waves each night. The room was clean, safe and the parking was free. The location is on S. Kihei Road which is a main road that leads to all conveniences and other sightseeing spots. You definitely need a car. The staff was ABSOLUTELY accommodating, friendly and professional. One in particular stands out. Hats off to Barbara!!! Maui Lu, you need to clone her. Would I return? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui and had a great time. The Maui Lu was not as bad as some of the reviewers stated. It is long past it's prime (which was in the 70's). It's grounds are very nice, but the hotel itself is a little run down. The property is already sold,and they are going to build a new resort on this property which is probably why they don't do any upgrades to the Maui Lu. We did not find any bugs in the room and it was cleaned daily.We did not spend a great deal of time at the hotel(snorkeling,beaches and sightseeing) but it was a fine place to crash for the nights we were there. If your used to 4 or 5 star resorts and don't leave the hotel at all during the day, then i'm sure you won't like it there. But if you need a nice clean place to sleep after a busy day doing a lot of fun stuff, then the Maui Lu is the perfect place. We would go back here for the $ we paid,for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Old but quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This is a great place to stay if you don't expect too much. It is rundown but the bed was comfortable, room was cleaned every day and the staff were friendly and helpful. Coffee in AM at the desk. The grounds are great to walk around in and relax. Pool is great although not heated. Beware of the traffic crossing to the beach area. Small private beach coves with easy access to the beach parks if you want bigger. Free parking!!! Great Japanese restaurant next door!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep and shower............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you dont expect much, this is the place for you. Very old complex. Needs some serious update. I kinda knew what I was booking myself into. I just needed a place to relax for a night. But it was one of the worst nights I ever had. Appearance was the first thing I noticed. Awful. I mean, its an old place, so what else is there to expect. Dingy carpet, smell of urine, moldy air conditioning, dirty walls and etc. Thank god I booked just one night. I would never return even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “ONE TIME MAUI VISITOR AFTER THE MAUI LU”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place should have been torn down and rebuilt years ago, from the ants crawling everywhere in the room to the filthy carpets I will never recomend this place to anyone! The maid service is something else, as they clean or spot clean on their own time and don't give a darn about the person staying in the rooms schedule! No restraunt within walking distance and No services of any kind except a local newspaper and a Pop machine!! I WOULDN'T EVER RECOMENND THIS TO ANYONE (EVEN ON A BUDGET) If I ever go back to Maui I won't stay here! Pretty much left a bad taaste in my mouth for a vacation resort! Next time give me Mexico anyday!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Checked Out! Awful!”
Reviews.Author: JeepGal
Reviews.Content: We probably hold the record for checking out of the Maui Lu in less then 12 hours after checking in. We booked it on the internet and booked oceanfront which we did get, but this was our first trip to Maui and expected so much more. The room was so old and dingy. When we checked in they gave us a notice explaining that they had recently had a problem with break ins and to make sure everything was locked. We ended up at the Maui Marriott which was much more our speed. (Who cares what it costs, you only live once!)

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu - OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone! My boyfriend and I just got back from Maui earlier this week. The Maui Lu wasn't the greatest hotel I've stayed at but I didn't want to let that ruin a perfectly great trip. We had an awesome time in Maui and after two days, we didn't care that the table was dirty or that the carpet was dingy or that the air conditioning unit looked moldy. We had a couple of visitors, namely, a huge spider and a roach but what do you expect on a tropical island? What was good: our room was always cleaned every day, got a newspaper delived everyday, we always had plenty of towels, soaps and shampoos. It was relatively quiet, too. The activities desk was very accomodating and friendly. In addition, we had a redeye back to LA and Maui Lu was happy to hold our luggages and bags. Even refrigerate the banana bread and chocolates we bought until it was time to go to the airport. The best part was when they gave us a hospitality room to shower - we were worried we'd have to fly home all sandy and sticky from our day at the beach. Take home message: hotel is OK (I've stayed at much worse) and the staff is nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Happy and relieved!”
Reviews.Author: AlfredMama
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in on 9/8/04 to the Maui Lu, my husband and I were relieved to find our room spacious, clean and in a perfect location overlooking the ocean. The reviews of this hotel are all over the board. We were in the 400 building, which faces nothing but open ocean. The second floor has a better view, with no one walking by your room. Overall, the resort needs routine maintenance and our room needed the carpet and couch/chairs replaced. However, the room was clean with all amenities replaced as needed daily. They provide a coffeemaker and the first morning's coffee packet, and a refrigerator. The icemaker is a short walk to the 600 building. The 400 building has 2 beaches on either side, one a small cove and the other is walkable. The resort provides lounge chairs on the beach and a table and 2 chairs on your balcony. You definitely need a car in this area, as it is on a very busy road which is actually dangerous to walk on or even cross from the ocean side to the inner resort area where the pool is. The pool is large and deep (10'), but not heated - the ocean was actually warmer. But it is a lovely pool area. Apparently the pool is being refurbished in October. The parking lot for the 400, 500 & 600 buildings is extremely small and parking spaces are very tight. We stayed for 9 nights and did get a space all but 2 - the alternate lot is just across the street - not a big deal. The staff at the resort was very nice. We got this room at a great price through the Entertainment Book and it was a great value. I would recommend it to anyone not too fussy and we would stay there again. The trade winds were pretty constant in the afternoon and we got a bit tired of them; however, it would've been quite hot otherwise. We only saw rooms for the 400 building, but the 400 & 500 buildings have the best location if you're looking for oceanfront. The hotel is away from the crowded town of Kihei and we were happier to be away from that, yet be only a 5 minute drive to get whatever supplies were needed or to go get a meal or go to a public beach. All in all, we were very happy with the Maui Lu. Once this resort gets a facelift, the prices will soar; the grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here without a car”
Reviews.Author: ToniVitanza
Reviews.Content: I'm a flight attendant who has stayed at two different Aston properties in Waikiki numerous times on pleasure trips with family and friends. This was our first trip to Maui, and, despite the negative comments on this site, I booked a stay at the Maui Lu due to our positive experiences with Aston. It is also true, as another reviewer notes, that different visitors can see the same property on the same day and form entirely different opinions. We are very, very experienced travelers, very flexible and relatively undemanding, so I generally do not let negative comments -- especially from those I suspect are spoiled or inexperienced travelers -- sway me. Do not, under any circumstances, book a room at this resort unless you intend to rent a car. We made that mistake and felt totally stranded. My husband and our 11-year-old were especially listless, as the property is near absolutely NOTHING in terms of food, shopping or entertainment. It would help a great deal if the management would put out a bowl of fruit or a plate of breakfast pastries next to the coffee in the lobby. That way you could get something in your stomach before the cab ride into civilization. The grounds of this property are just beautiful, and you are cheating yourself not to walk outside and sit near the large trees and watch the birds. Yes, the rooms are older and in need of a little effort, but once that effort is made many of us will not be able to afford to stay there. I found ours clean and safe and adequate to our basic needs (sleeping and showering), and that is what I demand for whatever I pay, which at the Maui Lu was very little. I never travel with the hope of rooming at a property so wonderful that I need never leave it, as many do. That kind of attitude is hardly travel; it is insulation, and I can get that at home. I would stay at the Maui Lu again in a heartbeat, but I would rent a car with the money I saved on the room. There is a gorgeous and relatively secluded beach right across the street; we called it the Totem Pole beach as we could not ascertain its proper name, and it is very special. Do not miss eating at Stella's; it is an elegant but relaxed restaurant decorated with memorabilia from the Grateful Dead. Both breakfast and dinner were wonderful there. We also splurged with a dinner at Roy's. We wouldn't have been so profligate if we'd paid much more for our room. You don't go to Maui for the room, now, do you?

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: caligoodgirl2000
Reviews.Content: Where to I begin? The room was smelly, the carpet was disgusting, the bathroom was horrible. We of course complained and was given an 'upgraded' room. Admittantly, this was a much better room. Apparantly, there is an old building (where our first room was) and a newer building (where the 'upgrade' was). Be sure to get the upgraded room if you have to stay here. personally, I wouldn't recommend it for my dog. The oceanview rooms located right on the beach were much nicer though.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back in an instant”
Reviews.Author: DavidDavidDavid
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Maui Lu at the end of June, 2004, and had a wonderful time. We were apprehensive because of the bad reviews we read about it on tripadvisor and other websites and even tried (unsuccessfully) to switch to a different hotel before we arrived. We're glad we didn't succeed. We immediately upgraded to two rooms with an ocean view (second floor, building 400) with a gorgeous panorama of the ocean and the coastline of Maui just 25 feet away outside our windows. Spectacular. The rooms are not luxurious, but everything was clean and worked, the grounds are beautiful (we saw very little boarded-up), and the staff was quite friendly. We'd go back in an instant. It's puzzling how people can have such different experiences at the same hotel or resort.

Reviews.Title: “if you don't expect much, this is for you”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got the room on priceline for $70/night with taxes and fees. Considering the price, one shouldn't expect much. It's worth it though to pay a few extra bucks to stay somewhere closer to town. Had to drive at least 10 minutes before any restaurants/shops. Also rooms are totally delapitated and not insulated. Toilet kept refilling all night. Could hear birds chirping all night through the walls. Only half the buildings are used - other half are shut down. Staff was very nice and pleasant. If you want a dirt cheap room on Maui and you don't care about being close to anything and don't need a room with much more than a bed and a bathroom that feels like it's outdoors, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people :) Calvary Chapel on ground :) no Kitchen :(”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want just a place to sleep and a pool is fine, the Maui Lu is quite ok. However you gotta eat out. We first wanted to leave this place, because there was no Kitchen and the room was kinda dark. Especially when traveling with a baby you need a kitchen. The people were nice and tried to help, but it was spring break and other places were much more expensive, so we stayed. There is a microwave in the lobby that did the job with boiling water. Caution, never heat water in a microwave w/o putting a spoon in the bottle. I didn't take care for that and burned my hand, when I took out a bottle and the water suddenly started to boil. Across a very busy street is a very tiny strech of beach. You gotta drive down the road a few miles for nice beaches. If you go down South Kihei Road keep straight into the dead end. There's a nice hidden beach. Markus

Reviews.Title: “Some Things Never Change”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here on our honeymoon trip. Checking in, the people were quite nice, the grounds at night looked beautiful. Hungy, we found that the restaurant was non-operational.In our itinerary we were told we would get an oceanview room. What we got instead was in the back of the complex. A large family stayed upstairs and the only thing that separated their feet from our view was probably a rug and plywood, because we were staring at raw exposed wood beams. Cobwebs were everywhere. Peeling paint & wallpaper, resplendent with penciled graffiti from some child no doubt. The bathroom was moldy, the toilets rusted, & the mirror had lost half of it's glazing.In love, we tried to make due, UNTIL, we pulled the very old & faded bedspread back to see the sheets were dirty!!! My husband immediately phoned Astin headquarters and secured us a room down Kehei Road in a nice 1 bedroom condo at the Kama'ole Sands. This was 14 years ago and reading the reviews it doesn't look like a lot has changed...unless you actually secure a beachfront room (the 400 Bldg?)....maybe. Here's a link to a picture of the place: Oh and watch out for the Kama'ole Sands. We stayed in a 2 bdr in '95 and the place was the pits & rundown. Since the condo's are owned individually it can be hit or miss whether you get a kept up place or not.

Reviews.Title: “OK Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK it was a bit of a dump but not as bad as some things I read, at least I was prepared for the worse. We only stayed on night until we could get into our condo. It was a bit dirty, we ordered an extra blanket to cover the couch and sit on. I have never seen so much rain, the roof didn't leak. We were in the "Honymoon Suite" on the corner of the building next to the beach, room had an OK loft where the bed was located and the sheets seemed to be clean. People working there were very nice, if your on a budget and just need a place to put your head I guess it would be OK.

Reviews.Title: “As part of a package...I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Maui Lu twice and am going again in late April. If I were piecing my trip together myself, I think I would choose other accomodation. But I've stayed there as part of an Expedia package that included air, car and the Maui Lu for five nights...all for $625. And I stayed on the ocean side. I wouldn't stay in the 'Garden' side but the ocean side is very nice. The place is old, but it reminds me of 'old style' Hawaii, like the episode of The Brady Bunch when they went to Hawaii...it has that feel. It's relaxed and the beach is right there for morning runs and walks and a killer sunset. Nothing within walking distance, but what is unless you're in Lahina? I feel like I've had great value at the Maui Lu as part of an Expedia package.

Reviews.Title: “You'll regret it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in October 2003. I was apprehensive after having read such mixed reviews, but since we were traveling with my in-laws we chose a lower budget hotel to keep costs down. When we arrived they gave us rooms in the back building facing a browning and patchy lawn. The room was dark and so depressing that we decided to upgrade to the partial ocean view - so much for a budget choice! Unfortunately, turned out the partial ocean view also included more than a partial view of the parking lot for one room. The reviews were right on - the place felt old and unkept, the paint was peeling, the linen old and dated, and although the lawns were mowed, the plants were overgrown and in desperate need of weeding. There was nothing within walking distance, the beach was not only too small and close to the road to be considered remote or private, but it was muddy and windy . The service was just ok, the rooms were cleaned ok, but bottom line - I had a pit in my stomach knowing that I could have chosen something better for my in laws for the priced we ended up paying.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the warning-We stayed elsewhere but visited just to be sure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife booked us elsewhere based on TA review and we're glad she did. We just had to see the place though. I was put off by the aged appearence, the boarded-up building on the property and the wooden walkways with some boards we would have replaced at least 5 years ago if they had been on our deck.I will say that the grounds are lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great vintage place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha. I've stayed at the Maui Lu 3 times & won't stay anywhere else. Feels like the old unspoiled Maui. 28 well maintained acres, great views, wonderful staff. Takes me away from the hussle & bustle of the rest of Maui. Hope it remains the same forever.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only difference between the Maui Lu and a transient hotel in Gary Indiana is the palm trees and the price, at least in Gary they wouldn't have the nerve to charge $200.00 for a room that featured different and interesting insects, mold, fungus and tatoo-ed locals in the adjoining room throwing a beer bash. The so-called beach is the size of a bed and the property is located so far into the leeward side of the bay that I expected jimmy hoffa's body to float up. Spend an extra $100 a night at a four star hotel in Makena, like the Prince.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four and stayed one week in March, 2003. Due to the reviews we didn't have high expectations but we wanted to spend most of our time and money sight seeing. We were pleasantly suprised during our stay. The staff are very friendly, the rooms spotlessly clean. The grounds are well manicured and spacious. We stayed off the beach and enjoyed being close to the pool. It is only a 2 minute walk to the ocean and the private beach for Maui Lu guests. The fact is that this is an older resort, so many things are not as updated as the newer hotels. The pool isn't heated, the restaurant was closed down, the handle came off in the shower, and the indoor outdoor carpeting around the pool needs replacing. However, if you are on a budget and would rather spend your money on more fun things, the Maui Lu is a clean, relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maui great Maui Lu just ok”
Reviews.Author: danoisking
Reviews.Content: We just loved Maui. Maui Lu had some good points and some bad. First the good. We saw whales from the lawn in front of our room everyday. We stayed in the 500 building, which is the middle building on the beach. We were downstairs (smoking). You could watch the sunset or whales from upstairs balcony. I don't think you could see much from the 600 building, except the room closest to the beach. The location is excellent. We drove to the volcano summit in 1 3/4 hours. 15 to 25 minutes to beaches in wailia. 35 to 40 mins to lahaina. The room was fairly clean and no mold. I checked. Room 506 second from beach.The staff was pleasent and helpful,especially Ed. Now the bad. Place is old and it shows. The maids didn't show up till 3:30 some days. They changed sheets and a quik once over, in and out in 15 mins. I looked at the cabins in back and you could look right through, no privacy. The mattresses in our room were cheap, old and hard. The ice machine was down for 3 days. I had to go across the street to the office to get it. You don't want to swim here at all. The water is dirty. All in all I wouldn't stay here again, but it wasn't to bad. If you are going to stay here, you should stay in the 500 building (ocean view) or upgrade to 400(ocean front) You can call aston to request this and they will try to accomidate you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were blessed to choose a "Deluxe Ocean View" room with a spectacular view of the little beach access and surrounding ocean! The room was quite comfortable with a great little balcony complete with a little table and chairs. It was wonderful to be able to look out our big windows and sliding glass doors to see palm trees and ocean waves! We delighted in the cleanliness and excellent service given us everyday! A newspaper was given daily. It was very quiet and peaceful there. A perfect location with lots of places to eat and visit just down the street. We couldn't have asked for better for the reasonable price! The Imburgias Langley, WA.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Aston Maui Lu is a great place to stay if you are on a budget. My family and I stayed in a room with an ocean view. We opened our door onto a private beach. This hotel is not fancy but the access to the beach made up for its shortcomings. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and courteous. We did have a gecko visit occassionally which we didn't mind at all. I think this is unique to Hawaii. Overall, enjoyed the view and beach access. We were able to spend money elsewhere like luau's and excursions.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of the old Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Maui Lu in June 2003. We knew it to be an older hotel, with the advantage of spacious and lovely grounds, beautifully kept. It was inexpensive and good value. The Maui Lu consists of several buildings. Three buildings are 2-storey oceanfront, beside two small sandy coves. Two of these buildings have marvellous ocean and sunset views. It would be lovely to stay there right by the water with the waves lapping all night long.The views from the third building (which I think was the 600 block) are obscured. Our room (in one of the buildings across the road on the land side in the 300 block ) was large, clean and obviously recently renovated with new curtains etc. The views from the buildings in this part of the resort have only garden views but they are pleasant. There are some cottages on the landward side that looked in need of renovation. The reviews for this resort are very mixed. Pehaps it depends on which building one stays in, and what one's expectations are. I would certainly recommend it for people who want good value and lots of space. I would personally rather stay beside their lovely garden than be right on the main road in Kihei looking out on to parking lots and overhead wires. If you are looking for the last word in luxury go spend lots of money in Wailea. If you can get one of the Maui Lu's oceanfront rooms it would be heaven. But be sure to ask for one with views. P.S. Canadians will be interested to see the totem pole and the memorial to Vancouver on the Maui Lu's beach

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: BrummieMoneypenny
Reviews.Content: I've just arrived in Honolulu after spending a great 4 day break at the Maui Lu. I was originally staying at the Banana Bungalow hostel but personally it was too far from the nearest beach (4 miles) and without having transport just not good for me. So after checking what was available I moved down to Kihei. THis was the best thing I could have done. The Maui Lu is at the top end of the road that leads into Kihei so at the quieter end. Across the road from a lovely beach the location was perfect. It's a 20 minute walk into town so my one piece of advice is to get a car. Its cheap and so quite on the island it's well worth it to give you the freedom. A taxi into town costs $5 each way and there isn't public transport to speak of. The room was fine no complaints about that. Two double beds a good size balcony over looking nice gardens and a decent size bathroom. All of which were kept clean. I was on the second floor overlooking the pool and the gardens. As the front looks onto the pool you won't be awaken by kids diving in (not that there were any but you could during summer) It may look a little tired from the outside as most of the hotel is wooden so therefore there will be peeling of paint etc but nothing too major. The staff here were very friendly and would help me as much as they could as they knew I was a female travelling on her own. Joanie on the Pleasant Excursions desk is fab - she was really helpful and suggested I go whale watching. Around $30 to be picked up and dropped off and for a 2 1/2 trip out on the Prince Kuhio. It was great well worth it in my opinion. I'm in Honolulu now and wish I could have stayed at the Maui Lu abit longer as I just loved it, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only had two weeks notice before my step-daughter and I had to be in Maui. Being the peak season hotel selections were few. The Maui Lu's description on the internet sounded as though it was what we needed. However, we checked out after three days and moved into a one-bedroom condo, that cost less and had more! Check around for other places. This one is over-priced for what you get and even if you don't stay in your room all the time you still want a clean bathroom and clean sheets. Our bathroom had mold and mildew growing on the ceiling, in the corners and the pillows smelled!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: PhineasFogg1899
Reviews.Content: We drove by this hotel and had a look at it! No one in this world would make me check in at this hotel. It looked like it has been deserted for years! This is NO GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu not bad, get out and see Maui”
Reviews.Author: DCGirl
Reviews.Content: Aston Maui Lu offered clean reasonably priced motel-style accomodations on a high priced island. It's got a central location that was good for exploring both sides of Maui or taking a snorkel boat during a short stay. For just over $80 we got an oceanview second floor unit with a separate loft sleeping area and a TV on both floors. The bathroom was clean, the desk people were nice, there was some traffic noise from Kihei Road. From our balcony we overlooked trees of a public beachside park and could see the surf lapping the sand. There is a beautiful old palm grove on the lawn in front, but it's not a 4 star fantasy honeymoon place. If you want to pay $250 a night and be charged $12 per drink in a big, expensive, sterile resort, do not stay here. If you plan to surf, hike, snorkel and see the sights of beautiful Maui, eat mixed plate or saimin, and come back tired every night, Maui Lu may fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Lu is not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Maui Lu was built in the 60's but is maintained quite well. The grounds are well kept, the pool is clean and the staff goes out of their way to help you. We stayed in a ground floor room and found it not to be a bad place to be. This is not a high dollar resort so don't expect the ambiance and ammenities. Nice place to spend the night so you can take advantage of Maui,s hospitality. Just make sure you have a car, there is no mass transit available on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Not a recommended site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was old and worn. Bathroom had hair on floor. sink and tub enclosure cracked. Tub did not drain. Ants infested the room.

Reviews.Title: “loved the maui lu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were doing Maui on a budget but didn't feel the price at the Maui Lu was any less than other places. We arrived late in the evening, tired and hungry. My first impression of the room was not good, before our bags were unloaded from our car we wanted a different room. None available until next morning. The bathroom and bedding were very clean, but the room wasn't fashionable. The view the next morning made me very happy we hadn't left. We felt like we had a private beach which was about 50' from our sliding door. We stayed there 5 days then spent 7 days in honollulu, all 7 in Ohau we cried because we weren't at the Maui Lu even though our room there was quite luxurious. Never saw a bug at the Lu, the people were wonderful and very helpful. I want to go there NOW.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also were skeptical from some of the bad reviews we read online about the Maui Lu being run down, bug infested & poor service so we contacted Astons management about our concerns, I guess trying to get a better handle on things, the reply was in a down to earth way of saying you be the judge, give us a try. It was our 20th anniversary and we were more interested being in and doing things in Maui than spending alot of time sitting in a hotel but after we were done with the activities it would be nice to come back to a comfortable clean room to relax. I'll tell you, we were very excited and pleased, the tall old palm trees and exotic flowers were beautiful, the grounds are very well kept, the staff was extremely helpful and polite we stayed in the ocean front section, upper floor, which is separate from the lobby/garden view area which made it even better, there is parking between the ocean front and ocean view units but if it gets full they have more parking just a short walk away. I would recommend the ocean front units especially the upper floor, the sunsets were truly remarkable with an island on each side in plain view, We were about 50 feet away from the shore and could hear the waves sliding up the shoreline all night, not a bug insight but the geckos were kind of cute, they like to stalk around the light fixtures outside, their about 3 to 5 inches long and I am assuming thats why the bugs aren't there. The room was very clean with coffee maker and hair dryer, the rug was a little worn and you can see its been painted a few times but thats not gonna keep us from staying there next time we visit Maui. The Maui Lu is located just north of Kiehi's hustle and bustle of restaurants and shopping areas you can snorkel right out in front but there's much better snorkeling areas in some of the beaches. We truely give the Maui Lu 2 big thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “room needs some freshening up, but view was awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, Jane was very helpfull, forgot the guys name, but he was helpfull too. We up graded to an ocean view room. The view was awesome to say the least. The room needed new carpeting, and some paint, but it was clean. The beds were comfortable, and the maid brought fresh towels every day. Never saw any bugs, but did see a lizard. The swimming pool was nice, but the water was cold. Had to look real hard to find the burned out buildings everyone seemed so concerned about. Why they don't knock them down I don't know, maybe it's just their lay back attitude. Like the guy in the motel 6 commercials says when you turn out the lights all hotel rooms look the same. I would stay there again. Maui is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too am one that read all the reviews before going to stay at the Maui Lu. I was worried as to what we might find there. My wife and I go to Hawaii a couple of times a year and try to save as much as possible on the accomodations. I thought we had gotten a great price when I booked our stay there. We stayed on the top floor of the Maui Lu with the garden view. Yes the room was run down and the buildings are in need of repair, but we were not there to spend our entire time in the room. The only insects that we found in the room at all was some of the small sugar ants in the bathroom, but let me tell you I have stayed at a number of 4 and 5 star places in Hawaii and have had the same thing in the rooms. I talked with some of the staff about the place needing repairs and found out the Aston is fight with the state of Hawaii about doing any repairs, seem they aways want to keep things as is instead of improving... The grounds are very very beautiful at the Maui Lu and is a quite palce to stay. So if you are looking for all the plush then stay away, if you are looking for a place that is quite with beautiful grounds and some place to rest at night then stay in the Maui Lu...

Reviews.Title: “avoid the bottom floors”
Reviews.Author: cntower
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Maui Lu with much trepidation this past summer. We were going to be staying five nights at the Westin Maui on points but needed to stay somewhere for two nights prior. Not wanting to spend a lot of money especially since we got in so late the first night we decided to check the Maui Lu out. Overall I have to say it was as bad as people say but also acceptable for the price as long as you can get it dirt cheap. There was definitely the bad. Like the first night I was biten by ants all night and was itchy all over. We asked to be moved to another room the next day and they were very accomodating. We ended up on the second floor and although I did see ants in the bathroom at least they did not journey into the bedroom. The rooms are definitely worn and tired but for budget accomodations and budget prices it was acceptable. The pool was so murky that you cannot see your feet and if you dropped something in it and tried to retrieve it good luck. My husband joked that there are bodies in there that have not been found. The pool did not seem dirty just very murky. I think the filtration system needs repair like the rest of the resort. They do offer nice towels for the pool at the activities centre. What I did like about the Maui Lu besides the location is its spacious well kept grounds. With two kids it gave them plenty of room to roam. I also liked the microwave, breakfast tables and free coffee that they gave in the mornings. Our family would go to the local supermarket and come back with breakfast items and eat them on the tables sipping good coffee and enjoying the ocean view. So would I stay here again? Only if they can gurantee that I will not get a ground floor room and I got a super cheap rate. I would however stay at the Westin Maui on points.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy, but it's decent. Like everyone else, I was pretty scared when I read the reviews...especially the one where the guy said the hotel caught on fire. The building that was boarded up was NOT the one that guests stay in, so you don't have to worry about that. The room was always clean and we really liked the location. I did not find any bugs, stains, insects, or anything of that sort in the room. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a decent/average place to stay...especially if you're on a budget becuase I would rather stay in an average hotel and use my extra money to do fun activities such as parasailing, jet skiing, snorkling, etc, than stay at an expensive hotel and have to limit my activities. I would stay at the Maui Lu again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read all the bad reviews here and figured it was just from people who expected too much from a bargain hotel. Boy was I wrong. I recently stayed here for 4 nights. Upon arrival, I upgraded to the oceanfront rooms as recommended. I was on the ground floor and the hotel gave me this paper warning of possible thefts/attacks by keeping the door open. I also had to sign a form saying since I did not want to pay to use the safe the hotel was not responsible for any thefts that occurred. Not the best way to start out. I drove to the ocean building and had trouble fitting my midsize car in the parking spots. When I got to the room, I was in shock. The sliding door opened onto the ocean, but the door did not seal completely allowing both cockroaches and centipedes to crawl unobstructed into the room. I actually had to ask the housekeeper to remove the cockroches trapped between the screen and the door. When the centipede came into the room, I had to contact the front desk. They were accomodating and moved me to the next floor up. The doors sealed, and not as many bugs in the room. The bottoms of the furniture did look like they were rotting, and the wall paper was peeling off the walls. There was also mold in the shower area. I realize this is a tropical location, and these things are actually common place, but I take many business trips to Maui and they just seemed to really stand out at this hotel. I have stayed at other bargain hotels here without these types of warnings, or problems. While the price was definitely tempting, I know I will not stay here again, until they do some serious cleaning and renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Maui Lu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Maui Lu Resort during the week of September 6. We stayed at the garden view room and yes: it is simple and the carpet was full of stains and the mattress too. I tried not to look closely. But the sheets and towels were clean, and the bathroom too. The staff was really friendly. We didn't spend a lot of time inside our room, because when we were at the hotel we would stay outside. The grounds were really well kept and we could always smell the trees with the white flowers (I don't know it's name). We used the pool which was clean and mostly only for us.
